<p>And thenke it is a guerdoun hir to serve</p>
<p>A thousand-fold more than he can deserve.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">820</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">118. And of that word took hede Troilus,</p>
<p>And thoughte anoon what folye he was inne,</p>
<p>And how that sooth him seyde Pandarus,</p>
<p>That for to sleen him-self mighte he not winne,</p>
<p>But bothe doon unmanhod and a sinne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">825</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And of his deeth his lady nought to wyte;</p>
<p>For of his wo, god woot, she knew ful lyte.</p>
<p class="stanza">119. And with that thought he gan ful sore syke,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'allas! what is me best to do?'</p>
<p>To whom Pandare answerde, 'if thee lyke,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">830</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">The best is that thou telle me thy wo;</p>
<p>And have my trouthe, but thou it finde so,</p>
<p>I be thy bote, or that it be ful longe,</p>
<p>To peces do me drawe, and sithen honge!'</p>
<p class="stanza">120. 'Ye, so thou seyst,' quod Troilus tho, 'allas!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">835</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But, god wot, it is not the rather so;</p>
<p>Ful hard were it to helpen in this cas,</p>
<p>For wel finde I that Fortune is my fo,</p>
<p>Ne alle the men that ryden conne or go</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page180">{180}</span>May of hir cruel wheel the harm
    withstonde;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">840</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For, as hir list, she pleyeth with free and bonde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">121. Quod Pandarus, 'than blamestow Fortune</p>
<p>For thou art wrooth, ye, now at erst I see;</p>
<p>Wostow nat wel that Fortune is commune</p>
<p>To every maner wight in som degree?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">845</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And yet thou hast this comfort, lo, pardee!</p>
<p>That, as <a href="#TINL846" id="TIL846" class="pginternal">hir Ioyes moten over-goon</a>,</p>
<p>So mote hir sorwes passen everichoon.</p>
<p class="stanza">122. <a href="#TINL848" id="TIL848" class="pginternal">For if hir wheel</a> stinte any-thing to
    torne,</p>
<p>Than cessed she Fortune anoon to be:</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">850</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Now, sith hir wheel by no wey may soiorne,</p>
<p>What wostow if hir mutabilitee</p>
<p>Right as thy-selven list, wol doon by thee,</p>
<p>Or that she be not fer fro thyn helpinge?</p>
<p>Paraunter, thou hast cause for to singe!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">855</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">123. And therfor wostow what I thee beseche?</p>
<p>Lat be thy wo and turning to the grounde;</p>
<p>For who-so list have helping of his leche,</p>
<p>To him bihoveth first unwrye his wounde.</p>
<p>To Cerberus in helle ay be I bounde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">860</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Were it for my suster, al thy sorwe,</p>
<p>By my wil, she sholde al be thyn to-morwe.</p>
<p class="stanza">124. Loke up, I seye, and tel me what she is</p>
<p>Anoon, that I may goon aboute thy nede;</p>
<p>Knowe ich hir ought? for my love, tel me this;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">865</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Than wolde I hopen rather for to spede.'</p>
<p>Tho gan the veyne of Troilus to blede,</p>
<p>For he was hit, and wex al reed for shame;</p>
<p>'A ha!' quod Pandare, 'here biginneth game!'</p>
<p class="stanza">125. And with that word he gan him for to shake,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">870</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde, 'theef, thou shalt hir name telle.'</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page181">{181}</span>But tho gan sely Troilus for to quake</p>
<p>As though men sholde han lad him in-to helle,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'allas! of al my wo the welle,</p>
<p>Than is my swete fo called Criseyde!'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">875</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And wel nigh with the word for fere he deyde.</p>
<p class="stanza">126. And whan that Pandare herde hir name nevene,</p>
<p>Lord, he was glad, and seyde, 'freend so dere,</p>
<p>Now fare a-right, for Ioves name in hevene,</p>
<p>Love hath biset the wel, be of good chere;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">880</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For of good name and wysdom and manere</p>
<p>She hath y-nough, and eek of gentilesse;</p>
<p>If she be fayr, thow wost thy-self, I gesse.</p>
<p class="stanza">127. Ne I never saw a more bountevous</p>
<p>Of hir estat, ne a gladder, ne of speche</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">885</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A freendlier, ne a more gracious</p>
<p>For to do wel, ne lasse hadde nede to seche</p>
<p>What for to doon; and <a href="#TINL887" id="TIL887" class="pginternal">al this bet to eche</a>,</p>
<p>In honour, to as fer as she may strecche,</p>
<p>A kinges herte semeth by hires a wrecche.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">890</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">128. <a href="#TINL890" id="TIL890" class="pginternal">And for-thy loke </a>of good comfort
    thou be;</p>
<p>For certeinly, the firste poynt is this</p>
<p>Of noble corage and wel ordeynè,</p>
<p>A man to have pees with him-self, y-wis;</p>
<p>So oughtest thou, for nought but good it is</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">895</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To loven wel, and in a worthy place;</p>
<p>Thee oughte not to clepe it hap, but grace.</p>
<p class="stanza">129. And also thenk, and ther-with glade thee,</p>
<p>That sith thy lady vertuous is al,</p>
<p>So folweth it that ther is som pitee</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">900</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Amonges alle thise othere in general;</p>
<p>And for-thy see that thou, in special,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page182">{182}</span>Requere nought that is ayein hir name;</p>
<p>For vertue streccheth not him-self to shame.</p>
<p class="stanza">130. But wel is me that ever I was born,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">905</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thou biset art in so good a place;</p>
<p>For by my trouthe, in love I dorste have sworn,</p>
<p>Thee sholde never han tid thus fayr a grace;</p>
<p>And wostow why? for thou were wont to chace</p>
<p>At love in scorn, and for despyt him calle</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">910</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">"Seynt Idiot, lord of thise foles alle."</p>
<p class="stanza">131. How often hastow maad thy nyce Iapes,</p>
<p>And seyd, that loves servants everichone</p>
<p>Of nycetee ben verray goddes apes;</p>
<p>And some wolde monche hir mete alone,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">915</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ligging a-bedde, and make hem for to grone;</p>
<p>And som, thou seydest, hadde a <a href="#TINL916" id="TIL916" class="pginternal">blaunche fevere</a>,</p>
<p>And preydest god he sholde never kevere!</p>
<p class="stanza">132. And some of hem toke on hem, for the colde,</p>
<p>More than y-nough, so seydestow ful ofte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">920</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And some han feyned ofte tyme, and tolde</p>
<p>How that they wake, whan they slepen softe;</p>
<p>And thus they wolde han brought hem-self a-lofte,</p>
<p>And nathelees were under at the laste;</p>
<p>Thus seydestow, and Iapedest ful faste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">925</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">133. Yet seydestow, that, for the more part,</p>
<p>These loveres wolden speke in general,</p>
<p>And thoughten that it was a siker art,</p>
<p>For fayling, for to assayen over-al.</p>
<p>Now may I iape of thee, if that I shal!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">930</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But nathelees, though that I sholde deye,</p>
<p>That thou art noon of tho, that dorste I seye.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page183">{183}</span>134. Now <a href="#TINL932" id="TIL932" class="pginternal">beet</a> thy brest, and sey to god of love,</p>
<p>"Thy grace, lord! for now I me repente</p>
<p>If I mis spak, for now my-self I love:"</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">935</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Thus sey with al thyn herte in good entente.'</p>
<p>Quod Troilus, 'a! lord! I me consente,</p>
<p>And pray to thee my Iapes thou foryive,</p>
<p>And I shal never-more whyl I live.'</p>
<p class="stanza">135. 'Thow seyst wel,' quod Pandare, 'and now I hope</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">940</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thou the goddes wraththe hast al apesed;</p>
<p>And sithen thou hast wepen many a drope,</p>
<p>And seyd swich thing wher-with thy god is plesed,</p>
<p>Now wolde never god but thou were esed;</p>
<p>And think wel, she of whom rist al thy wo</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">945</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Here-after may thy comfort been al-so.</p>
<p class="stanza">136. For thilke ground, that bereth the wedes wikke,</p>
<p>Bereth eek thise holsom herbes, as ful ofte</p>
<p>Next the foule netle, rough and thikke,</p>
<p>The rose waxeth swote and smothe and softe;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">950</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And next the valey is the hil a-lofte;</p>
<p>And next the derke night the glade morwe;</p>
<p>And also Ioye is next the fyn of sorwe.</p>
<p class="stanza">137. Now loke that atempre be thy brydel,</p>
<p>And, for the beste, ay suffre to the tyde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">955</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or elles al our labour is on ydel;</p>
<p>He <a href="#TINL956" id="TIL956" class="pginternal">hasteth wel</a> that wysly can abyde;</p>
<p>Be diligent, and trewe, and ay wel hyde.</p>
<p>Be lusty, free, persevere in thy servyse,</p>
<p>And al is wel, if thou werke in this wyse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">960</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">138. But he that parted is in every place</p>
<p>Is no-wher hool, as writen clerkes wyse;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page184">{184}</span>What wonder is, though swich oon have no
    grace?</p>
<p>Eek wostow how it fareth of som servyse?</p>
<p><a href="#TINL964" id="TIL964" class="pginternal">As plaunte a tre or herbe</a>, in sondry wyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">965</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And on the morwe pulle it up as blyve,</p>
<p>No wonder is, though it may never thryve.</p>
<p class="stanza">139. And sith that god of love hath thee bistowed</p>
<p>In place digne un-to thy worthinesse,</p>
<p>Stond faste, for to <a href="#TINL969" id="TIL969" class="pginternal">good port hastow rowed</a>;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">970</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And of thy-self, for any hevinesse,</p>
<p>Hope alwey wel; for, but-if drerinesse</p>
<p>Or over-haste our bothe labour shende,</p>
<p>I hope of this to maken a good ende.</p>
<p class="stanza">140. And wostow why I am the lasse a-fered</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">975</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of this matere with my nece trete?</p>
<p>For this have I herd seyd of wyse y-lered,</p>
<p>"Was never man ne <a href="#TINL977" id="TIL977" class="pginternal">woman</a> yet bigete</p>
<p>That was unapt to suffren loves hete</p>
<p>Celestial, or elles love of kinde;"</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">980</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For-thy som grace I hope in hir to finde.</p>
<p class="stanza">141. And for to speke of hir in special,</p>
<p>Hir beautee to bithinken and hir youthe,</p>
<p>It sit hir nought to be celestial</p>
<p>As yet, though that hir liste bothe and couthe;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">985</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But trewely, it sete hir wel right nouthe</p>
<p>A worthy knight to loven and cheryce,</p>
<p>And but she do, I holde it for a vyce.</p>
<p class="stanza">142. Wherfore I am, and wol be, ay redy</p>
<p>To peyne me to do yow this servyse;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">990</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For bothe yow to plese thus hope I</p>
<p>Her-afterward; for ye beth bothe wyse,</p>
<p>And conne it counseyl kepe in swich a wyse,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page185">{185}</span>That no man shal the wyser of it be;</p>
<p>And so we may be gladed alle three.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">995</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">143. And, by my trouthe, I have right now of thee</p>
<p>A good conceyt in my wit, as I gesse,</p>
<p>And what it is, I wol now that thou see.</p>
<p>I thenke, sith that love, of his goodnesse,</p>
<p>Hath thee converted out of wikkednesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1000</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thou shalt be the beste <a href="#TINL1000" id="TIL1000" class="pginternal">post</a>, I
    leve,</p>
<p>Of al his lay, and most his foos to-greve.</p>
<p class="stanza">144. Ensample why, see now these wyse clerkes,</p>
<p>That <a href="#TINL1002" id="TIL1002" class="pginternal">erren aldermost</a> a-yein a lawe,</p>
<p>And ben converted from hir wikked werkes</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1005</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Thorugh grace of god, that list hem to him drawe,</p>
<p>Than arn they folk that han most god in awe,</p>
<p>And strengest-feythed been, I understonde,</p>
<p>And conne an errour alder-best withstonde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">145. Whan Troilus had herd Pandare assented</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1010</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To been his help in loving of Criseyde,</p>
<p>Wex of his wo, as who seyth, <a href="#TINL1011" id="TIL1011" class="pginternal">untormented</a>,</p>
<p>But hotter wex his love, and thus he seyde,</p>
<p>With sobre chere, al-though his herte pleyde,</p>
<p>'Now blisful Venus helpe, er that I sterve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1015</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of thee, Pandare, I may som thank deserve.</p>
<p class="stanza">146. But, dere frend, how shal myn wo ben lesse</p>
<p>Til this be doon? and goode, eek tel me this,</p>
<p>How wiltow seyn of me and my destresse?</p>
<p>Lest she be wrooth, this drede I most, y-wis,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1020</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or nil not here or trowen how it is.</p>
<p>Al this drede I, and eek for the manere</p>
<p>Of thee, hir eem, she nil no swich thing here.'</p>
<p class="stanza">147. Quod Pandarus, 'thou hast a ful gret care</p>
<p>Lest that the <a href="#TINL1024" id="TIL1024" class="pginternal">cherl</a> may falle out of the mone!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1025</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page186">{186}</span>Why, lord! I hate of thee thy
    nyce fare!</p>
<p>Why, <a href="#TINL1026" id="TIL1026" class="pginternal">entremete</a> of that thou hast to done!</p>
<p>For goddes love, I bidde thee a bone,</p>
<p>So lat me alone, and it shal be thy beste.'—</p>
<p>'Why, freend,' quod he, 'now do right as thee leste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1030</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">148. But herke, Pandare, o word, for I nolde</p>
<p>That thou in me wendest so greet folye,</p>
<p>That to my lady I desiren sholde</p>
<p>That toucheth harm or any vilenye;</p>
<p>For dredelees, me were lever dye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1035</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Than she of me ought elles understode</p>
<p>But that, that mighte sounen in-to gode.'</p>
<p class="stanza">149. Tho lough this Pandare, and anoon answerde,</p>
<p>'And I thy <a href="#TINL1038" id="TIL1038" class="pginternal">borw</a>? fy! no wight dooth but so;</p>
<p>I roughte nought though that she stode and herde</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1040</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How that thou seyst; but fare-wel, I wol go.</p>
<p>A-dieu! be glad! god spede us bothe two!</p>
<p>Yif me this labour and this besinesse,</p>
<p>And of my speed be thyn al that swetnesse.'</p>
<p class="stanza">150. Tho Troilus gan doun on knees to falle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1045</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And Pandare in his armes hente faste,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'now, fy on the Grekes alle!</p>
<p>Yet, pardee, god shal helpe us at the laste;</p>
<p>And dredelees, if that my lyf may laste,</p>
<p>And god to-forn, lo, som of hem shal smerte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1050</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And yet <a href="#TINL1050" id="TIL1050" class="pginternal">me athinketh</a> that this avaunt me
    asterte!</p>
<p class="stanza">151. <a href="#TINL1051" id="TIL1051" class="pginternal">Now</a>, Pandare, I can no more
    seye,</p>
<p>But <a href="#TINL1052" id="TIL1052" class="pginternal">thou wys</a>, thou wost, thou mayst, thou art al!</p>
<p>My lyf, my deeth, hool in thyn honde I leye;</p>
<p>Help now,' quod he. 'Yis, by my trouthe, I shal.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1055</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'God yelde thee, freend, and this in special,'</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page187">{187}</span>Quod Troilus, 'that thou me recomaunde</p>
<p>To hir that to the deeth me may comaunde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">152. This Pandarus tho, <a href="#TINL1058" id="TIL1058" class="pginternal">desirous</a> to
    serve</p>
<p>His fulle freend, than seyde in this manere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1060</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Far-wel, and thenk I wol thy thank deserve;</p>
<p>Have here my trouthe, and that thou shalt wel here.'—</p>
<p>And wente his wey, thenking on this matere,</p>
<p>And how he best mighte hir beseche of grace,</p>
<p>And finde a tyme ther-to, and a place.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1065</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">153. For every wight that hath an hous to founde</p>
<p>Ne renneth nought the werk for to biginne</p>
<p>With rakel hond, but he wol byde a stounde,</p>
<p>And sende his hertes lyne out fro with-inne</p>
<p>Alderfirst his purpos for to winne.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1070</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Al this <a href="#TINL1070" id="TIL1070" class="pginternal">Pandare</a> in his herte thoughte,</p>
<p>And caste his werk ful wysly, or he wroughte.</p>
<p class="stanza">154. But Troilus lay tho no lenger doun,</p>
<p>But up anoon up-on his stede bay,</p>
<p>And in the feld he pleyde tho leoun;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1075</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Wo was that Greek that with him mette that day.</p>
<p>And in the toun his maner tho forth ay</p>
<p>So goodly was, and gat him so in grace,</p>
<p><a href="#TINL1078" id="TIL1078" class="pginternal">That ech him lovede</a> that loked on his face.</p>
<p class="stanza">155. For he bicom the frendlyeste wight,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1080</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">The gentileste, and eek the moste free,</p>
<p>The thriftieste and oon the beste knight,</p>
<p>That in his tyme was, or mighte be.</p>
<p>Dede were his Iapes and his crueltee,</p>
<p>His heighe port and his manere estraunge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1085</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And ech of tho gan for a vertu chaunge.</p>
<p class="stanza">156. Now lat us stinte of Troilus a stounde,</p>
<p>That fareth lyk a man that hurt is sore,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page188">{188}</span>And is <a href="#TINL1088" id="TIL1088" class="pginternal">somdel</a> of akinge of his wounde</p>
<p>Y-lissed wel, but heled no del more:</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1090</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And, as an esy pacient, the lore</p>
<p>Abit of him that gooth aboute his cure;</p>
<p>And thus he dryveth forth his aventure.</p>
</div>
<p class="ac"><b>Explicit Liber Primus.</b></p>

<div><span class="pagenum" id="page189">{189}</span></div>
<h2 class="ac" style="margin-bottom:2.1ex;"> <span class="larger">BOOK II.</span></h2>
<p class="ac"><b>Incipit prohemium Secundi Libri.</b></p>
<div class="poem poemc35">
<p><a href="#TIINL1" id="TIIL1" class="pginternal">1</a>. Out of these blake wawes for to sayle,</p>
<p>O wind, O wind, the weder ginneth clere;</p>
<p>For in this see the boot hath swich travayle,</p>
<p>Of my conning that unnethe I it stere:</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">5</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This see clepe I the tempestous matere</p>
<p>Of desespeyr that Troilus was inne:</p>
<p>But now of hope the <a href="#TIINL7" id="TIIL7" class="pginternal">calendes</a> biginne.</p>
<p class="stanza">2. O lady myn, that called art <a href="#TIINL8" id="TIIL8" class="pginternal">Cleo</a>,</p>
<p>Thou be my speed fro this forth, and my muse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">10</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To ryme wel this book, til I have do;</p>
<p>Me nedeth here noon other art to use.</p>
<p>For-why to every lovere I me excuse,</p>
<p>That of no sentement I this endyte,</p>
<p>But out of <a href="#TIINL14" id="TIIL14" class="pginternal">Latin</a> in my tonge it wryte.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">15</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">3. Wherfore I nil have neither thank ne blame</p>
<p>Of al this werk, but pray yow mekely,</p>
<p>Disblameth me, if any word be lame,</p>
<p>For as myn auctor seyde, so seye I.</p>
<p>Eek though I speke of love unfelingly,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">20</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">No wonder is, for it no-thing of newe is;</p>
<p>A blind man can nat Iuggen wel <a href="#TIINL21" id="TIIL21" class="pginternal">in hewis</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIINL22" id="TIIL22" class="pginternal">4</a>. Ye knowe eek, that in forme of speche is
    chaunge</p>
<p>With-inne a thousand yeer, and wordes tho</p>
<p>That hadden prys, now wonder nyce and straunge</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">25</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Us thinketh hem; and yet they spake hem so,</p>
<p>And spedde as wel in love as men now do;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page190">{190}</span>Eek for to winne love in sondry ages,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL28" id="TIIL28" class="pginternal">In sondry londes</a>, sondry ben usages.</p>
<p class="stanza">5. And for-thy if it happe in any wyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">30</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That here be any lovere in this place</p>
<p>That herkeneth, as the story wol devyse,</p>
<p>How Troilus com to his lady grace,</p>
<p>And thenketh, so nolde I nat love purchace,</p>
<p>Or wondreth on his speche and his doinge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">35</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I noot; but it is me no wonderinge;</p>
<p class="stanza">6. For every wight which that to Rome <a href="#TIINL36" id="TIIL36" class="pginternal">went</a>,</p>
<p>Halt nat o path, or alwey o manere;</p>
<p>Eek in some lond were al the gamen shent,</p>
<p>If that they ferde in love as men don here,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">40</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As thus, in open doing or in chere,</p>
<p>In visitinge, in forme, or seyde hir sawes;</p>
<p>For-thy men seyn, ech contree hath his lawes.</p>
<p class="stanza">7. Eek scarsly been ther in this place three</p>
<p>That han in love seyd lyk and doon in al;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">45</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For to thy purpos this may lyken thee,</p>
<p>And thee right nought, yet al is seyd or <a href="#TIINL46" id="TIIL46" class="pginternal">shal</a>;</p>
<p>Eek som men grave in tree, som in stoon wal,</p>
<p>As it <a href="#TIINL48" id="TIIL48" class="pginternal">bitit</a>; but sin I have begonne,</p>
<p>Myn auctor shal I folwen, if I conne.</p>
</div>
<p class="sp3 ac"><b>Explicit prohemium Secundi Libri.</b></p>
<p class="ac"><b>Incipit Liber Secundus.</b></p>
<div class="poem poemc35">
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">50</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">8. In May, that moder is of monthes glade,</p>
<p>That fresshe floures, blewe, and whyte, and rede,</p>
<p>Ben quike agayn, that winter dede made,</p>
<p>And ful of bawme is fletinge every mede;</p>
<p>Whan Phebus doth his brighte bemes sprede</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">55</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right in the whyte <a href="#TIINL55" id="TIIL55" class="pginternal">Bole</a>, it so bitidde</p>
<p>As I shal singe, on Mayes day the thridde,</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page191">{191}</span>9. That Pandarus, for al his
    wyse speche,</p>
<p>Felte eek his part of loves shottes kene,</p>
<p>That, coude he never so wel of loving preche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">60</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It made his hewe a-day ful ofte grene;</p>
<p>So shoop it, that him fil that day a tene</p>
<p>In love, for which in wo to bedde he wente,</p>
<p>And made, er it was day, ful many a <a href="#TIINL63" id="TIIL63" class="pginternal">wente</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">10. The swalwe Proignè, with a sorwful lay,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">65</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Whan morwe com, gan make hir weymentinge,</p>
<p>Why she <a href="#TIINL64" id="TIIL64" class="pginternal">forshapen</a> was; and ever lay</p>
<p>Pandare a-bedde, half in a slomeringe,</p>
<p>Til she so neigh him made hir chiteringe</p>
<p>How Tereus gan forth hir suster take,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">70</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That with the noyse of hir he gan a-wake;</p>
<p class="stanza">11. And gan to calle, and dresse him up to ryse,</p>
<p>Remembringe him his erand was to done</p>
<p>From Troilus, and eek his greet empryse;</p>
<p>And caste and knew in good <a href="#TIINL74" id="TIIL74" class="pginternal">plyt</a> was the mone</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">75</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To doon viage, and took his wey ful sone</p>
<p>Un-to his neces paleys ther bi-syde;</p>
<p>Now <a href="#TIINL77" id="TIIL77" class="pginternal">Ianus</a>, god of entree, thou him gyde!</p>
<p class="stanza">12. Whan he was come un-to his neces place,</p>
<p>'Wher is my lady?' to hir folk seyde he;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">80</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And they him tolde; and he forth in gan pace,</p>
<p>And fond, two othere ladyes <a href="#TIINL81" id="TIIL81" class="pginternal">sete</a> and she</p>
<p>With-inne a paved parlour; and they three</p>
<p>Herden a mayden reden hem the geste</p>
<p>Of the Sege of <a href="#TIINL84" id="TIIL84" class="pginternal">Thebes</a>, whyl hem leste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">85</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">13. Quod Pandarus, 'ma dame, god yow see,</p>
<p>With al your book and al the companye!'</p>
<p>'<a href="#TIINL87" id="TIIL87" class="pginternal">Ey</a>, uncle myn, welcome y-wis,' quod she,</p>
<p>And up she roos, and by the hond in hye</p>
<p>She took him faste, and seyde, 'this night thrye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">90</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page192">{192}</span>To goode mote it turne, of yow I
    mette!'</p>
<p>And with that word she doun on bench him sette.</p>
<p class="stanza">14. 'Ye, nece, ye shal fare wel the bet,</p>
<p>If god wole, al this yeer,' quod Pandarus;</p>
<p>'But I am sory that I have yow let</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">95</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To herknen of your book ye preysen thus;</p>
<p>For goddes love, what seith it? tel it us.</p>
<p>Is it of love? O, som good ye me lere!'</p>
<p>'Uncle,' quod she, 'your maistresse is not here!'</p>
<p class="stanza">15. With that they gonnen laughe, and tho she seyde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">100</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'This romaunce is of Thebes, that we rede;</p>
<p>And we han herd how that king Laius deyde</p>
<p>Thurgh <a href="#TIINL100" id="TIIL100" class="pginternal">Edippus his sone</a>, and al that dede;</p>
<p>And here we stenten at these <a href="#TIINL103" id="TIIL103" class="pginternal">lettres rede</a>,</p>
<p>How the bisshop, as the book can telle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">105</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Amphiorax, fil thurgh the ground to helle.'</p>
<p class="stanza">16. Quod Pandarus, 'al this knowe I my-selve,</p>
<p>And al the assege of Thebes and the care;</p>
<p>For her-of been ther maked <a href="#TIINL108" id="TIIL108" class="pginternal">bokes twelve</a>:—</p>
<p>But lat be this, and tel me how ye fare;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">110</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Do wey your <a href="#TIINL110" id="TIIL110" class="pginternal">barbe</a>, and shew your face
    bare;</p>
<p>Do wey your book, rys up, and lat us daunce,</p>
<p>And lat us don to May som <a href="#TIINL112" id="TIIL112" class="pginternal">observaunce</a>.'</p>
<p class="stanza">17. 'A! god forbede!' quod she, 'be ye mad?'</p>
<p>Is that a widewes lyf, so god you save?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">115</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">By god, ye maken me right sore a-drad,</p>
<p>Ye ben so wilde, it semeth as ye rave!</p>
<p>It <a href="#TIINL117" id="TIIL117" class="pginternal">sete</a> me wel bet ay in a cave</p>
<p>To bidde, and rede on holy seyntes lyves:</p>
<p>Lat maydens gon to daunce, and yonge wyves.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">120</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page193">{193}</span>18. 'As ever thryve I,'
    quod this Pandarus,</p>
<p>'Yet coude I telle a thing to doon you pleye.'</p>
<p>'Now uncle dere,' quod she, 'tel it us</p>
<p>For goddes love; is than the assege aweye?</p>
<p>I am of Grekes so ferd that I deye.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">125</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Nay, nay,' quod he, 'as ever mote I thryve!</p>
<p>It is a thing wel bet than swiche fyve.'</p>
<p class="stanza">19. 'Ye, holy god!' quod she, 'what thing is that?</p>
<p>What? bet than swiche fyve? ey, nay, y-wis!</p>
<p>For al this world ne can I reden what</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">130</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It sholde been; som Iape, I trowe, is this;</p>
<p>And but your-selven telle us what it is,</p>
<p>My wit is for to arede it al to lene;</p>
<p>As help me god, I noot nat what ye mene.'</p>
<p class="stanza">20. 'And I your <a href="#TIINL134" id="TIIL134" class="pginternal">borow</a>, ne never shal, for
    me,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">135</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This thing be told to yow, as mote I thryve!'</p>
<p>'And why so, uncle myn? why so?' quod she.</p>
<p>'By god,' quod he, 'that wole I telle as blyve;</p>
<p>For prouder womman were ther noon on-lyve,</p>
<p>And ye it wiste, in al the toun of Troye;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">140</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I iape nought, as ever have I Ioye!'</p>
<p class="stanza">21. Tho gan she wondren more than biforn</p>
<p>A thousand fold, and doun hir eyen caste;</p>
<p>For never, sith the tyme that she was born,</p>
<p>To knowe thing desired she so faste;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">145</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And with a syk she seyde him at the laste,</p>
<p>'Now, uncle myn, I nil yow nought displese,</p>
<p>Nor axen more, that may do yow disese.'</p>
<p class="stanza">22. So after this, with many wordes glade,</p>
<p>And freendly tales, and with mery chere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">150</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of this and that they pleyde, and gunnen wade</p>
<p>In many an <a href="#TIINL151" id="TIIL151" class="pginternal">unkouth</a> glad and deep matere,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page194">{194}</span>As freendes doon, whan they ben met
    y-fere;</p>
<p>Til she gan axen him how Ector ferde,</p>
<p>That was the tounes <a href="#TIINL154" id="TIIL154" class="pginternal">wal</a> and Grekes yerde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">155</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">23. 'Ful wel, I thanke it god,' quod Pandarus,</p>
<p>'Save in his arm he hath a litel wounde;</p>
<p>And eek his fresshe brother Troilus,</p>
<p>The wyse worthy Ector the secounde,</p>
<p>In whom that every vertu list abounde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">160</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As alle trouthe and alle gentillesse,</p>
<p>Wysdom, honour, fredom, and worthinesse.'</p>
<p class="stanza">24. 'In good feith, eem,' quod she, 'that lyketh me;</p>
<p>They faren wel, god save hem bothe two!</p>
<p>For trewely I holde it greet deyntee</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">165</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A kinges sone in armes wel to do,</p>
<p>And been of good condiciouns ther-to;</p>
<p>For greet power and moral vertu here</p>
<p>Is selde y-seye in <a href="#TIINL167" id="TIIL167" class="pginternal">o persone</a> y-fere.'</p>
<p class="stanza">25. 'In good feith, that is sooth,' quod Pandarus;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">170</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But, by my trouthe, the king hath sones tweye,</p>
<p>That is to mene, Ector and Troilus,</p>
<p>That certainly, though that I sholde deye,</p>
<p>They been as voyde of vyces, dar I seye,</p>
<p>As any men that liveth under the sonne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">175</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hir might is wyde y-knowe, and what they conne.</p>
<p class="stanza">26. Of Ector nedeth it nought for to telle;</p>
<p>In al this world ther nis a bettre knight</p>
<p>Than he, that is of worthinesse welle;</p>
<p>And he wel more vertu hath than might.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">180</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This knoweth many a wys and worthy wight.</p>
<p>The same prys of Troilus I seye,</p>
<p>God help me so, I knowe not swiche tweye.'</p>
<p class="stanza">27. 'By god,' quod she, 'of Ector that is sooth;</p>
<p>Of Troilus the same thing trowe I;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">185</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For dredelees, men tellen that he dooth</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page195">{195}</span>In armes day by day so worthily,</p>
<p>And bereth him here at hoom so gentilly</p>
<p>To every wight, that al the prys hath he</p>
<p>Of hem that me were levest preysed be.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">190</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">28. 'Ye sey right sooth, y-wis,' quod Pandarus;</p>
<p>'For yesterday, who-so hadde with him been,</p>
<p>He might have wondred up-on Troilus;</p>
<p>For never yet so thikke a swarm of been</p>
<p>Ne fleigh, as Grekes fro him gonne fleen;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">195</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And thorugh the feld, in every wightes ere,</p>
<p>Ther nas no cry but "Troilus is there!"</p>
<p class="stanza">29. Now here, now there, he hunted hem so faste,</p>
<p>Ther nas but Grekes blood; and Troilus,</p>
<p>Now hem he hurte, and hem alle doun he caste;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">200</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ay where he wente it was arayed thus:</p>
<p>He was hir deeth, and sheld and lyf for us;</p>
<p>That as that day ther dorste noon with-stonde,</p>
<p>Whyl that he held his blody swerd in honde.</p>
<p class="stanza">30. Therto he is the freendlieste man</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">205</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of grete estat, that ever I saw my lyve;</p>
<p>And wher him list, best felawshipe can</p>
<p>To suche as him thinketh able for to thryve.'</p>
<p>And with that word tho Pandarus, as blyve,</p>
<p>He took his leve, and seyde, 'I wol go henne:'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">210</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Nay, blame have I, myn uncle,' quod she thenne.</p>
<p class="stanza">31. 'What eyleth yow to be thus wery sone,</p>
<p>And namelich of wommen? wol ye so?</p>
<p>Nay, sitteth down; by god, I have to done</p>
<p>With yow, to speke of wisdom er ye go.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">215</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And every wight that was a-boute hem tho,</p>
<p>That herde that, gan fer a-wey to stonde,</p>
<p>Whyl they two hadde al that hem liste in honde.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page196">{196}</span>32. Whan that hir tale al
    brought was to an ende</p>
<p>Of hire estat and of hir governaunce,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">220</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Quod Pandarus, 'now is it tyme I wende;</p>
<p>But yet, I seye, aryseth, lat us daunce,</p>
<p>And cast your widwes habit to mischaunce:</p>
<p>What list yow thus your-self to disfigure,</p>
<p>Sith yow is tid thus fair an aventure?'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">225</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">33. 'A! wel bithought! for love of god,' quod she,</p>
<p>'Shal I not witen what ye mene of this?'</p>
<p>'No, this thing axeth layser,' tho quod he,</p>
<p>'And eek me wolde muche greve, y-wis,</p>
<p>If I it tolde, and ye it toke amis.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">230</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Yet were it bet my tonge for to stille</p>
<p>Than seye a sooth that were ayeins your wille.</p>
<p class="stanza">34. For, nece, by the goddesse Minerve,</p>
<p>And Iuppiter, that maketh the thonder ringe,</p>
<p>And by the blisful Venus that I serve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">235</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ye been the womman in this world livinge,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL236" id="TIIL236" class="pginternal">With-oute</a> paramours, to my witinge,</p>
<p>That I best love, and lothest am to greve,</p>
<p>And that ye witen wel your-self, I leve.'</p>
<p class="stanza">35. 'Y-wis, myn uncle,' quod she, 'grant mercy;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">240</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Your freendship have I founden ever yit;</p>
<p>I am to no man holden trewely</p>
<p>So muche as yow, and have so litel quit;</p>
<p>And, with the grace of god, emforth my wit,</p>
<p>As in my gilt I shal you never offende;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">245</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And if I have er this, I wol amende.</p>
<p class="stanza">36. But, for the love of god, I yow beseche,</p>
<p>As ye ben he that I most love and triste,</p>
<p>Lat be to me your fremde maner speche,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page197">{197}</span>And sey to me, your nece, what yow liste:'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">250</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And with that word hir uncle anoon hir kiste,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'gladly, leve nece dere,</p>
<p>Tak it for good that I shal seye yow here.'</p>
<p class="stanza">37. With that she gan hir eyen doun to caste,</p>
<p>And Pandarus to coghe gan a lyte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">255</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde, 'nece, alwey, lo! to the laste,</p>
<p>How-so it be that som men hem delyte</p>
<p>With subtil art hir tales for to endyte,</p>
<p>Yet for al that, in hir entencioun,</p>
<p>Hir tale is al for som conclusioun.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">260</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">38. And sithen thende is every tales strengthe,</p>
<p>And this matere is so bihovely,</p>
<p>What sholde I peynte or drawen it on lengthe</p>
<p>To yow, that been my freend so feithfully?'</p>
<p>And with that word he gan right inwardly</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">265</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Biholden hir, and loken on hir face,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'on suche a mirour goode grace!'</p>
<p class="stanza">39. Than thoughte he thus, 'if I my tale endyte</p>
<p>Ought hard, or make a proces any whyle,</p>
<p>She shal no savour han ther-in but lyte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">270</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And trowe I wolde hir in my wil bigyle.</p>
<p>For tendre wittes wenen al be wyle</p>
<p>Ther-as they can nat pleynly understonde;</p>
<p>For-thy hir wit <a href="#TIINL273" id="TIIL273" class="pginternal">to serven</a> wol I fonde'—</p>
<p class="stanza">40. And loked on hir in a besy wyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">275</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And she was war that he byheld hir so,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'lord! so faste ye me avyse!</p>
<p>Sey ye me never er now? what sey ye, no?'</p>
<p>'Yes, yes,' quod he, 'and bet wole er I go;</p>
<p>But, by my trouthe, I thoughte now if ye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">280</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be fortunat, for now men shal it see.</p>
<p class="stanza">41. For to every wight som goodly aventure</p>
<p>Som tyme is shape, if he it can receyven;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page198">{198}</span>And if that he wol take of it no cure,</p>
<p>Whan that it cometh, but wilfully it weyven,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">285</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Lo, neither cas nor fortune him deceyven,</p>
<p>But right his verray slouthe and wrecchednesse;</p>
<p>And swich a wight is for to blame, I gesse.</p>
<p class="stanza">42. Good aventure, O bele nece, have ye</p>
<p>Ful lightly founden, and ye conne it take;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">290</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And, for the love of god, and eek of me,</p>
<p>Cacche it anoon, lest aventure slake.</p>
<p>What sholde I lenger proces of it make?</p>
<p>Yif me your hond, for in this world is noon,</p>
<p>If that you list, a wight <a href="#TIINL294" id="TIIL294" class="pginternal">so wel begoon</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">295</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">43. And sith I speke of good entencioun,</p>
<p>As I to yow have told wel here-biforn,</p>
<p>And love as wel your honour and renoun</p>
<p>As creature in al this world y-born;</p>
<p>By alle the othes that I have yow sworn,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">300</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And ye be wrooth therfore, or wene I lye,</p>
<p>Ne shal I never seen yow eft with yë.</p>
<p class="stanza">44. Beth nought agast, ne quaketh nat; wher-to?</p>
<p>Ne chaungeth nat for fere so your hewe;</p>
<p>For hardely, the werste of this is do;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">305</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And though my tale as now be to yow newe,</p>
<p>Yet trist alwey, ye shal me finde trewe;</p>
<p>And were it thing that me thoughte unsittinge,</p>
<p>To yow nolde I no swiche tales bringe.'</p>
<p class="stanza">45. 'Now, my good eem, for goddes love, I preye,'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">310</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Quod she, 'com of, and tel me what it is;</p>
<p>For bothe I am agast what ye wol seye,</p>
<p>And eek me longeth it to wite, y-wis.</p>
<p>For whether it be wel or be amis,</p>
<p>Sey on, lat me not in this fere dwelle:'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">315</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'So wol I doon, now herkneth, I shal telle:</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page199">{199}</span>46. Now, nece myn, the kinges
    dere sone,</p>
<p>The goode, wyse, worthy, fresshe, and free,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL318" id="TIIL318" class="pginternal">Which</a> alwey for to do wel is his wone,</p>
<p>The noble Troilus, so loveth thee,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">320</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, bot ye helpe, it wol his bane be.</p>
<p>Lo, here is al, what sholde I more seye?</p>
<p>Doth what yow list, to make him live or deye.</p>
<p class="stanza">47. But if ye lete him deye, I wol sterve;</p>
<p>Have her my trouthe, nece, I nil not lyen;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">325</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Al sholde I with this knyf my throte kerve'—</p>
<p>With that the teres braste out of his yën,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'if that ye doon us bothe dyen,</p>
<p>Thus giltelees, than have ye <a href="#TIINL328" id="TIIL328" class="pginternal">fisshed faire</a>;</p>
<p>What <a href="#TIINL329" id="TIIL329" class="pginternal">mende</a> ye, though that we bothe apeyre?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">330</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">48. Allas! he which that is my lord so dere,</p>
<p>That trewe man, that noble gentil knight,</p>
<p>That nought desireth but your freendly chere,</p>
<p>I see him deye, ther he goth up-right,</p>
<p>And hasteth him, with al his fulle might,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">335</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For to be slayn, if fortune wol assente;</p>
<p>Allas! that god yow swich a beautee sente!</p>
<p class="stanza">49. If it be so that ye so cruel be,</p>
<p>That of his deeth yow liste nought to recche,</p>
<p>That is so trewe and worthy, as ye see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">340</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">No more than of a Iapere or a wrecche,</p>
<p>If ye be swich, your beautee may not strecche</p>
<p>To make amendes of so cruel a dede;</p>
<p>Avysement is good bifore the nede.</p>
<p class="stanza">50. Wo worth the faire <a href="#TIINL344" id="TIIL344" class="pginternal">gemme</a>
    vertulees!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">345</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Wo worth that herbe also that dooth no bote!</p>
<p>Wo worth that beautee that is routhelees!</p>
<p>Wo worth that wight that tret ech under fote!</p>
<p>And ye, that been of beautee crop and rote,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page200">{200}</span>If therwith-al in you ther be no routhe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">350</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Than is it harm ye liven, by my trouthe!</p>
<p class="stanza">51. And also thenk wel, that this is no gaude;</p>
<p>For me were lever, thou and I and he</p>
<p>Were hanged, than I sholde been his baude,</p>
<p>As heyghe, as men mighte on us alle y-see:</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">355</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I am thyn eem, the shame were to me,</p>
<p>As wel as thee, if that I sholde assente,</p>
<p>Thorugh myn abet, that he thyn honour shente.</p>
<p class="stanza">52. Now understond, for I yow nought requere,</p>
<p>To binde yow to him thorugh no beheste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">360</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But only that ye make him bettre chere</p>
<p>Than ye han doon er this, and more feste,</p>
<p>So that his lyf be saved, at the leste:</p>
<p>This al and som, and playnly our entente;</p>
<p>God helpe me so, I never other mente.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">365</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">53. Lo, this request is not but skile, y-wis,</p>
<p>Ne doute of reson, pardee, is ther noon.</p>
<p>I sette the worste that ye dredden this,</p>
<p>Men wolden wondren seen him come or goon:</p>
<p>Ther-ayeins answere I thus a-noon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">370</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That every wight, but he be fool of kinde,</p>
<p>Wol deme it love of freendship in his minde.</p>
<p class="stanza">54. What? who wol deme, though he see a man</p>
<p>To temple go, that he the images eteth?</p>
<p>Thenk eek how wel and wysly that he can</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">375</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Governe him-self, that he no-thing foryeteth,</p>
<p>That, wher he cometh, he prys and thank him geteth;</p>
<p>And eek ther-to, he shal come here so selde,</p>
<p>What fors were it though al the toun behelde?</p>
<p class="stanza">55. Swich love of freendes regneth al this toun;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">380</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And wrye yow in that mantel ever-mo;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page201">{201}</span>And, god so wis be my savacioun,</p>
<p>As I have seyd, your beste is to do so.</p>
<p>But alwey, goode nece, to stinte his wo,</p>
<p>So lat your daunger sucred ben a lyte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">385</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That of his deeth ye be nought for to wyte.'</p>
<p class="stanza">56. Criseyde, which that herde him in this wyse,</p>
<p>Thoughte, 'I shal <a href="#TIINL387" id="TIIL387" class="pginternal">fele</a> what he meneth, y-wis.'</p>
<p>'Now, eem,' quod she, 'what wolde ye devyse,</p>
<p>What is your reed I sholde doon of this?'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">390</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'That is wel seyd,' quod he, 'certayn, best is</p>
<p>That <a href="#TIINL391" id="TIIL391" class="pginternal">ye him love ayein for his lovinge</a>,</p>
<p>As love for love is skilful guerdoninge.</p>
<p class="stanza">57. Thenk eek, <a href="#TIINL393" id="TIIL393" class="pginternal">how elde wasteth every
    houre</a></p>
<p>In eche of yow a party of beautee;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">395</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And therfore, er that age thee devoure,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL396" id="TIIL396" class="pginternal">Go love</a>, for, olde, ther wol no wight of thee.</p>
<p>Lat this proverbe a lore un-to yow be;</p>
<p>"<a href="#TIINL398" id="TIIL398" class="pginternal">To late y-war</a>, quod Beautee, whan it paste;"</p>
<p>And elde daunteth daunger at the laste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">400</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">58. <a href="#TIINL400" id="TIIL400" class="pginternal">The kinges fool</a> is woned to
    cryen loude,</p>
<p>Whan that him thinketh a womman bereth hir hyë,</p>
<p>"So longe mote ye live, and alle proude,</p>
<p>Til <a href="#TIINL403" id="TIIL403" class="pginternal">crowes feet </a>be growe under your yë,</p>
<p>And sende yow thanne a mirour in to pryë</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">405</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">In whiche ye may see your face a-morwe!"</p>
<p>Nece, I bidde wisshe yow no more sorwe.'</p>
<p class="stanza">59. With this he stente, and caste adoun the heed,</p>
<p>And she bigan to <a href="#TIINL408" id="TIIL408" class="pginternal">breste a-wepe</a> anoon.</p>
<p>And seyde, 'allas, for wo! why nere I deed?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">410</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page202">{202}</span>For of this world the feith is
    al agoon!</p>
<p>Allas! what sholden straunge to me doon,</p>
<p>When he, that for my beste freend I wende,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL413" id="TIIL413" class="pginternal">Ret</a> me to love, and sholde it me defende?</p>
<p class="stanza">60. Allas! I wolde han trusted, doutelees,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">415</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That if that I, thurgh my disaventure,</p>
<p>Had loved other him or Achilles,</p>
<p>Ector, or any mannes creature,</p>
<p>Ye nolde han had no mercy ne mesure</p>
<p>On me, but alwey had me in repreve;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">420</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This false world, allas! who may it leve?</p>
<p class="stanza">61. What? is this al the Ioye and al the feste?</p>
<p>Is this your reed, is this my blisful cas?</p>
<p>Is this the verray mede of your beheste?</p>
<p>Is al this peynted proces seyd, allas!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">425</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right for this fyn? O lady myn, <a href="#TIINL425" id="TIIL425" class="pginternal">Pallas</a>!</p>
<p>Thou in this dredful cas for me purveye;</p>
<p>For so astonied am I that I deye!'</p>
<p class="stanza">62. With that she gan ful sorwfully to syke;</p>
<p>'A! may it be no bet?' quod Pandarus;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">430</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'By god, I shal no-more com here this wyke,</p>
<p>And god to-forn, that am mistrusted thus;</p>
<p>I see ful wel that ye sette lyte of us,</p>
<p>Or of our deeth! Allas! I woful wrecche!</p>
<p>Mighte he yet live, of me is <a href="#TIINL434" id="TIIL434" class="pginternal">nought to recche</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">435</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">63. O cruel god, O dispitouse Marte,</p>
<p>O Furies three of helle, on yow I crye!</p>
<p>So lat me never out of this hous departe,</p>
<p>If that I mente harm or vilanye!</p>
<p>But sith I see my lord mot nedes dye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">440</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And I with him, here I me shryve, and seye</p>
<p>That wikkedly ye doon us bothe deye.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page203">{203}</span>64. But sith it lyketh yow that
    I be deed,</p>
<p>By Neptunus, that god is of the see,</p>
<p>Fro this forth shal I never eten breed</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">445</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Til I myn owene herte blood may see;</p>
<p>For certayn, I wole deye as sone as he'—</p>
<p>And up he sterte, and on his wey he raughte,</p>
<p>Til she agayn him by the lappe caughte.</p>
<p class="stanza">65. Criseyde, which that wel neigh starf for fere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">450</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So as she was the ferfulleste wight</p>
<p>That mighte be, and herde eek with hir ere,</p>
<p>And saw the sorwful ernest of the knight,</p>
<p>And in his preyere eek saw noon unright,</p>
<p>And for the harm that mighte eek fallen more,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">455</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">She gan to rewe, and dradde hir wonder sore;</p>
<p class="stanza">66. And thoughte thus, 'unhappes fallen thikke</p>
<p>Alday for love, and in swich maner cas,</p>
<p>As men ben cruel in hem-self and wikke;</p>
<p>And if this man slee here him-self, allas!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">460</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">In my presence, it wol be no solas.</p>
<p>What men wolde of hit deme I can nat seye;</p>
<p>It nedeth me ful sleyly for to pleye.'</p>
<p class="stanza">67. And with a sorwful syk she seyde thrye,</p>
<p>'A! lord! what me is tid a sory chaunce!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">465</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For myn estat now lyth in Iupartye,</p>
<p>And eek myn emes lyf lyth in balaunce;</p>
<p>But nathelees, with goddes governaunce,</p>
<p>I shal so doon, myn honour shal I kepe,</p>
<p>And eek his lyf;' and stinte for to wepe.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">470</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">68. 'Of harmes two, the lesse is for to chese;</p>
<p>Yet have I lever maken him good chere</p>
<p>In honour, than myn emes lyf to lese;</p>
<p>Ye seyn, ye no-thing elles me requere?'</p>
<p>'No, wis,' quod he, 'myn owene nece dere.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">475</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page204">{204}</span>'Now wel,' quod she, 'and I wol
    doon my peyne;</p>
<p>I shal myn herte ayeins my lust constreyne,</p>
<p class="stanza">69. But that I nil not <a href="#TIINL477" id="TIIL477" class="pginternal">holden him in
    honde</a>,</p>
<p>Ne love a man, ne can I not, ne may</p>
<p>Ayeins my wil; but elles wol I fonde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">480</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Myn honour sauf, plese him fro day to day;</p>
<p>Ther-to nolde I nought ones have seyd nay,</p>
<p>But that I dredde, as in my fantasye;</p>
<p>But cesse cause, ay <a href="#TIINL483" id="TIIL483" class="pginternal">cesseth maladye</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">70. And here I make a protestacioun,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">485</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That in this proces if ye depper go,</p>
<p>That certaynly, for no savacioun</p>
<p>Of yow, though that ye sterve bothe two,</p>
<p>Though al the world on o day be my fo,</p>
<p>Ne shal I never on him han other routhe.'—</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">490</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'I graunte wel,' quod Pandare, 'by my trouthe.</p>
<p class="stanza">71. But may I truste wel ther-to,' quod he,</p>
<p>'That, of this thing that ye han hight me here,</p>
<p>Ye wol it holden trewly un-to me?'</p>
<p>'Ye, doutelees,' quod she, 'myn uncle dere.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">495</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Ne that I shal han cause in this matere,'</p>
<p>Quod he, 'to pleyne, or after yow to preche?'</p>
<p>'Why, no, pardee; what nedeth more speche?'</p>
<p class="stanza">72. Tho fillen they in othere tales glade,</p>
<p>Til at the laste, 'O good eem,' quod she tho,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">500</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'For love of god, which that us bothe made,</p>
<p>Tel me how first ye wisten of his wo:</p>
<p>Wot noon of hit but ye?' He seyde, 'no.'</p>
<p>'Can he wel speke of love?' quod she, 'I preye,</p>
<p>Tel me, for I the bet me shal purveye.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">505</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">73. Tho Pandarus a litel gan to smyle,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'by my trouthe, I shal yow telle.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page205">{205}</span>This other day, nought <a href="#TIINL507" id="TIIL507" class="pginternal">gon</a> ful longe whyle,</p>
<p>In-with the paleys-gardyn, by a welle,</p>
<p>Gan he and I wel half a day to dwelle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">510</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right for to speken of an ordenaunce,</p>
<p>How we the Grekes mighte disavaunce.</p>
<p class="stanza">74. Sone after that bigonne we to lepe,</p>
<p>And casten with our dartes to and fro,</p>
<p>Til at the laste he seyde, he wolde slepe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">515</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And on the gres a-doun he leyde him tho;</p>
<p>And I after gan rome to and fro</p>
<p>Til that I herde, as that I welk allone,</p>
<p>How he bigan ful wofully to grone.</p>
<p class="stanza">75. Tho gan I stalke him softely bihinde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">520</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And sikerly, the sothe for to seyne,</p>
<p>As I can clepe ayein now to my minde,</p>
<p>Right thus to Love he gan him for to pleyne;</p>
<p>He seyde, "lord! have routhe up-on my peyne,</p>
<p>Al have I been rebel in myn entente;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">525</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Now, <a href="#TIINL525" id="TIIL525" class="pginternal"><i>mea culpa</i></a>, lord! I me
    repente.</p>
<p class="stanza">76. O god, that at thy disposicioun</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL527" id="TIIL527" class="pginternal">Ledest the fyn</a>, by Iuste purveyaunce,</p>
<p>Of every wight, my lowe confessioun</p>
<p>Accepte in gree, and send me swich penaunce</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">530</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As lyketh thee, but from desesperaunce,</p>
<p>That may my goost departe awey fro thee,</p>
<p>Thou be my sheld, for thy benignitee.</p>
<p class="stanza">77. For certes, lord, so sore hath she me wounded</p>
<p>That stod in blak, with loking of hir yën,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">535</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That to myn hertes botme it is y-sounded,</p>
<p>Thorugh which I woot that I mot nedes dyen;</p>
<p>This is the worste, I dar me not <a href="#TIINL537" id="TIIL537" class="pginternal">bi-wryen</a>;</p>
<p>And wel the hotter been the gledes rede,</p>
<p>That men hem <a href="#TIINL539" id="TIIL539" class="pginternal">wryen</a> with asshen pale and dede."</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">540</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page206">{206}</span>78. With that he smoot
    his heed adoun anoon,</p>
<p>And gan to motre, I noot what, trewely.</p>
<p>And I with that gan stille awey to goon,</p>
<p>And leet ther-of as no-thing wist hadde I,</p>
<p>And come ayein anoon and stood him by,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">545</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde, "a-wake, ye slepen al to longe;</p>
<p>It semeth nat that love dooth yow longe,</p>
<p class="stanza">79. That slepen so that no man may yow wake.</p>
<p>Who sey ever or this so dul a man?"</p>
<p>"Ye, freend," quod he, "do ye your hedes ake</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">550</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For love, and lat me liven as I can."</p>
<p>But though that he for wo was pale and wan,</p>
<p>Yet made he tho as fresh a contenaunce,</p>
<p>As though he shulde have led the newe daunce.</p>
<p class="stanza">80. This passed forth, til now, this other day,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">555</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It fel that I com roming al allone</p>
<p>Into his chaumbre, and fond how that he lay</p>
<p>Up-on his bed; but man so sore grone</p>
<p>Ne herde I never, and what that was his mone,</p>
<p>Ne wiste I nought; for, as I was cominge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">560</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Al sodeynly he lefte his compleyninge.</p>
<p class="stanza">81. Of which I took somwhat suspecioun,</p>
<p>And neer I com, and fond he wepte sore;</p>
<p>And god so wis be my savacioun,</p>
<p>As never of thing hadde I no routhe more.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">565</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For neither with engyn, ne with no lore,</p>
<p>Unethes mighte I fro the deeth him kepe;</p>
<p>That yet fele I myn herte for him wepe.</p>
<p class="stanza">82. And god wot, never, sith that I was born,</p>
<p>Was I so bisy no man for to preche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">570</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne never was to wight so depe y-sworn,</p>
<p>Or he me tolde who mighte been his leche.</p>
<p>But now to yow rehersen al his speche,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page207">{207}</span>Or alle his woful wordes for to soune,</p>
<p>Ne bid me not, but ye wol see me swowne.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">575</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">83. But for to save his lyf, and elles nought,</p>
<p>And to non harm of yow, thus am I driven;</p>
<p>And for the love of god that us hath wrought,</p>
<p>Swich chere him dooth, that he and I may liven.</p>
<p>Now have I plat to yow myn herte schriven;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">580</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And sin ye woot that myn entente is clene,</p>
<p>Tak hede ther-of, for I non yvel mene.</p>
<p class="stanza">84. And right good thrift, I pray to god, have ye,</p>
<p>That han swich oon y-caught with-oute net;</p>
<p>And be ye wys, as ye ben fair to see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">585</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Wel in the ring than is the ruby set.</p>
<p>Ther <a href="#TIINL586" id="TIIL586" class="pginternal">were never</a> two so wel y-met,</p>
<p>Whan ye ben his al hool, as he is youre:</p>
<p>Ther mighty god yet graunte us see that houre!'</p>
<p class="stanza">85. 'Nay, therof spak I not, a, ha!' quod she,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">590</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'As helpe me god, ye shenden every deel!'</p>
<p>'O mercy, dere nece,' anoon quod he,</p>
<p>'What-so I spak, I mente nought but weel,</p>
<p>By Mars the god, that helmed is of steel;</p>
<p>Now beth nought wrooth, my blood, my nece dere.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">595</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Now wel,' quod she, 'foryeven be it here!'</p>
<p class="stanza">86. With this he took his leve, and hoom he wente;</p>
<p>And lord, how he was glad and wel bigoon!</p>
<p>Criseyde aroos, no lenger she ne stente,</p>
<p>But straught in-to hir closet wente anoon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">600</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And sette here doun as stille as any stoon,</p>
<p>And every word gan up and doun to winde,</p>
<p>That he hadde seyd, as it com hir to minde;</p>
<p class="stanza">87. And wex somdel astonied in hir thought,</p>
<p>Right for the newe cas; but whan that she</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">605</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page208">{208}</span>Was ful avysed, tho fond she
    right nought</p>
<p>Of peril, why she oughte afered be.</p>
<p>For man may love, of possibilitee,</p>
<p>A womman so, his herte may to-breste,</p>
<p>And she nought love ayein, but-if hir leste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">610</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">88. But as she sat allone and thoughte thus,</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL611" id="TIIL611" class="pginternal">Thascry</a> aroos at skarmish al with-oute,</p>
<p>And men cryde in the strete, 'see, Troilus</p>
<p>Hath right now put to flight the Grekes route!'</p>
<p>With that gan al hir meynee for to shoute,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">615</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'A! go we see, caste up the <a href="#TIINL615" id="TIIL615" class="pginternal">latis</a>
    wyde;</p>
<p>For thurgh this strete he moot to palays ryde;</p>
<p class="stanza">89. For other wey is fro the yate noon</p>
<p>Of <a href="#TIINL618" id="TIIL618" class="pginternal">Dardanus</a>, <a href="#TIINL618" class="pginternal">ther open</a> is the
    cheyne.'</p>
<p>With that com he and al his folk anoon</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">620</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">An esy pas rydinge, in routes tweyne,</p>
<p>Right as his <a href="#TIINL621" id="TIIL621" class="pginternal">happy</a> day was, sooth to seyne,</p>
<p>For which, men say, may nought disturbed be</p>
<p>That shal bityden of necessitee.</p>
<p class="stanza">90. This Troilus sat on his baye stede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">625</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Al armed, save his heed, ful richely,</p>
<p>And wounded was his hors, and gan to blede,</p>
<p>On whiche he rood <a href="#TIINL627" id="TIIL627" class="pginternal">a pas</a>, ful softely;</p>
<p>But swych a knightly sighte, trewely,</p>
<p>As was on him, was nought, with-outen faile,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">630</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To loke on Mars, that god is of batayle.</p>
<p class="stanza">91. So lyk a man of armes and a knight</p>
<p>He was to seen, fulfild of heigh prowesse;</p>
<p>For bothe he hadde a body and a might</p>
<p>To doon that thing, as wel as hardinesse;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">635</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And eek to seen him in his gere him dresse,</p>
<p>So fresh, so yong, so weldy semed he,</p>
<p>It was <a href="#TIINL637" id="TIIL637" class="pginternal">an heven</a> up-on him for to see.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page209">{209}</span>92. His helm to-hewen was in
    twenty places,</p>
<p>That by a <a href="#TIINL639" id="TIIL639" class="pginternal">tissew</a> heng, his bak bihinde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">640</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">His sheld to-dasshed was with swerdes and maces,</p>
<p>In which men mighte many an arwe finde</p>
<p>That thirled hadde horn and <a href="#TIINL642" id="TIIL642" class="pginternal">nerf and rinde</a>;</p>
<p>And ay the peple cryde, 'here cometh our Ioye,</p>
<p>And, next his brother, holdere up of Troye!'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">645</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">93. For which he wex a litel reed for shame,</p>
<p>Whan he the peple up-on him herde cryen,</p>
<p>That to biholde it was a noble game,</p>
<p>How sobreliche he caste doun his yën.</p>
<p>Cryseyda gan al his chere aspyen,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">650</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And leet so softe it in hir herte sinke,</p>
<p>That to hir-self she seyde, 'who yaf me <a href="#TIINL651" id="TIIL651" class="pginternal">drinke</a>?'</p>
<p class="stanza">94. For of hir owene thought she wex al reed,</p>
<p>Remembringe hir right thus, 'lo, this is he</p>
<p>Which that myn uncle swereth he moot be deed,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">655</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But I on him have mercy and pitee;'</p>
<p>And with that thought, for <a href="#TIINL656" id="TIIL656" class="pginternal">pure a-shamed</a>, she</p>
<p>Gan in hir heed to pulle, and that as faste,</p>
<p>Whyl he and al the peple for-by paste,</p>
<p class="stanza">95. And gan to caste and rollen up and doun</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">660</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">With-inne hir thought his excellent prowesse,</p>
<p>And his estat, and also his renoun,</p>
<p>His wit, his shap, and eek his gentillesse;</p>
<p>But most hir favour was, for his distresse</p>
<p>Was al for hir, and thoughte it was a routhe</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">665</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To sleen swich oon, if that he mente trouthe.</p>
<p class="stanza">96. Now mighte som <a href="#TIINL666" id="TIIL666" class="pginternal">envyous</a> Iangle
    thus,</p>
<p>'This was a sodeyn love, how mighte it be</p>
<p>That she so lightly lovede Troilus</p>
<p>Right for the firste sighte; ye, pardee?'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">670</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Now who-so seyth so, mote he never thee!</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page210">{210}</span>For every thing, a ginning hath it nede</p>
<p>Er al be wrought, with-outen any drede.</p>
<p class="stanza">97. For I sey nought that she so sodeynly</p>
<p>Yaf him hir love, but that she gan enclyne</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">675</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To lyke him first, and I have told yow why;</p>
<p>And after that, his manhod and his pyne</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL677" id="TIIL677" class="pginternal">Made</a> love with-inne hir for to myne,</p>
<p>For which, by proces and by good servyse,</p>
<p>He gat hir love, and in no sodeyn wyse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">680</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">98. And also blisful Venus, wel arayed,</p>
<p>Sat in hir seventhe <a href="#TIINL681" id="TIIL681" class="pginternal">hous</a> of hevene tho,</p>
<p>Disposed wel, and with aspectes payed,</p>
<p>To helpen sely Troilus of his wo.</p>
<p>And, sooth to seyn, she nas nat al a fo</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">685</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To Troilus in his nativitee;</p>
<p>God woot that wel the soner spedde he.</p>
<p class="stanza">99. Now lat us stinte of Troilus a throwe,</p>
<p>That rydeth forth, and lat us tourne faste</p>
<p>Un-to Criseyde, that heng hir heed ful lowe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">690</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ther-as she sat allone, and gan to caste</p>
<p>Wher-on she wolde apoynte hir at the laste,</p>
<p>If it so were hir eem ne wolde cesse,</p>
<p>For Troilus, up-on hir for to presse.</p>
<p class="stanza">100. And, lord! so she gan in hir thought argue</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">695</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">In this matere of which I have yow told,</p>
<p>And what to doon best were, and what eschue,</p>
<p>That plyted she ful ofte in many fold.</p>
<p>Now was hir herte warm, now was it cold,</p>
<p>And what she thoughte somwhat shal I wryte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">700</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As to myn auctor listeth for to endyte.</p>
<p class="stanza">101. She thoughte wel, that Troilus persone</p>
<p>She knew by sighte and eek his gentillesse,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page211">{211}</span>And thus she seyde, 'al were it nought to
    done,</p>
<p>To graunte him love, yet, for his worthinesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">705</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It were honour, with pley and with gladnesse,</p>
<p>In honestee, with swich a lord to dele,</p>
<p>For myn estat, and also for his hele.</p>
<p class="stanza">102. Eek, wel wot I my kinges sone is he;</p>
<p>And sith he hath to see me swich delyt,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">710</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">If I wolde utterly his sighte flee,</p>
<p>Paraunter he mighte have me in dispyt,</p>
<p>Thurgh which I mighte stonde in worse plyt;</p>
<p>Now were I wys, me hate to purchace,</p>
<p>With-outen nede, ther I may stonde in grace?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">715</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">103. In every thing, I woot, ther lyth mesure.</p>
<p><a href="#TIINL716" id="TIIL716" class="pginternal">For though a man</a> forbede dronkenesse,</p>
<p>He nought for-bet that every creature</p>
<p>Be drinkelees for alwey, as I gesse;</p>
<p>Eek sith I woot for me is his distresse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">720</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I ne oughte not for that thing him despyse,</p>
<p>Sith it is so, he meneth in good wyse.</p>
<p class="stanza">104. And eek I knowe, of longe tyme agoon,</p>
<p>His thewes goode, and that he is not nyce.</p>
<p>Ne avauntour, seyth men, certein, is he noon;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">725</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To wys is he to do so gret a vyce;</p>
<p>Ne als I nel him never so cheryce,</p>
<p>That he may make avaunt, by Iuste cause;</p>
<p>He shal me never binde in swiche a clause.</p>
<p class="stanza">105. Now set a cas, the hardest is, y-wis,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">730</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Men mighten deme that he loveth me:</p>
<p>What dishonour were it un-to me, this?</p>
<p>May I him lette of that? why nay, pardee!</p>
<p>I knowe also, and alday here and see,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page212">{212}</span>Men loven wommen al this toun aboute;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">735</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be they the wers? why, nay, with-outen doute.</p>
<p class="stanza">106. I thenk eek how he able is for to have</p>
<p>Of al this noble toun the thriftieste,</p>
<p>To been his love, so she hir honour save;</p>
<p>For out and out he is the worthieste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">740</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Save only Ector, which that is the beste.</p>
<p>And yet his lyf al lyth now in my cure,</p>
<p>But swich is love, and eek myn aventure.</p>
<p class="stanza">107. Ne me to love, a wonder is it nought;</p>
<p>For wel wot I my-self, so god me spede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">745</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Al wolde I that noon wistë of this thought,</p>
<p>I am oon the <a href="#TIINL746" id="TIIL746" class="pginternal">fayreste</a>, out of drede,</p>
<p>And goodlieste, who-so taketh hede;</p>
<p>And so men seyn in al the toun of Troye.</p>
<p>What wonder is it though he of me have Ioye?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">750</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">108. I am <a href="#TIINL750" id="TIIL750" class="pginternal">myn owene woman</a>, wel at
    ese,</p>
<p>I thank it god, as after myn estat;</p>
<p>Right yong, and stonde unteyd in lusty <a href="#TIINL752" id="TIIL752" class="pginternal">lese</a>,</p>
<p>With-outen Ialousye or swich debat;</p>
<p>Shal noon housbonde seyn to me <a href="#TIINL754" id="TIIL754" class="pginternal">"chekmat!"</a></p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">755</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For either they ben ful of Ialousye,</p>
<p>Or maisterful, or loven novelrye.</p>
<p class="stanza">109. What shal I doon? to what fyn live I thus?</p>
<p>Shal I nat loven, in cas if that me leste?</p>
<p>What, <i>par dieux</i>! I am nought <a href="#TIINL759" id="TIIL759" class="pginternal">religious</a>!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">760</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And though that I myn herte sette at reste</p>
<p>Upon this knight, that is the worthieste,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page213">{213}</span>And kepe alwey myn honour and my name,</p>
<p>By alle right, it may do me no shame.'</p>
<p class="stanza">110. But right as whan the sonne shyneth brighte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">765</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">In March, that chaungeth ofte tyme his face,</p>
<p>And that a cloud is put with wind to flighte</p>
<p>Which <a href="#TIINL767" id="TIIL767" class="pginternal">over-sprat</a> the sonne as for a space,</p>
<p>A cloudy thought gan thorugh hir soule pace,</p>
<p>That over-spradde hir brighte thoughtes alle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">770</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So that for fere almost she gan to falle.</p>
<p class="stanza">111. That thought was this, 'allas! sin I am free,</p>
<p>Sholde I now love, and putte in Iupartye</p>
<p>My sikernesse, and thrallen libertee?</p>
<p>Allas! how dorste I thenken that folye?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">775</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">May I nought wel in other folk aspye</p>
<p>Hir dredful Ioye, hir constreynt, and hir peyne?</p>
<p>Ther loveth noon, that she nath <a href="#TIINL777" id="TIIL777" class="pginternal">why</a> to pleyne.</p>
<p class="stanza">112. For love is yet the moste stormy lyf,</p>
<p>Right of him-self, that ever was bigonne;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">780</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For ever som mistrust, or nyce stryf,</p>
<p>Ther is in love, som cloud is over the sonne:</p>
<p>Ther-to we wrecched wommen no-thing conne,</p>
<p>Whan us is wo, but wepe and sitte and thinke;</p>
<p>Our wreche is this, <a href="#TIINL784" id="TIIL784" class="pginternal">our owene wo to drinke</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">785</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">113. Also these wikked tonges been so prest</p>
<p>To speke us harm, eek men be so untrewe,</p>
<p>That, right anoon as cessed is hir lest,</p>
<p>So cesseth love, and forth to love a newe:</p>
<p>But harm y-doon, is doon, who-so it rewe.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">790</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For though these men for love hem first to-rende,</p>
<p>Ful sharp biginning breketh ofte at ende.</p>
<p class="stanza">114. How ofte tyme hath it y-knowen be,</p>
<p>The treson, that to womman hath be do?</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page214">{214}</span>To what fyn is swich love, I can nat see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">795</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or wher bicomth it, whan it is ago;</p>
<p>Ther is no wight that woot, I trowe so,</p>
<p>Wher it bycomth; lo, no wight on it <a href="#TIINL797" id="TIIL797" class="pginternal">sporneth</a>;</p>
<p>That erst was no-thing, in-to nought it torneth.</p>
<p class="stanza">115. How bisy, if I love, eek moste I be</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">800</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To plesen hem that Iangle of love, and demen,</p>
<p>And coye hem, that they sey non harm of me?</p>
<p>For though ther be no cause, yet hem semen</p>
<p>Al be for harm that folk hir freendes <a href="#TIINL802" id="TIIL802" class="pginternal">quemen</a>;</p>
<p>And who may stoppen every wikked tonge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">805</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or soun of belles whyl that they be ronge?'</p>
