<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">145</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And, with good herte, al holly your talent</p>
<p>Receyven wel, how sore that me smerte,</p>
<p>Lo, this mene I, myn owene swete herte.'</p>
<p class="stanza">22. Quod Pandarus, 'lo, here an hard request,</p>
<p>And resonable, a lady for to werne!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">150</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Now, nece myn, by <a href="#TIIINL150" id="TIIIL150" class="pginternal">natal Ioves fest</a>,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page249">{249}</span>Were I a god, ye sholde sterve as yerne,</p>
<p>That heren wel, this man wol no-thing yerne</p>
<p>But your honour, and seen him almost sterve,</p>
<p>And been so looth to suffren him yow serve.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">155</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">23. With that she gan hir eyen on him caste</p>
<p>Ful esily, and ful debonairly,</p>
<p>Avysing hir, and hyed not to faste</p>
<p>With never a word, but seyde him softely,</p>
<p>'Myn honour sauf, I wol wel trewely,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">160</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And in swich forme as he can now devyse,</p>
<p>Receyven him fully to my servyse,</p>
<p class="stanza">24. Biseching him, for goddes love, that he</p>
<p>Wolde, in honour of trouthe and gentilesse,</p>
<p>As I wel mene, eek mene wel to me,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">165</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And myn honour, with wit and besinesse,</p>
<p>Ay kepe; and if I may don him gladnesse,</p>
<p>From hennes-forth, y-wis, I nil not feyne:</p>
<p>Now beeth al hool, no lenger ye ne pleyne.</p>
<p class="stanza">25. But nathelees, this warne I yow,' quod she,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">170</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'A kinges sone al-though ye be, y-wis,</p>
<p>Ye shul na-more have soverainetee</p>
<p>Of me in love, than right in that cas is;</p>
<p>Ne I nil forbere, if that ye doon a-mis,</p>
<p>To wrathen yow; and whyl that ye me serve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">175</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Cherycen yow right after ye deserve.</p>
<p class="stanza">26. And shortly, derë herte and al my knight,</p>
<p>Beth glad, and draweth yow to lustinesse,</p>
<p>And I shal trewely, with al my might,</p>
<p>Your bittre tornen al in-to swetnesse;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">180</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">If I be she that may yow do gladnesse,</p>
<p>For every wo ye shal recovere a blisse';</p>
<p>And him in armes took, and gan him kisse.</p>
<p class="stanza">27. Fil Pandarus on knees, and up his yën</p>
<p>To hevene threw, and held his hondes hye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">185</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page250">{250}</span>'Immortal god!' quod he, 'that
    mayst nought dyen,</p>
<p>Cupide I mene, of this mayst glorifye;</p>
<p>And Venus, thou mayst make melodye;</p>
<p>With-outen hond, me semeth that in towne,</p>
<p>For this merveyle, I here <a href="#TIIINL188" id="TIIIL188" class="pginternal">ech belle sowne</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">190</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">28. But ho! no more as now of this matere,</p>
<p>For-why this folk wol comen up anoon,</p>
<p>That han the lettre red; lo, I hem here.</p>
<p>But I coniure thee, Criseyde, <a href="#TIIINL193" id="TIIIL193" class="pginternal">and oon</a>,</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL193" class="pginternal">And two</a>, thou Troilus, whan thow mayst goon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">195</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That at myn hous ye been at my warninge,</p>
<p>For I ful wel shal shape your cominge;</p>
<p class="stanza">29. And eseth ther your hertes right y-nough;</p>
<p>And lat see which of yow shal <a href="#TIIINL198" id="TIIIL198" class="pginternal">bere the belle</a></p>
<p>To speke of love a-right!' ther-with he lough,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">200</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'For ther have ye a layser for to telle.'</p>
<p>Quod Troilus, 'how longe shal I dwelle</p>
<p>Er this be doon?' Quod he, 'whan thou mayst ryse,</p>
<p>This thing shal be right as I yow devyse.'</p>
<p class="stanza">30. With that Eleyne and also Deiphebus</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">205</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Tho comen upward, right at the steyres ende;</p>
<p>And lord, so than gan grone Troilus,</p>
<p>His brother and his suster for to blende.</p>
<p>Quod Pandarus, 'it tyme is that we wende;</p>
<p>Tak, nece myn, your leve at alle three,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">210</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And lat hem speke, and cometh forth with me.'</p>
<p class="stanza">31. She took hir leve at hem ful thriftily,</p>
<p>As she wel coude, and they hir reverence</p>
<p>Un-to the fulle diden hardely,</p>
<p>And speken wonder wel, in hir absence,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">215</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of hir, in preysing of hir excellence,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page251">{251}</span>Hir governaunce, hir wit; and hir manere</p>
<p>Commendeden, it Ioye was to here.</p>
<p class="stanza">32. Now lat hir wende un-to hir owne place,</p>
<p>And torne we to Troilus a-yein,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">220</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That gan ful lightly of the lettre passe,</p>
<p>That Deiphebus hadde in the gardin seyn.</p>
<p>And of Eleyne and him he wolde fayn</p>
<p>Delivered been, and seyde, that him leste</p>
<p>To slepe, and after tales have reste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">225</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">33. Eleyne him kiste, and took hir leve blyve,</p>
<p>Deiphebus eek, and hoom wente every wight;</p>
<p>And Pandarus, as faste as he may dryve,</p>
<p>To Troilus tho com, <a href="#TIIINL228" id="TIIIL228" class="pginternal">as lyne right</a>;</p>
<p>And on a paillet, al that glade night,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">230</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">By Troilus he lay, with mery chere,</p>
<p>To tale; and wel was hem they were y-fere.</p>
<p class="stanza">34. Whan every wight was voided but they two,</p>
<p>And alle the dores were faste y-shette,</p>
<p>To telle in short, with-oute wordes mo,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">235</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This Pandarus, with-outen any lette,</p>
<p>Up roos, and on his beddes syde him sette,</p>
<p>And gan to speken in a sobre wyse</p>
<p>To Troilus, as I shal yow devyse.</p>
<p class="stanza">35. 'Myn alderlevest lord, and brother dere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">240</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">God woot, and thou, that it sat me so sore,</p>
<p>When I thee saw so languisshing to-yere,</p>
<p>For love, of which thy wo wex alwey more;</p>
<p>That I, with al my might and al my lore,</p>
<p>Have ever sithen doon my bisinesse</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">245</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To bringe thee to Ioye out of distresse;</p>
<p class="stanza">36. And have it brought to swich plyt as thou wost,</p>
<p>So that, thorugh me, thow stondest now in weye</p>
<p>To fare wel, I seye it for no bost,</p>
<p>And wostow why? for shame it is to seye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">250</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page252">{252}</span>For thee have I bigonne a gamen
    pleye</p>
<p>Which that I never doon shal eft for other,</p>
<p>Al-though he were a thousand fold my brother.</p>
<p class="stanza">37. That is to seye, for thee am I bicomen,</p>
<p>Bitwixen game and ernest, swich a mene</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">255</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As maken wommen un-to men to comen;</p>
<p>Al sey I nought, thou wost wel what I mene.</p>
<p>For thee have I my nece, of vyces clene,</p>
<p>So fully maad thy gentilesse triste,</p>
<p>That al shal been right as thy-selve liste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">260</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">38. But god, that al wot, take I to witnesse,</p>
<p>That never I this for coveityse wroughte,</p>
<p>But only for to abregge that distresse,</p>
<p>For which wel nygh thou deydest, as me thoughte.</p>
<p>But gode brother, do now as thee oughte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">265</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For goddes love, and keep hir out of blame,</p>
<p>Sin thou art wys, and save alwey hir name.</p>
<p class="stanza">39. For wel thou wost, the name as yet of here</p>
<p>Among the peple, as who seyth, halwed is;</p>
<p>For that man is unbore, I dar wel swere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">270</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That ever wiste that she dide amis.</p>
<p>But wo is me, that I, that cause al this,</p>
<p>May thenken that she is my nece dere,</p>
<p>And I hir eem, and traytor eek y-fere!</p>
<p class="stanza">40. And were it wist that I, through myn engyn,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">275</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hadde in my nece y-put this fantasye,</p>
<p>To do thy lust, and hoolly to be thyn,</p>
<p>Why, al the world up-on it wolde crye,</p>
<p>And seye, that I the worste trecherye</p>
<p>Dide in this cas, that ever was bigonne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">280</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And she for-lost, and thou right nought y-wonne.</p>
<p class="stanza">41. Wher-fore, er I wol ferther goon a pas,</p>
<p>Yet eft I thee biseche and fully seye,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page253">{253}</span>That privetee go with us in this cas,</p>
<p>That is to seye, that thou us never wreye;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">285</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And be nought wrooth, though I thee ofte preye</p>
<p>To holden secree swich an heigh matere;</p>
<p>For skilful is, thow wost wel, my preyere.</p>
<p class="stanza">42. And thenk what wo ther hath bitid er this,</p>
<p>For makinge of avauntes, as men rede;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">290</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And what mischaunce in this world yet ther is,</p>
<p>Fro day to day, right for that wikked dede;</p>
<p>For which these wyse clerkes that ben dede</p>
<p>Han ever yet proverbed to us yonge,</p>
<p>That <a href="#TIIINL294" id="TIIIL294" class="pginternal">"firste vertu is to kepe tonge."</a></p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">295</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">43. And, nere it that I wilne as now tabregge</p>
<p>Diffusioun of speche, I coude almost</p>
<p>A thousand olde stories thee alegge</p>
<p>Of wommen lost, thorugh fals and foles bost;</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL299" id="TIIIL299" class="pginternal">Proverbes canst thy-self</a> y-nowe, and wost,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">300</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ayeins that vyce, for to been a labbe,</p>
<p>Al seyde men sooth as often as they gabbe.</p>
<p class="stanza">44. O tonge, allas! so often here-biforn</p>
<p>Hastow made many a lady bright of hewe</p>
<p>Seyd, "welawey! the day that I was born!"</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">305</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And many a maydes sorwes for to newe;</p>
<p>And, for the more part, al is untrewe</p>
<p>That men of yelpe, and it were brought to preve;</p>
<p>Of kinde non avauntour <a href="#TIIINL308" id="TIIIL308" class="pginternal">is to leve</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">45. Avauntour and a lyere, al is on;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">310</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As thus: I pose, a womman graunte me</p>
<p>Hir love, and seyth that other wol she non,</p>
<p>And I am sworn to holden it secree,</p>
<p>And after I go telle it two or three;</p>
<p>Y-wis, I am avauntour at the leste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">315</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And lyere, for I breke my biheste.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page254">{254}</span>46. Now loke thanne, if they be
    nought to blame,</p>
<p>Swich maner folk; what shal I clepe hem, what,</p>
<p>That hem avaunte of wommen, and by name,</p>
<p>That never yet bihighte hem this ne that,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">320</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne knewe hem more than myn olde hat?</p>
<p>No wonder is, so god me sende hele,</p>
<p>Though wommen drede with us men to dele.</p>
<p class="stanza">47. I sey not this for no mistrust of yow,</p>
<p>Ne for no wys man, but for foles nyce,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">325</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And for the harm that in the world is now,</p>
<p>As wel for foly ofte as for malyce;</p>
<p>For wel wot I, in wyse folk, that vyce</p>
<p>No womman <a href="#TIIINL328" id="TIIIL328" class="pginternal">drat</a>, if she be wel avysed;</p>
<p>For wyse ben by foles harm chastysed.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">330</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">48. But now to purpos; leve brother dere,</p>
<p>Have al this thing that I have seyd in minde,</p>
<p>And keep thee clos, and be now of good chere,</p>
<p>For at thy day thou shalt me trewe finde.</p>
<p>I shal thy proces sette in swich a kinde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">335</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And god to-forn, that it shall thee suffyse,</p>
<p>For it shal been right as thou wolt devyse.</p>
<p class="stanza">49. For wel I woot, thou menest wel, parde;</p>
<p>Therfore I dar this fully undertake.</p>
<p>Thou wost eek what thy lady graunted thee,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">340</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIIINL340" id="TIIIL340" class="pginternal">And day is set</a>, the chartres up to
    make.</p>
<p>Have now good night, I may no lenger wake;</p>
<p>And bid for me, sin thou art now in blisse,</p>
<p>That god me sende deeth or sone lisse.'</p>
<p class="stanza">50. Who mighte telle half the Ioye or feste</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">345</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Which that the sowle of Troilus tho felte,</p>
<p>Heringe theffect of Pandarus biheste?</p>
<p>His olde wo, that made his herte swelte,</p>
<p>Gan tho for Ioye wasten and to-melte,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page255">{255}</span>And al the <a href="#TIIINL349" id="TIIIL349" class="pginternal">richesse</a> of his sykes sore</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">350</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">At ones fledde, he felte of hem no more.</p>
<p class="stanza">51. But right so as these holtes and these hayes,</p>
<p>That han in winter dede been and dreye,</p>
<p>Revesten hem in grene, whan that May is,</p>
<p>Whan every <a href="#TIIINL354" id="TIIIL354" class="pginternal">lusty</a> lyketh best to pleye:</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">355</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right in that selve wyse, sooth to seye,</p>
<p>Wex sodeynliche his herte ful of Ioye,</p>
<p>That gladder was ther never man in Troye.</p>
<p class="stanza">52. And gan his look on Pandarus up caste</p>
<p>Ful sobrely, and frendly for to see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">360</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde, 'freend, in Aprille the laste,</p>
<p>As wel thou wost, if it remembre thee,</p>
<p>How neigh the deeth for wo thou founde me;</p>
<p>And how thou didest al thy bisinesse</p>
<p>To knowe of me the cause of my distresse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">365</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">53. Thou wost how longe I it for-bar to seye</p>
<p>To thee, that art the man that I best triste;</p>
<p>And peril was it noon to thee by-wreye,</p>
<p>That wiste I wel; but tel me, if thee liste,</p>
<p>Sith I so looth was that thy-self it wiste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">370</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How dorste I mo tellen of this matere,</p>
<p>That quake now, and no wight may us here?</p>
<p class="stanza">54. But natheles, by that god I thee swere,</p>
<p>That, as him list, may al this world governe,</p>
<p>And, if I lye, Achilles with his spere</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">375</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Myn herte cleve, al were my lyf eterne,</p>
<p>As I am mortal, if I late or yerne</p>
<p>Wolde it biwreye, <a href="#TIIINL377" id="TIIIL377" class="pginternal">or dorste</a>, or sholde conne,</p>
<p>For al the good that god made under sonne;</p>
<p class="stanza">55. That rather deye I wolde, and determyne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">380</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As thinketh me, now <a href="#TIIINL380" id="TIIIL380" class="pginternal">stokked</a> in
    presoun,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page256">{256}</span>In wrecchednesse, in filthe, and in
    vermyne,</p>
<p>Caytif to cruel king Agamenoun;</p>
<p>And this, in alle the temples of this toun,</p>
<p>Upon the goddes alle, I wol thee swere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">385</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To-morwe day, if that thee lyketh here.</p>
<p class="stanza">56. And that thou hast so muche y-doon for me,</p>
<p>That I ne may it never-more deserve,</p>
<p>This knowe I wel, al mighte I now for thee</p>
<p>A thousand tymes on a morwen sterve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">390</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I can no more, but that I wol thee serve</p>
<p>Right as thy sclave, whider-so thou wende,</p>
<p>For ever-more, un-to my lyves ende!</p>
<p class="stanza">57. But here, with al myn herte, I thee biseche,</p>
<p>That never in me thou deme swich folye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">395</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As I shal seyn; me thoughte, by thy speche,</p>
<p>That this, which thou me dost for companye,</p>
<p>I sholde wene it were a bauderye;</p>
<p>I am nought wood, al-if I lewed be;</p>
<p>It is not so, that wool I wel, pardee.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">400</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">58. But he that goth, for gold or for richesse,</p>
<p>On swich message, calle him what thee list;</p>
<p>And this that thou dost, calle it gentilesse,</p>
<p>Compassioun, and felawship, and trist;</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL404" id="TIIIL404" class="pginternal">Departe it so</a>, for wyde-where is wist</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">405</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How that there is dyversitee requered</p>
<p>Bitwixen thinges lyke, as I have lered.</p>
<p class="stanza">59. And, that thou knowe I thenke nought ne wene</p>
<p>That this servyse a shame be or Iape,</p>
<p>I have my faire suster Polixene,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">410</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Cassandre, Eleyne, or any of the <a href="#TIIINL410" id="TIIIL410" class="pginternal">frape</a>;</p>
<p>Be she never so faire or wel y-shape,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page257">{257}</span>Tel me, which thou wilt of everichone,</p>
<p>To han for thyn, and lat me thanne allone.</p>
<p class="stanza">60. But sin that thou hast don me this servyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">415</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">My lyf to save, and for noon hope of mede,</p>
<p>So, for the love of god, this grete empryse</p>
<p>Parforme it out; for now is moste nede.</p>
<p>For high and low, with-outen any drede,</p>
<p>I wol alwey thyne hestes alle kepe;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">420</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Have now good night, and lat us bothe slepe.'</p>
<p class="stanza">61. Thus held him ech with other wel apayed,</p>
<p>That al the world ne mighte it bet amende;</p>
<p>And, on the morwe, whan they were arayed,</p>
<p>Ech to his owene nedes gan entende.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">425</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But Troilus, though as the fyr he brende</p>
<p>For sharp desyr of hope and of plesaunce,</p>
<p>He not for-gat his gode governaunce.</p>
<p class="stanza">62. But in him-self with manhod gan restreyne</p>
<p>Ech rakel dede and ech unbrydled chere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">430</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That alle tho that liven, sooth to seyne,</p>
<p>Ne sholde han wist, by word or by manere,</p>
<p>What that he mente, as touching this matere.</p>
<p>From every wight as fer as is the cloude</p>
<p>He was, so wel dissimulen he coude.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">435</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">63. And al the whyl which that I yow devyse,</p>
<p>This was his lyf; with al his fulle might,</p>
<p>By day he was in Martes high servyse,</p>
<p>This is to seyn, in armes as a knight;</p>
<p>And for the more part, the longe night</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">440</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He lay, and thoughte how that he mighte serve</p>
<p>His lady best, hir thank for to deserve.</p>
<p class="stanza">64. Nil I nought swerë, al-though he lay softe,</p>
<p>That in his thought he nas sumwhat disesed,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page258">{258}</span>Ne that he tornede on his pilwes ofte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">445</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And wolde of that him missed <a href="#TIIINL445" id="TIIIL445" class="pginternal">han ben
    sesed</a>;</p>
<p>But in swich cas man is nought alwey plesed,</p>
<p>For ought I wot, no more than was he;</p>
<p>That can I deme of possibilitee.</p>
<p class="stanza">65. But certeyn is, to purpos for to go,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">450</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That in this whyle, as writen is in geste,</p>
<p>He say his lady som-tyme; and also</p>
<p>She with him spak, whan that she dorste or leste,</p>
<p>And by hir bothe avys, as was the beste,</p>
<p>Apoynteden ful warly in this nede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">455</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So as they dorste, how they wolde procede.</p>
<p class="stanza">66. But it was spoken in so short a wyse,</p>
<p>In swich awayt alwey, and in swich fere,</p>
<p>Lest any wyght divynen or devyse</p>
<p>Wolde of hem two, or to it leye an ere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">460</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That al this world so leef to hem ne were</p>
<p>As that Cupido wolde hem grace sende</p>
<p>To maken of hir speche aright an ende.</p>
<p class="stanza">67. But thilke litel that they speke or wroughte,</p>
<p>His wyse goost took ay of al swich hede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">465</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It semed hir, he wiste what she thoughte</p>
<p>With-outen word, so that it was no nede</p>
<p>To bidde him ought to done, or ought for-bede;</p>
<p>For which she thoughte that love, al come it late,</p>
<p>Of alle Ioye hadde opned hir the yate.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">470</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">68. And shortly of this proces for to pace,</p>
<p>So wel his werk and wordes he bisette,</p>
<p>That he so ful stood in his lady grace,</p>
<p>That twenty thousand tymes, or she lette,</p>
<p>She thonked god she ever with him mette;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">475</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So coude he him governe in swich servyse,</p>
<p>That al the world ne mighte it bet devyse.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page259">{259}</span>69. For-why she fond him so
    discreet in al,</p>
<p>So secret, and of swich obëisaunce,</p>
<p>That wel she felte he was to hir a wal</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">480</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of steel, and sheld from every displesaunce;</p>
<p>That, to ben in his gode governaunce,</p>
<p>So wys he was, she was no more afered,</p>
<p>I mene, as fer as oughte ben requered.</p>
<p class="stanza">70. And Pandarus, to quike alwey the fyr,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">485</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Was ever y-lyke prest and diligent;</p>
<p>To ese his frend was set al his desyr.</p>
<p>He shof ay on, he to and fro was sent;</p>
<p>He lettres bar whan Troilus was absent.</p>
<p>That never man, as in his freendes nede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">490</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne bar him bet than he, with-outen drede.</p>
<p class="stanza">71. But now, paraunter, som man wayten wolde</p>
<p>That every word, or sonde, or look, or chere</p>
<p>Of Troilus that I rehersen sholde,</p>
<p>In al this whyle, un-to his lady dere;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">495</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I trowe it were a long thing for to here;</p>
<p>Or of what wight that stant in swich disioynte,</p>
<p>His wordes alle, or every look, <a href="#TIIINL497" id="TIIIL497" class="pginternal">to poynte</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">72. For sothe, I have not herd it doon er this,</p>
<p>In storye noon, ne no man here, I wene;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">500</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And though I wolde I coude not, y-wis;</p>
<p>For ther was som epistel hem bitwene,</p>
<p>That wolde, <a href="#TIIINL502" id="TIIIL502" class="pginternal">as seyth</a> myn auctor, wel contene</p>
<p>Neigh half this book, of which him list not wryte;</p>
<p>How sholde I thanne a lyne of it endyte?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">505</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">73. But to the grete effect: than sey I thus,</p>
<p>That stonding in concord and in quiete</p>
<p>Thise ilke two, Criseyde and Troilus,</p>
<p>As I have told, and in this tyme swete,</p>
<p>Save only often mighte they not mete,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">510</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page260">{260}</span>Ne layser have hir speches to <a href="#TIIINL510" id="TIIIL510" class="pginternal">fulfelle</a>,</p>
<p>That it befel right as I shal yow telle,</p>
<p class="stanza">74. That Pandarus, that ever dide his might</p>
<p>Right for the fyn that I shal speke of here,</p>
<p>As for to bringe to his hous som night</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">515</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">His faire nece, and Troilus y-fere,</p>
<p>Wher-as at leyser al this heigh matere,</p>
<p>Touching hir love, were at the fulle up-bounde,</p>
<p>Hadde out of doute a tyme to it founde.</p>
<p class="stanza">75. For he with greet deliberacioun</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">520</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hadde every thing that her-to mighte avayle</p>
<p>Forn-cast, and put in execucioun,</p>
<p>And neither laft, for cost ne for travayle;</p>
<p>Come if hem lest, hem sholde no-thing fayle;</p>
<p>And for to been in ought espyed there,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">525</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, wiste he wel, an inpossible were.</p>
<p class="stanza">76. <a href="#TIIINL526" id="TIIIL526" class="pginternal">Dredelees, it cleer</a> was in the
    wind</p>
<p>Of every pye and every lette-game;</p>
<p>Now al is wel, for al the world is blind</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL529" id="TIIIL529" class="pginternal">In this matere, bothe fremed</a> and tame.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">530</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This timber is al redy up to frame;</p>
<p>Us lakketh nought but that we witen wolde</p>
<p>A certein houre, in whiche she comen sholde.</p>
<p class="stanza">77. And Troilus, that al this purveyaunce</p>
<p>Knew at the fulle, and waytede on it ay,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">535</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hadde here-up-on eek made gret ordenaunce,</p>
<p>And founde his cause, and ther-to his aray,</p>
<p>If that he were missed, night or day,</p>
<p>Ther-whyle he was aboute this servyse,</p>
<p>That he was goon to doon his sacrifyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">540</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">78. And moste at swich a temple alone wake,</p>
<p>Answered of Appollo for to be;</p>
<p>And first, to seen the <a href="#TIIINL542" id="TIIIL542" class="pginternal">holy</a> laurer quake,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page261">{261}</span>Er that Apollo spak out of the tree,</p>
<p>To telle him next whan Grekes sholden flee,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">545</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And forthy <a href="#TIIINL545" id="TIIIL545" class="pginternal">lette</a> him no man, god
    forbede,</p>
<p>But preye Apollo helpen in this nede.</p>
<p class="stanza">79. Now is ther litel more for to done,</p>
<p>But Pandare up, and shortly for to seyne,</p>
<p>Right sone upon the chaunging of the mone,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">550</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Whan lightles is the world a night or tweyne,</p>
<p>And that the welken shoop him for to reyne,</p>
<p>He streight a-morwe un-to his nece wente;</p>
<p>Ye han wel herd the fyn of his entente.</p>
<p class="stanza">80. Whan he was come, he gan anoon to pleye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">555</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As he was wont, and of him-self to Iape;</p>
<p>And fynally, he swor and gan hir seye,</p>
<p>By this and that, she sholde him not escape,</p>
<p>Ne lengere doon him after hir to gape;</p>
<p>But certeynly she moste, by hir leve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">560</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Come soupen in his hous with him at eve.</p>
<p class="stanza">81. At whiche she lough, and gan hir faste excuse,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'it rayneth; lo, how sholde I goon?'</p>
<p>'Lat be,' quod he, 'ne stond not thus to muse;</p>
<p>This moot be doon, ye shal be ther anoon.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">565</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So at the laste her-of they felle at oon,</p>
<p>Or elles, softe he swor hir in hir ere,</p>
<p>He nolde never come ther she were.</p>
<p class="stanza">82. Sone after this, to him she gan to rowne,</p>
<p>And asked him if Troilus were there?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">570</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He swor hir, 'nay, for he was out of towne,'</p>
<p>And seyde, 'nece, I pose that he were,</p>
<p>Yow <a href="#TIIINL572" id="TIIIL572" class="pginternal">thurfte</a> never have the more fere.</p>
<p>For rather than men mighte him ther aspye,</p>
<p>Me were lever a thousand-fold to dye.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">575</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page262">{262}</span>83. Nought list myn
    auctor fully to declare</p>
<p>What that she thoughte whan he seyde so,</p>
<p>That Troilus was out of town y-fare,</p>
<p>As if he seyde ther-of sooth or no;</p>
<p>But that, with-oute awayt, with him to go,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">580</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">She graunted him, sith he hir that bisoughte,</p>
<p>And, as his nece, obeyed as hir oughte.</p>
<p class="stanza">84. But nathelees, yet gan she him biseche,</p>
<p>Al-though with him to goon it was no fere,</p>
<p>For to be war of <a href="#TIIINL584" id="TIIIL584" class="pginternal">goosish</a> peples speche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">585</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That dremen thinges whiche that never were,</p>
<p>And wel avyse him whom he broughte there;</p>
<p>And seyde him, 'eem, sin I mot on yow triste,</p>
<p>Loke al be wel, and do now as yow liste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">85. He swor hir, 'yis, by stokkes and by stones,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">590</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And by the goddes that in hevene dwelle,</p>
<p>Or elles were him lever, soule and bones,</p>
<p>With Pluto king as depe been in helle</p>
<p>As Tantalus!' What sholde I more telle?</p>
<p>Whan al was wel, he roos and took his leve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">595</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And she to souper com, whan it was eve,</p>
<p class="stanza">86. With a certayn of hir owene men,</p>
<p>And with hir faire nece Antigone,</p>
<p>And othere of hir wommen nyne or ten;</p>
<p>But who was glad now, who, as trowe ye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">600</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But Troilus, that stood and mighte it see</p>
<p>Thurgh-out a litel windowe in a <a href="#TIIINL601" id="TIIIL601" class="pginternal">stewe</a>,</p>
<p>Ther he <a href="#TIIINL602" id="TIIIL602" class="pginternal">bishet</a>, sin midnight, was in mewe,</p>
<p class="stanza">87. Unwist of every wight but of Pandare?</p>
<p>But to the poynt; now whan she was y-come</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">605</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page263">{263}</span>With alle Ioye, and alle frendes
    fare,</p>
<p>Hir eem anoon in armes hath hir nome,</p>
<p>And after to the souper, alle and some,</p>
<p>Whan tyme was, ful softe they hem sette;</p>
<p>God wot, ther was no deyntee <a href="#TIIINL609" id="TIIIL609" class="pginternal">for to fette</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">610</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">88. And after souper gonnen they to ryse,</p>
<p>At ese wel, with hertes fresshe and glade,</p>
<p>And wel was him that coude best devyse</p>
<p>To lyken hir, or that hir laughen made.</p>
<p>He song; she pleyde; he tolde tale of <a href="#TIIINL614" id="TIIIL614" class="pginternal">Wade</a>.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">615</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But at the laste, as every thing hath ende,</p>
<p>She took hir leve, and nedes wolde wende.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIIINL617" id="TIIIL617" class="pginternal">89</a>. But O, Fortune, executrice of
    wierdes,</p>
<p>O influences of thise hevenes hye!</p>
<p>Soth is, that, under god, ye ben our hierdes,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">620</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Though to us bestes been the causes wrye.</p>
<p>This mene I now, for she gan hoomward hye,</p>
<p>But execut was al <a href="#TIIINL622" id="TIIIL622" class="pginternal">bisyde hir leve</a>,</p>
<p>At the goddes wil; for which she moste bleve.</p>
<p class="stanza">90. The <a href="#TIIINL624" id="TIIIL624" class="pginternal">bente</a> mone with hir hornes
    pale,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">625</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Saturne, and Iove, <a href="#TIIINL625" id="TIIIL625" class="pginternal">in Cancro</a> ioyned
    were,</p>
<p>That swich a rayn from hevene gan avale,</p>
<p>That every maner womman that was there</p>
<p>Hadde of that smoky reyn a verray fere;</p>
<p>At which Pandare tho lough, and seyde thenne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">630</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Now were it tyme a lady to go henne!</p>
<p class="stanza">91. But goode nece, if I mighte ever plese</p>
<p>Yow any-thing, than prey I yow,' quod he,</p>
<p>'To doon myn herte as now so greet an ese</p>
<p>As for to dwelle here al this night with me,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">635</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For-why this is your owene hous, pardee.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page264">{264}</span>For, by my trouthe, I sey it nought
    a-game,</p>
<p>To wende as now, it were to me a shame.'</p>
<p class="stanza">92. Criseyde, whiche that coude as muche good</p>
<p>As half a world, tok hede of his preyere;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">640</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And sin it <a href="#TIIINL640" id="TIIIL640" class="pginternal">ron</a>, and al was on a
    flood,</p>
<p>She thoughte, as good chep may I dwellen here,</p>
<p>And graunte it gladly with a freendes chere,</p>
<p>And have a thank, as grucche and thanne abyde;</p>
<p>For hoom to goon it may nought wel bityde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">645</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">93. 'I wol,' quod she, 'myn uncle leef and dere,</p>
<p>Sin that yow list, it skile is to be so;</p>
<p>I am right glad with yow to dwellen here;</p>
<p>I seyde but <a href="#TIIINL648" id="TIIIL648" class="pginternal">a-game</a>, I wolde go.'</p>
<p>'Y-wis, graunt mercy, nece!' quod he tho;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">650</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Were it a game or no, soth for to telle,</p>
<p>Now am I glad, sin that yow list to dwelle.'</p>
<p class="stanza">94. Thus al is wel; but tho bigan aright</p>
<p>The newe Ioye, and al the feste agayn;</p>
<p>But Pandarus, if goodly hadde he might,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">655</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He wolde han hyed hir to bedde fayn,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'lord, this is an huge rayn!</p>
<p>This were a weder for to slepen inne;</p>
<p>And that I rede us sone to biginne.</p>
<p class="stanza">95. And nece, woot ye wher I wol yow leye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">660</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For that we shul not liggen fer asonder,</p>
<p>And for ye neither shullen, dar I seye,</p>
<p>Heren noise of reynes nor of thondre?</p>
<p>By god, right in my lyte closet yonder.</p>
<p>And I wol in that outer hous allone</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">665</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be wardeyn of your wommen everichone.</p>
<p class="stanza">96. And in this middel chaumbre that ye see</p>
<p>Shul youre wommen slepen wel and softe;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page265">{265}</span>And ther I seyde shal your-selve be;</p>
<p>And if ye liggen wel to-night, com ofte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">670</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And careth not what weder is on-lofte.</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL671" id="TIIIL671" class="pginternal">The wyn anon</a>, and whan so that yow leste,</p>
<p>So go we slepe, I trowe it be the beste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">97. Ther nis no more, but here-after sone,</p>
<p>The <a href="#TIIINL674" id="TIIIL674" class="pginternal">voydè</a> dronke, and travers drawe anon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">675</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Gan every wight, that hadde nought to done</p>
<p>More in that place, out of the chaumber gon.</p>
<p>And ever-mo so sternelich it ron,</p>
<p>And blew ther-with so wonderliche loude,</p>
<p>That wel neigh no man heren other coude.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">680</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">98. Tho Pandarus, hir eem, right as him oughte,</p>
<p>With women swiche as were hir most aboute,</p>
<p>Ful glad un-to hir beddes syde hir broughte,</p>
<p>And toke his leve, and gan ful lowe loute,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'here at this closet-dore with-oute,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">685</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right over-thwart, your wommen liggen alle,</p>
<p>That, whom yow liste of hem, ye may here calle.'</p>
<p class="stanza">99. So whan that she was in the closet leyd,</p>
<p>And alle hir wommen forth by ordenaunce</p>
<p>A-bedde weren, ther as I have seyd,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">690</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIIINL690" id="TIIIL690" class="pginternal">There</a> was no more to skippen nor to <a href="#TIIINL690" class="pginternal">traunce</a>,</p>
<p>But boden go to bedde, with mischaunce,</p>
<p>If any wight was steringe any-where,</p>
<p>And late hem slepe that a-bedde were.</p>
<p class="stanza">100. But Pandarus, that wel coude eche a del</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">695</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIIINL695" id="TIIIL695" class="pginternal">The olde daunce</a>, and every poynt
    ther-inne,</p>
<p>Whan that he <a href="#TIIINL696" id="TIIIL696" class="pginternal">sey</a> that alle thing was wel,</p>
<p>He thoughte he wolde up-on his werk biginne,</p>
<p>And gan the stewe-dore al softe un-pinne,</p>
<p>And stille as stoon, with-outen lenger lette,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">700</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">By Troilus a-doun right he him sette.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page266">{266}</span>101. And, shortly to the poynt
    right for to gon,</p>
<p>Of al this werk he tolde him <a href="#TIIINL702" id="TIIIL702" class="pginternal">word and ende</a>,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'make thee redy right anon,</p>
<p>For thou shalt in-to hevene blisse wende.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">705</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Now blisful Venus, thou me grace sende,'</p>
<p>Quod Troilus, 'for never yet no nede</p>
<p>Hadde I er now, ne halvendel the drede.'</p>
<p class="stanza">102. Quod Pandarus, 'ne drede thee never a del,</p>
<p>For it shal been right as thou wilt desyre;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">710</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So thryve I, this night shal I make it wel,</p>
<p>Or <a href="#TIIINL711" id="TIIIL711" class="pginternal">casten</a> al the gruwel in the fyre.'</p>
<p>'Yit blisful Venus, this night thou me enspyre,'</p>
<p>Quod Troilus, 'as wis as I thee serve,</p>
<p>And ever bet and bet shal, til I sterve.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">715</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">103. And if I hadde, O Venus ful of murthe,</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL716" id="TIIIL716" class="pginternal">Aspectes badde</a> of Mars or of Saturne,</p>
<p>Or thou <a href="#TIIINL717" id="TIIIL717" class="pginternal">combust</a> or <a href="#TIIINL717" class="pginternal">let</a> were
    in my birthe,</p>
<p>Thy fader prey al thilke harm disturne</p>
<p>Of grace, and that I glad ayein may turne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">720</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For love of him thou lovedest in the shawe,</p>
<p>I mene <a href="#TIIINL721" id="TIIIL721" class="pginternal">Adoon</a>, that with the boor was slawe.</p>
<p class="stanza">104. O Iove eek, for the love of faire <a href="#TIIINL722" id="TIIIL722" class="pginternal">Europe</a>,</p>
<p>The whiche in forme of bole away thou fette;</p>
<p>Now help, O Mars, thou with thy blody cope,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">725</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For love of <a href="#TIIINL725" id="TIIIL725" class="pginternal">Cipris</a>, thou me nought ne
    lette;</p>
<p>O Phebus, thenk whan <a href="#TIIINL726" id="TIIIL726" class="pginternal">Dane</a> hir-selven shette</p>
<p>Under the bark, and laurer wex for drede,</p>
<p>Yet for hir love, O help now at this nede!</p>
<p class="stanza">105. <a href="#TIIINL729" id="TIIIL729" class="pginternal">Mercurie</a>, for the love of <a href="#TIIINL729" class="pginternal">Hiersè</a> eke,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">730</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For which Pallas was with Aglauros wrooth,</p>
<p>Now help, and eek Diane, I thee biseke,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page267">{267}</span>That this viage be not to thee looth.</p>
<p>O <a href="#TIIINL733" id="TIIIL733" class="pginternal">fatal sustren</a>, which, er any clooth</p>
<p>Me shapen was, my destenè me sponne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">735</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So helpeth to this werk that is bi-gonne!'</p>
<p class="stanza">106. Quod Pandarus, 'thou wrecched mouses herte,</p>
<p>Art thou agast so that she wol thee byte?</p>
<p>Why, don this furred cloke up-on thy sherte,</p>
<p>And folowe me, for I wol han the wyte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">740</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But byd, and lat me go bifore a lyte.'</p>
<p>And with that word he gan un-do a trappe,</p>
<p>And Troilus he broughte in by the lappe.</p>
<p class="stanza">107. The sterne wind so loude gan to route</p>
<p>That no wight other noyse mighte here;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">745</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And they that layen at the dore with-oute,</p>
<p>Ful sykerly they slepten alle y-fere;</p>
<p>And Pandarus, with a ful sobre chere,</p>
<p>Goth to the dore anon with-outen lette,</p>
<p>Ther-as they laye, and softely it shette.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">750</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">108. And as he com ayeinward prively,</p>
<p>His nece awook, and asked 'who goth there?'</p>
<p>'My dere nece,' quod he, 'it am I;</p>
<p>Ne wondreth not, ne have of it no fere;'</p>
<p>And ner he com, and seyde hir in hir ere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">755</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'No word, for love of god I yow biseche;</p>
<p>Lat no wight ryse and heren of our speche.'</p>
<p class="stanza">109. 'What! which wey be ye comen, <i>benedicite</i>?'</p>
<p>Quod she, 'and how thus unwist of hem alle?'</p>
<p>'Here at this secre trappe-dore,' quod he.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">760</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Quod tho Criseyde, 'lat me som wight calle.'</p>
<p>'Ey! god forbede that it sholde falle,'</p>
<p>Quod Pandarus, 'that ye swich foly wroughte!</p>
<p>They mighte deme thing they never er thoughte!</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page268">{268}</span>110. It is nought good a <a href="#TIIINL764" id="TIIIL764" class="pginternal">sleping hound</a> to wake,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">765</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne yeve a wight a cause to devyne;</p>
<p>Your wommen slepen alle, I under-take,</p>
<p>So that, for hem, the hous men mighte myne;</p>
<p>And slepen wolen til the sonne shyne.</p>
<p>And whan my tale al brought is to an ende,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">770</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Unwist, right as I com, so wol I wende.</p>
<p class="stanza">111. Now nece myn, ye shul wel understonde,'</p>
<p>Quod he, 'so as ye wommen demen alle,</p>
<p>That for to holde in love a man <a href="#TIIINL773" id="TIIIL773" class="pginternal">in honde</a>,</p>
<p>And him hir "leef" and "dere herte" calle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">775</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And maken him <a href="#TIIINL775" id="TIIIL775" class="pginternal">an howve</a> above a
    calle,</p>
<p>I mene, as love an other in this whyle,</p>
<p>She doth hir-self a shame, and him a gyle.</p>
<p class="stanza">112. Now wherby that I telle yow al this?</p>
<p>Ye woot your-self, as wel as any wight,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">780</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How that your love al fully graunted is</p>
<p>To Troilus, the worthieste knight,</p>
<p>Oon of this world, and ther-to trouthe plyght,</p>
<p>That, but it were on him along, ye nolde</p>
<p>Him never falsen, whyl ye liven sholde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">785</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">113. Now stant it thus, that sith I fro yow wente,</p>
<p>This Troilus, right platly for to seyn,</p>
<p>Is thurgh a goter, by a privè wente,</p>
<p>In-to my chaumbre come in al this reyn,</p>
<p>Unwist of every maner wight, certeyn,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">790</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Save of my-self, as wisly have I Ioye,</p>
<p>And by that feith I <a href="#TIIINL791" id="TIIIL791" class="pginternal">shal</a> Pryam of Troye!</p>
<p class="stanza">114. And he is come in swich peyne and distresse</p>
<p>That, but he be al fully wood by this,</p>
<p>He sodeynly mot falle in-to wodnesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">795</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But-if god helpe; and cause why this is,</p>
<p>He seyth him told is, of a freend of his,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page269">{269}</span>How that ye <a href="#TIIINL797" id="TIIIL797" class="pginternal">sholde love</a> oon that hatte Horaste,</p>
<p>For sorwe of which this night shalt been his laste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">115. Criseyde, which that al this wonder herde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">800</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Gan sodeynly aboute hir herte colde,</p>
<p>And with a syk she sorwfully answerde,</p>
<p>'Allas! I wende, who-so tales tolde,</p>
<p>My dere herte wolde me not holde</p>
<p>So lightly fals! allas! conceytes wronge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">805</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">What harm they doon, for now live I to longe!</p>
<p class="stanza">116. Horaste! allas! and falsen Troilus?</p>
<p>I knowe him not, god helpe me so,' quod she;</p>
<p>'Allas! what wikked spirit tolde him thus?</p>
<p>Now certes, eem, to-morwe, and I him see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">810</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I shal ther-of as ful excusen me</p>
<p>As ever dide womman, if him lyke';</p>
<p>And with that word she gan ful sore syke.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIIINL813" id="TIIIL813" class="pginternal">117</a>. 'O god!' quod she, 'so worldly
    selinesse,</p>
<p>Which clerkes callen fals felicitee,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">815</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Y-medled is with many a bitternesse!</p>
<p>Ful anguisshous than is, god woot,' quod she,</p>
<p>'Condicioun of veyn prosperitee;</p>
<p>For either Ioyes comen nought y-fere,</p>
<p>Or elles no wight hath hem alwey here.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">820</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">118. O brotel wele of mannes Ioye unstable!</p>
<p>With what wight so thou be, or how thou pleye,</p>
<p>Either he woot that thou, Ioye, art muable,</p>
<p>Or woot it not, it moot ben oon of tweye;</p>
<p>Now if he woot it not, how may he seye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">825</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That he hath verray Ioye and selinesse,</p>
<p>That is of ignoraunce ay in derknesse?</p>
<p class="stanza">119. Now if he woot that Ioye is transitorie,</p>
<p>As every Ioye of worldly thing mot flee,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page270">{270}</span>Than every tyme he that hath in memorie,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">830</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">The drede of lesing maketh him that he</p>
<p>May in no parfit selinesse be.</p>
<p>And if to lese his Ioye he set a myte,</p>
<p>Than semeth it that Ioye is worth ful lyte.</p>
<p class="stanza">120. Wherfore I wol deffyne in this matere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">835</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That trewely, for ought I can espye,</p>
<p>Ther is no verray wele in this world here.</p>
<p>But O, thou wikked serpent Ialousye,</p>
<p>Thou misbeleved and envious folye,</p>
<p>Why hastow Troilus me mad <a href="#TIIINL839" id="TIIIL839" class="pginternal">untriste</a>,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">840</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That never yet agilte him, that I wiste?'</p>
<p class="stanza">121. Quod Pandarus, 'thus fallen is this cas.'</p>
<p>'Why, uncle myn,' quod she, 'who tolde him this?</p>
<p>Why doth my dere herte thus, allas?'</p>
<p>'Ye woot, ye nece myn,' quod he, 'what is;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">845</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I hope al shal be wel that is amis.</p>
<p>For ye may quenche al this, if that yow leste,</p>
<p>And doth right so, for I holde it the beste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">122. 'So shal I do to-morwe, y-wis,' quod she,</p>
<p>'And god to-forn, so that it shal suffyse.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">850</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'To-morwe? allas, that were a fayr,' quod he,</p>
<p>'Nay, nay, it may not stonden in this wyse;</p>
<p>For, nece myn, thus wryten clerkes wyse,</p>
<p>That peril is with drecching in <a href="#TIIINL853" id="TIIIL853" class="pginternal">y-drawe</a>;</p>
<p>Nay, swich abodes been nought worth an hawe.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">855</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">123. <a href="#TIIINL855" id="TIIIL855" class="pginternal">Nece</a>, al thing hath tyme, I
    dar avowe;</p>
<p>For whan a chaumber a-fyr is, or an halle,</p>
<p>Wel more nede is, it sodeynly rescowe</p>
<p>Than to dispute, and axe amonges alle</p>
<p>How is this candele in the straw y-falle?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">860</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page271">{271}</span>A! <i>benedicite!</i> for al
    among that fare</p>
<p>The harm is doon, and <a href="#TIIINL861" id="TIIIL861" class="pginternal">fare-wel feldefare</a>!</p>
<p class="stanza">124. And, nece myn, ne take it not a-greef,</p>
<p>If that ye suffre him al night in this wo,</p>
<p>God help me so, ye hadde him never leef,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">865</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That dar I seyn, now there is but we two;</p>
<p>But wel I woot, that ye wol not do so;</p>
<p>Ye been to wys to do so gret folye,</p>
<p>To putte his lyf al night in Iupartye.'</p>
<p class="stanza">125. 'Hadde I him never leef? By god, I wene</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">870</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ye hadde never thing so leef,' quod she.</p>
<p>'Now by my thrift,' quod he, 'that shal be sene;</p>
<p>For, sin ye make this ensample of me,</p>
<p>If I al night wolde him in sorwe see</p>
<p>For al the tresour in the toun of Troye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">875</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I bidde god, I never mote have Ioye!</p>
<p class="stanza">126. Now loke thanne, if ye, that been his love,</p>
<p>Shul putte al night his lyf in Iupartye</p>
<p>For thing of nought! Now, by that god above,</p>
<p>Nought only this delay comth of folye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">880</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But of malyce, if that I shal nought lye.</p>
<p>What, platly, and ye suffre him in distresse,</p>
<p>Ye neither bountee doon ne gentilesse!'</p>
<p class="stanza">127. Quod tho Criseyde, 'wole ye doon o thing,</p>
<p>And ye therwith shal stinte al his disese;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">885</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Have here, and bereth him this <a href="#TIIINL885" id="TIIIL885" class="pginternal">blewe</a>
    ringe,</p>
<p>For ther is no-thing mighte him bettre plese,</p>
<p>Save I my-self, ne more his herte apese;</p>
<p>And sey my dere herte, that his sorwe</p>
<p>Is causeles, that shal be seen to-morwe.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">890</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">128. 'A ring?' quod he, 'ye, <a href="#TIIINL890" id="TIIIL890" class="pginternal">hasel-wodes shaken</a>!</p>
<p>Ye, nece myn, that ring moste han a stoon</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page272">{272}</span>That mighte dede men alyve maken;</p>
<p>And swich a ring, trowe I that ye have noon.</p>
<p>Discrecioun out of your heed is goon;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">895</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That fele I now,' quod he, 'and that is routhe;</p>
<p>O tyme y-lost, wel maystow cursen slouthe!</p>
<p class="stanza">129. Wot ye not wel that noble and heigh corage</p>
<p>Ne sorweth not, ne stinteth eek for lyte?</p>
<p>But if a fool were in a Ialous rage,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">900</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I nolde setten at his sorwe a myte,</p>
<p>But <a href="#TIIINL901" id="TIIIL901" class="pginternal">feffe him</a> with a fewe wordes <a href="#TIIINL901" class="pginternal">whyte</a></p>
<p>Another day, whan that I mighte him finde:</p>
<p>But this thing stont al in another kinde.</p>
<p class="stanza">130. This is so gentil and so tendre of herte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">905</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That with his deeth he wol his sorwes wreke;</p>
<p>For trusteth wel, how sore that him smerte,</p>
<p>He wol to yow no Ialouse wordes speke.</p>
<p>And for-thy, nece, er that his herte breke,</p>
<p>So spek your-self to him of this matere;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">910</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For with o word ye may his herte stere.</p>
<p class="stanza">131. Now have I told what peril he is inne,</p>
<p>And his coming unwist is to every wight;</p>
<p>Ne, pardee, harm may ther be noon ne sinne;</p>
<p>I wol my-self be with yow al this night.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">915</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ye knowe eek how it is your owne knight,</p>
<p>And that, by right, ye moste upon him triste,</p>
<p>And I al prest to fecche him whan yow liste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">132. This accident so pitous was to here,</p>
<p>And eek so lyk a sooth, <a href="#TIIINL919" id="TIIIL919" class="pginternal">at pryme face</a>,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">920</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And Troilus hir knight to hir so dere,</p>
<p>His privè coming, and the siker place,</p>
<p>That, though that she dide him as thanne a grace,</p>
<p>Considered alle thinges as they stode,</p>
<p>No wonder is, sin she dide al for gode.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">925</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page273">{273}</span>133. Cryseyde answerde,
    'as wisly god at reste</p>
<p>My sowle bringe, as me is for him wo!</p>
<p>And eem, y-wis, fayn wolde I doon the beste,</p>
<p>If that I hadde grace to do so.</p>
<p>But whether that ye dwelle or for him go,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">930</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I am, til god me bettre minde sende,</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL931" id="TIIIL931" class="pginternal">At dulcarnon</a>, right at my wittes ende.'</p>
<p class="stanza">134. Quod Pandarus, 'ye, nece, wol ye here?</p>
<p>Dulcarnon called is "fleminge of wrecches";</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL934" id="TIIIL934" class="pginternal">It</a> semeth hard, for wrecches wol not lere</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">935</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For verray slouthe or othere wilful tecches;</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL936" id="TIIIL936" class="pginternal">This</a> seyd by hem that be not worth two <a href="#TIIINL936" class="pginternal">fecches</a>.</p>
<p>But ye ben wys, and that we han on honde</p>
<p>Nis neither hard, ne skilful to withstonde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">135. 'Thanne, eem,' quod she, 'doth her-of as yow list;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">940</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But er he come I wil up first aryse;</p>
<p>And, for the love of god, sin al my trist</p>
<p>Is on yow two, and ye ben bothe wyse,</p>
<p>So wircheth now in so discreet a wyse,</p>
<p>That I honour may have, and he plesaunce;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">945</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For I am here al in your governaunce.'</p>
<p class="stanza">136. 'That is wel seyd,' quod he, 'my nece dere,</p>
<p>Ther good thrift <a href="#TIIINL947" id="TIIIL947" class="pginternal">on</a> that wyse gentil herte!</p>
<p>But liggeth stille, and taketh him right here,</p>
<p>It nedeth not no ferther for him sterte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">950</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And ech of yow ese otheres sorwes smerte,</p>
<p>For love of god; and, Venus, I thee herie;</p>
<p>For sone hope I we shulle ben alle merie.'</p>
<p class="stanza">137. This Troilus ful sone on knees him sette</p>
<p>Ful sobrely, right by hir beddes heed,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">955</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And in his beste wyse his lady grette;</p>
<p>But lord, so she wex sodeynliche reed!</p>
<p>Ne, though men sholden smyten of hir heed,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page274">{274}</span>She coude nought a word a-right out-bringe</p>
<p>So sodeynly, for his sodeyn cominge.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">960</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">138. But Pandarus, that so wel coude fele</p>
<p>In every thing, to pleye anoon bigan,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'nece, see how this lord can knele!</p>
<p>Now, for your trouthe, seeth this gentil man!'</p>
<p>And with that word he for a quisshen ran,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">965</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde, 'kneleth now, whyl that yow leste,</p>
<p>Ther god your hertes bringe sone at reste!'</p>
<p class="stanza">139. Can I not seyn, for she bad him not ryse,</p>
<p>If sorwe it putte out of hir remembraunce,</p>
<p>Or elles if she toke it in the wyse</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">970</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of duëtee, as for his observaunce;</p>
<p>But wel finde I she dide him this plesaunce,</p>
<p>That she him kiste, al-though she syked sore;</p>
<p>And bad him sitte a-doun with-outen more.</p>
<p class="stanza">140. Quod Pandarus, 'now wol ye wel biginne;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">975</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Now doth him sitte, gode nece dere,</p>
<p>Upon your beddes syde al there with-inne,</p>
<p>That ech of yow the bet may other here.'</p>
<p>And with that word he drow him to the <a href="#TIIINL978" id="TIIIL978" class="pginternal">fere</a>,</p>
<p>And took a light, and <a href="#TIIINL979" id="TIIIL979" class="pginternal">fond his contenaunce</a></p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">980</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As for to loke up-on an old romaunce.</p>
<p class="stanza">141. Criseyde, that was Troilus lady right,</p>
<p>And cleer stood on a ground of sikernesse,</p>
<p>Al thoughte she, hir servaunt and hir knight</p>
<p>Ne sholde of right non untrouthe in hir gesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">985</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Yet nathelees, considered his distresse,</p>
<p>And that love is in cause of swich folye,</p>
<p>Thus to him spak she of his Ielousye:</p>
<p class="stanza">142. 'Lo, herte myn, as wolde the excellence</p>
<p>Of love, ayeins the which that no man may,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">990</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page275">{275}</span>Ne oughte eek goodly maken
    resistence</p>
<p>And eek bycause I felte wel and say</p>
<p>Your grete trouthe, and servyse every day;</p>
<p>And that your herte al myn was, sooth to seyne,</p>
<p>This droof me for to rewe up-on your peyne.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">995</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">143. And your goodnesse have I founde alwey yit,</p>
<p>Of whiche, my dere herte and al my knight,</p>
<p>I thonke it yow, as fer as I have wit,</p>
<p>Al can I nought as muche as it were right;</p>
<p>And I, emforth my conninge and my might,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1000</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Have and ay shal, how sore that me smerte,</p>
<p>Ben to yow trewe and hool, with al myn herte;</p>
<p class="stanza">144. And dredelees, that shal be founde at preve.—-</p>
<p>But, herte myn, what al this is to seyne</p>
<p>Shal wel be told, so that ye noght yow greve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1005</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Though I to yow right on your-self compleyne.</p>
<p>For ther-with mene I fynally the peyne,</p>
<p>That halt your herte and myn in hevinesse,</p>
<p>Fully to sleen, and every wrong redresse.</p>
<p class="stanza">145. My goode, myn, not I for-why ne how</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1010</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That Ialousye, allas! that wikked <a href="#TIIINL1010" id="TIIIL1010" class="pginternal">wivere</a>,</p>
<p>Thus causelees is cropen in-to yow;</p>
<p>The harm of which I wolde fayn delivere!</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL1013" id="TIIIL1013" class="pginternal">Allas! that he,</a> al hool, or of him slivere,</p>
<p>Shuld have his refut in so digne a place,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1015</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ther Iove him sone out of your herte arace!</p>
<p class="stanza">146. But O, thou Iove, O auctor of nature,</p>
<p>Is this an honour to thy deitee,</p>
<p>That folk ungiltif suffren here iniure,</p>
<p>And who that giltif is, al quit goth he?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1020</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">O were it leful for to pleyne on thee,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page276">{276}</span>That <a href="#TIIINL1021" id="TIIIL1021" class="pginternal">undeserved</a> suffrest Ialousye,</p>
<p>And that I wolde up-on thee pleyne and crye!</p>
<p class="stanza">147. Eek al my wo is this, that folk now usen</p>
<p>To seyn right thus, "ye, Ialousye is love!"</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1025</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And wolde a busshel venim al excusen,</p>
<p>For that o greyn of love is on it shove!</p>
<p>But that wot heighe god that sit above,</p>
<p>If it be lyker love, or hate, or grame;</p>
<p>And <a href="#TIIINL1029" id="TIIIL1029" class="pginternal">after that</a>, it oughte bere <a href="#TIIINL1029" class="pginternal">his</a> name.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1030</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">148. But certeyn is, som maner Ialousye</p>
<p>Is excusable more than som, y-wis.</p>
<p>As whan cause is, and som swich fantasye</p>
<p>With pietee so wel repressed is,</p>
<p>That it unnethe dooth or seyth amis,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1035</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But goodly <a href="#TIIINL1035" id="TIIIL1035" class="pginternal">drinketh up</a> al his
    distresse;</p>
<p>And that excuse I, for the gentilesse.</p>
<p class="stanza">149. And som so ful of furie is and despyt,</p>
<p>That it sourmounteth his repressioun;</p>
<p>But herte myn, ye be not in that plyt,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1040</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thanke I god, for whiche your passioun</p>
<p>I wol not calle it but illusioun,</p>
<p>Of habundaunce of love and bisy cure,</p>
<p>That dooth your herte this disese endure.</p>
<p class="stanza">150. Of which I am right sory, but not wrooth;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1045</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But, for my devoir and your hertes reste,</p>
<p>Wher-so yow list, by <a href="#TIIINL1046" id="TIIIL1046" class="pginternal">ordal</a> or by ooth,</p>
<p>By sort, or in what wyse so yow leste,</p>
<p>For love of god, lat preve it for the beste!</p>
<p>And if that I be giltif, do me deye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1050</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Allas! what mighte I more doon or seye?'</p>
<p class="stanza">151. With that a fewe brighte teres newe</p>
<p>Out of hir eyen fille, and thus she seyde,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page277">{277}</span>'Now god, thou wost, in thought ne dede
    untrewe</p>
<p>To Troilus was never yet Criseyde.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1055</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">With that hir heed doun in the bed she leyde,</p>
<p>And with the shete it <a href="#TIIINL1056" id="TIIIL1056" class="pginternal">wreigh</a>, and syghed sore,</p>
<p>And held hir pees; not o word spak she more.</p>
<p class="stanza">152. But now help god to quenchen al this sorwe,</p>
<p>So hope I that he shal, for he best may;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1060</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For I have seyn, of a ful misty morwe</p>
<p>Folwen ful ofte a mery someres day;</p>
<p>And after winter folweth grene May.</p>
<p>Men seen alday, and reden eek in stories,</p>
<p>That after sharpe <a href="#TIIINL1064" id="TIIIL1064" class="pginternal">shoures</a> been victories.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1065</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">153. This Troilus, whan he hir wordes herde,</p>
<p>Have ye no care, him liste not to slepe;</p>
<p>For it thoughte him <a href="#TIIINL1067" id="TIIIL1067" class="pginternal">no strokes of a yerde</a></p>
<p>To here or seen Criseyde his lady wepe;</p>
<p>But wel he felte aboute his herte crepe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1070</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For every teer which that Criseyde asterte,</p>
<p>The crampe of deeth, to streyne him by the herte.</p>
<p class="stanza">154. And in his minde he gan the tyme acurse</p>
<p>That he cam therë, and that he was born;</p>
<p>For now is wikke y-turned in-to worse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1075</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And al that labour he hath doon biforn,</p>
<p>He wende it lost, he thoughte he nas but lorn.</p>
<p>'O Pandarus,' thoughte he, 'allas! thy wyle</p>
<p>Serveth of nought, so weylawey the whyle!'</p>
<p class="stanza">155. And therwithal he heng a-doun the heed,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1080</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And fil on knees, and sorwfully he sighte;</p>
<p>What mighte he seyn? he felte he nas but deed,</p>
<p>For wrooth was she that shulde his sorwes lighte.</p>
<p>But nathelees, whan that he speken mighte,</p>
<p>Than seyde he thus, 'god woot, that of this game,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1085</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Whan al is wist, than am I not to blame!'</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page278">{278}</span>156. Ther-with the sorwe so his
    herte shette,</p>
<p>That from his eyen fil ther not a tere,</p>
<p>And every spirit his vigour in-knette,</p>
<p>So they astoned and oppressed were.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1090</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">The feling of his sorwe, or of his fere,</p>
<p>Or of ought elles, fled was out of towne;</p>
<p>And doun he fel al sodeynly a-swowne.</p>
<p class="stanza">157. This was no litel sorwe for to see;</p>
<p>But al was hust, and Pandare up as faste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1095</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'O nece, pees, or we be lost,' quod he,</p>
<p>Beth nought agast;' but certeyn, at the laste,</p>
<p>For this or that, he in-to bedde him caste,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'O theef, is this a mannes herte?'</p>
<p>And of he rente al to his bare sherte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1100</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">158. And seyde, 'nece, but ye helpe us now,</p>
<p>Allas, your owne Troilus is lorn!'</p>
<p>'Y-wis, so wolde I, and I wiste how,</p>
<p>Ful fayn,' quod she; 'allas! that I was born!'</p>
<p>'Ye, nece, wol ye pullen out the thorn</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1105</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That stiketh in his herte?' quod Pandare;</p>
<p>'Sey "<a href="#TIIINL1067" class="pginternal">al foryeve</a>," and <a href="#TIIINL1106" id="TIIIL1106" class="pginternal">stint</a> is al this fare!'</p>
<p class="stanza">159. 'Ye, that to me,' quod she, 'ful lever were</p>
<p>Than al the good the sonne aboute gooth';</p>
<p>And therwith-al she swoor him in his ere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1110</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Y-wis, my dere herte, I am nought wrooth,</p>
<p>Have here my trouthe and many another ooth;</p>
<p>Now speek to me, for it am I, Cryseyde!'</p>
<p>But al for nought; yet mighte he not a-breyde.</p>
<p class="stanza">160. Therwith his pous and pawmes of his hondes</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1115</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">They gan to frote, and wete his temples tweyne,</p>
<p>And, to deliveren him from bittre bondes,</p>
<p>She ofte him kiste; and, shortly for to seyne,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page279">{279}</span>Him to revoken she dide al hir peyne.</p>
<p>And at the laste, he gan his breeth to drawe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1120</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And of his swough sone after that adawe,</p>
<p class="stanza">161. And gan bet minde and reson to him take,</p>
<p>But wonder sore he was abayst, y-wis.</p>
<p>And with a syk, whan he gan bet a-wake,</p>
<p>He seyde, 'O mercy, god, what thing is this?'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1125</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Why do ye with your-selven thus amis?'</p>
<p>Quod tho Criseyde, 'is this a mannes game?</p>
<p>What, Troilus! wol ye do thus, for shame?'</p>
<p class="stanza">162. And therwith-al hir arm over him she leyde,</p>
<p>And al foryaf, and ofte tyme him keste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1130</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He thonked hir, and to hir spak, and seyde</p>
<p>As fil to purpos for his herte reste.</p>
<p>And she to that answerde him as hir leste;</p>
<p>And with hir goodly wordes him disporte</p>
<p>She gan, and ofte his sorwes to comforte.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1135</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">163. Quod Pandarus, 'for ought I can espyen,</p>
<p>This light nor I ne serven here of nought;</p>
<p>Light is not good for syke folkes yën.</p>
<p>But for the love of god, sin ye be brought</p>
<p>In thus good plyt, lat now non hevy thought</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1140</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ben hanginge in the hertes of yow tweye:'</p>
<p>And bar the candele to the chimeneye.</p>
<p class="stanza">164. Sone after this, though it no nede were,</p>
<p>Whan she swich othes as hir list devyse</p>
<p>Hadde of him take, hir thoughte tho no fere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1145</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne cause eek non, to bidde him thennes ryse.</p>
<p>Yet lesse thing than othes may suffyse</p>
<p>In many a cas; for every wight, I gesse,</p>
<p>That loveth wel meneth but gentilesse.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page280">{280}</span>165. But in effect she wolde
    wite anoon</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1150</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of what man, and eek where, and also why</p>
<p>He Ielous was, sin ther was cause noon;</p>
<p>And eek the signe, that he took it by,</p>
<p>She bad him that to telle hir bisily,</p>
<p>Or elles, certeyn, she <a href="#TIIINL1154" id="TIIIL1154" class="pginternal">bar him on honde,</a></p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1155</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That this was doon of malis, hir to fonde.</p>
<p class="stanza">166. With-outen more, shortly for to seyne,</p>
<p>He moste obeye un-to his lady heste;</p>
<p>And for the lasse harm, he moste feyne.</p>
<p>He seyde hir, whan she was at swiche a feste</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1160</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">She mighte on him han loked at the leste;</p>
<p>Not I not what, al dere y-nough a risshe,</p>
<p>As he that nedes moste a cause fisshe.</p>
<p class="stanza">167. And she answerde, 'swete, al were it so,</p>
<p>What harm was that, sin I non yvel mene?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1165</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For, by that god that boughte us bothe two,</p>
<p>In alle thinge is myn entente clene.</p>
<p>Swich arguments ne been not worth a bene;</p>
<p>Wol ye the childish Ialous contrefete?</p>
<p>Now were it worthy that ye were y-bete.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1170</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">168. Tho Troilus gan sorwfully to syke,</p>
<p>Lest she be wrooth, him thoughte his herte deyde;</p>
<p>And seyde, 'allas! upon my sorwes syke</p>
<p>Have mercy, swete herte myn, Cryseyde!</p>
<p>And if that, in tho wordes that I seyde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1175</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be any wrong, I wol no more trespace;</p>
<p>Do what yow list, I am al in your grace.'</p>
<p class="stanza">169. And she answerde, '<a href="#TIIINL1177" id="TIIIL1177" class="pginternal">of gilt
    misericorde!</a></p>
<p>That is to seyn, that I foryeve al this;</p>
<p>And ever-more on this night yow recorde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1180</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And beth wel war ye do no more amis.'</p>
<p>'Nay, dere herte myn,' quod he, 'y-wis.'</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page281">{281}</span>'And now,' quod she, 'that I have do yow
    smerte,</p>
<p>Foryeve it me, myn owene swete herte.'</p>
<p class="stanza">170. This Troilus, with blisse of that supprysed,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1185</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Put al in goddes hond, as he that mente</p>
<p>No-thing but wel; and, sodeynly avysed,</p>
<p>He hir in armes faste to him hente.</p>
<p>And Pandarus, with a ful good entente,</p>
<p>Leyde him to slepe, and seyde, 'if ye ben wyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1190</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Swowneth not now, lest more folk aryse.'</p>
<p class="stanza">171. What mighte or may the sely larke seye,</p>
<p>Whan that the sparhauk hath it in his foot?</p>
<p>I can no more, but of thise ilke tweye,</p>
<p>To whom this tale <a href="#TIIINL1194" id="TIIIL1194" class="pginternal">sucre be or soot</a>,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1195</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Though that I tarie a yeer, som-tyme I moot,</p>
<p>After myn auctor, tellen hir gladnesse,</p>
<p>As wel as I have told hir hevinesse.</p>
<p class="stanza">172. Criseyde, which that felte hir thus y-take,</p>
<p>As writen clerkes in hir bokes olde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1200</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Right as an aspes leef she gan to quake,</p>
<p>Whan she him felte hir in his armes folde.</p>
<p>But Troilus, al hool of cares colde,</p>
<p>Gan thanken tho the blisful goddes sevene;</p>
<p>Thus sondry peynes bringen folk to hevene.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1205</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">173. This Troilus in armes gan hir streyne,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'O swete, as ever mote I goon,</p>
<p>Now be ye caught, now is ther but we tweyne;</p>
<p>Now yeldeth yow, for other boot is noon.'</p>
<p>To that Criseyde answerde thus anoon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1210</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'Ne hadde I er now, my swete herte dere,</p>
<p>Ben yolde, y-wis, I were now not here!'</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page282">{282}</span>174. O! sooth is seyd, that
    heled for to be</p>
<p>As of a fevre or othere greet syknesse,</p>
<p>Men moste drinke, as men may often see,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1215</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIIINL1215" id="TIIIL1215" class="pginternal">Ful bittre drink</a>; and for to han
    gladnesse,</p>
<p>Men drinken often peyne and greet distresse;</p>
<p>I mene it here, as for this aventure,</p>
<p>That thourgh a peyne hath founden al his cure.</p>
<p class="stanza">175. And now swetnesse semeth more sweet,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1220</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That bitternesse assayed was biforn;</p>
<p>For out of wo in blisse now they flete.</p>
<p>Non swich they felten, sith they were born;</p>
<p>Now is this bet, than bothe two be lorn!</p>
<p>For love of god, take every womman hede</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1225</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To werken thus, if it comth to the nede.</p>
<p class="stanza">176. Criseyde, al quit from every drede and tene,</p>
<p>As she that iuste cause hadde him to triste,</p>
<p>Made him swich feste, it Ioye was to sene,</p>
<p>Whan she his trouthe and clene entente wiste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1230</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And as aboute a tree, with many a twiste,</p>
<p><a href="#TIIINL1231" id="TIIIL1231" class="pginternal">Bitrent</a> and wryth the sote wode-binde,</p>
<p>Gan eche of hem in armes other winde.</p>
<p class="stanza">177. And as the newe abaysshed nightingale,</p>
<p>That stinteth first whan she biginneth singe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1235</div>
</div>
