<p class="stanza">66. Thow biddest me I sholde love an-other</p>
<p>Al freshly newe, and lat Criseyde go!</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page317">{317}</span>It lyth not in my power, leve brother.</p>
<p>And though I mighte, I wolde not do so.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">460</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But canstow <a href="#TIVNL460" id="TIVL460" class="pginternal">pleyen raket</a>, to and fro,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL461" id="TIVL461" class="pginternal">Netle in, dokke out</a>, now this, now that, Pandare?</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL462" id="TIVL462" class="pginternal">Now foule falle hir</a>, for thy wo that care!</p>
<p class="stanza">67. Thow farest eek by me, thou Pandarus,</p>
<p>As he, that whan a wight is wo bi-goon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">465</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He cometh to him a pas, and seyth right thus,</p>
<p>"Thenk not on smert, and thou shalt fele noon."</p>
<p>Thou most me first transmuwen in a stoon,</p>
<p>And reve me my passiounes alle,</p>
<p>Er thou so lightly do my wo to falle.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">470</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">68. The deeth may wel out of my brest departe</p>
<p>The lyf, so longe may this sorwe myne;</p>
<p>But fro my soule shal Criseydes darte</p>
<p>Out never-mo; but doun with Proserpyne,</p>
<p>Whan I am deed, I wol go wone in pyne;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">475</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And ther I wol eternally compleyne</p>
<p>My wo, and how that twinned be we tweyne.</p>
<p class="stanza">69. Thow hast here maad an argument, for fyn,</p>
<p>How that it sholde lasse peyne be</p>
<p>Criseyde to for-goon, for she was myn,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">480</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And live in ese and in felicitee.</p>
<p>Why <a href="#TIVNL481" id="TIVL481" class="pginternal">gabbestow</a>, that seydest thus to me</p>
<p>That "him is wors that is fro wele y-throwe,</p>
<p>Than he hadde erst non of that wele y-knowe?"</p>
<p class="stanza">70. But tel me now, sin that thee thinketh so light</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">485</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To chaungen so in love, ay to and fro,</p>
<p>Why hastow not don bisily thy might</p>
<p>To chaungen hir that doth thee al thy wo?</p>
<p>Why niltow lete hir fro thyn herte go?</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page318">{318}</span>Why niltow love an-other lady swete,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">490</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That may thyn herte setten in quiete?</p>
<p class="stanza">71. If thou hast had in love ay yet mischaunce,</p>
<p>And canst it not out of thyn herte dryve,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL493" id="TIVL493" class="pginternal">I, that livede</a> in lust and in plesaunce</p>
<p>With hir as muche as creature on-lyve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">495</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How sholde I that foryete, and that so blyve?</p>
<p>O where hastow ben hid so longe in muwe,</p>
<p>That canst so wel and <a href="#TIVNL497" id="TIVL497" class="pginternal">formely</a> arguwe?</p>
<p class="stanza">72. Nay, nay, god wot, nought worth is al thy reed,</p>
<p>For which, for what that ever may bifalle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">500</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">With-outen wordes mo, I wol be deed.</p>
<p>O deeth, that endere art of sorwes alle,</p>
<p>Com now, sin I so ofte after thee calle,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL503" id="TIVL503" class="pginternal">For sely is that deeth</a>, soth for to seyne,</p>
<p>That, ofte y-cleped, cometh and endeth peyne.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">505</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">73. Wel wot I, whyl my lyf was in quiete,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL506" id="TIVL506" class="pginternal">Er thou me slowe</a>, I wolde have yeven hyre;</p>
<p>But now thy cominge is to me so swete,</p>
<p>That in this world I no-thing so desyre.</p>
<p>O deeth, sin with this sorwe I am a-fyre,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">510</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Thou outher do me anoon in teres drenche,</p>
<p>Or with thy colde strook myn hete quenche!</p>
<p class="stanza">74. Sin that thou sleest so fele in sondry wyse</p>
<p>Ayens hir wil, unpreyed, day and night,</p>
<p>Do me, at my requeste, this servyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">515</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Delivere now the world, so dostow right,</p>
<p>Of me, that am the wofulleste wight</p>
<p>That ever was; for tyme is that I sterve,</p>
<p>Sin in this world of right nought may I serve.'</p>
<p class="stanza">75. This Troilus in teres gan distille,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">520</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As licour out of <a href="#TIVNL520" id="TIVL520" class="pginternal">alambyk</a> ful faste;</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page319">{319}</span>And Pandarus gan holde his tunge stille,</p>
<p>And to the ground his eyen doun he caste.</p>
<p>But nathelees, thus thoughte he at the laste,</p>
<p>'What, parde, rather than my felawe deye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">525</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Yet shal I som-what more un-to him seye:'</p>
<p class="stanza">76. And seyde, 'freend, sin thou hast swich distresse,</p>
<p>And sin thee list myn arguments to blame,</p>
<p>Why nilt thy-selven helpen doon redresse,</p>
<p>And with thy manhod letten al this grame?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">530</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Go ravisshe hir ne canstow not for shame!</p>
<p>And outher lat hir out of toune fare,</p>
<p>Or hold hir stille, and leve thy nyce fare.</p>
<p class="stanza">77. Artow in Troye, and hast non hardiment</p>
<p>To take a womman which that loveth thee,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">535</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And wolde hir-selven been of thyn assent?</p>
<p>Now is not this a nyce vanitee?</p>
<p>Rys up anoon, and lat this weping be,</p>
<p>And kyth thou art a man, for in this houre</p>
<p>I wil be deed, or she shal bleven oure.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">540</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">78. To this answerde him Troilus ful softe,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'parde, leve brother dere,</p>
<p>Al this have I my-self yet thought ful ofte,</p>
<p>And more thing than thou devysest here.</p>
<p>But why this thing is laft, thou shalt wel here;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">545</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And whan thou me hast yeve an audience,</p>
<p>Ther-after mayst thou telle al thy sentence.</p>
<p class="stanza">79. First, sin thou wost this toun hath al this werre</p>
<p>For ravisshing of wommen so by might,</p>
<p>It sholde not be suffred me to erre,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">550</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As it stant now, ne doon so gret unright.</p>
<p>I sholde han also blame of every wight,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page320">{320}</span>My fadres graunt if that I so withstode,</p>
<p>Sin she is chaunged for the tounes goode.</p>
<p class="stanza">80. I have eek thought, so it were hir assent,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">555</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To aske hir at my fader, of his grace;</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL556" id="TIVL556" class="pginternal">Than thenke I</a>, this were hir accusement,</p>
<p>Sin wel I woot I may hir not purchace.</p>
<p>For sin my fader, in so heigh a place</p>
<p>As parlement, hath hir eschaunge enseled,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">560</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He nil for me his lettre be repeled.</p>
<p class="stanza">81. Yet drede I most hir herte to pertourbe</p>
<p>With violence, if I do swich a game;</p>
<p>For if I wolde it openly distourbe,</p>
<p>It moste been disclaundre to hir name.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">565</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And me were lever deed than hir defame,</p>
<p>As nolde god but-if I sholde have</p>
<p>Hir honour lever than my lyf to save!</p>
<p class="stanza">82. Thus am I lost, for ought that I can see;</p>
<p>For certeyn is, sin that I am hir knight,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">570</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I moste hir honour levere han than me</p>
<p>In every cas, as lovere oughte of right.</p>
<p>Thus am I with desyr and reson twight;</p>
<p>Desyr for to distourben hir me redeth,</p>
<p>And reson nil not, so myn herte dredeth.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">575</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">83. Thus wepinge that he coude never cesse,</p>
<p>He seyde, 'allas! how shal I, wrecche, fare?</p>
<p>For wel fele I alwey my love encresse,</p>
<p>And hope is lasse and lasse alwey, Pandare!</p>
<p>Encressen eek the causes of my care;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">580</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">So wel-a-wey, why nil myn herte breste?</p>
<p>For, as in love, ther is but litel reste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">84. Pandare answerde, 'freend, thou mayst, for me,</p>
<p>Don as thee list; but <a href="#TIVNL583" id="TIVL583" class="pginternal">hadde ich it so hote</a>,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page321">{321}</span>And thyn estat, she sholde go with me;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">585</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Though al this toun cryede on this thing by note,</p>
<p>I nolde sette at al that noyse a grote.</p>
<p>For when men han wel cryed, than wol they roune;</p>
<p>A wonder last but <a href="#TIVNL588" id="TIVL588" class="pginternal">nyne night</a> never in toune.</p>
<p class="stanza">85. Devyne not in reson ay so depe</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">590</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne curteysly, but help thy-self anoon;</p>
<p>Bet is that othere than thy-selven wepe,</p>
<p>And namely, sin ye two been al oon.</p>
<p>Rys up, for by myn heed, she shal not goon;</p>
<p>And rather be in blame a lyte y-founde</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">595</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Than sterve here as a gnat, with-oute wounde.</p>
<p class="stanza">86. It is no shame un-to yow, ne no vyce</p>
<p>Hir to with-holden, that ye loveth most.</p>
<p>Paraunter, she mighte holden thee for nyce</p>
<p>To lete hir go thus to the Grekes ost.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">600</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Thenk eek <a href="#TIVNL600" id="TIVL600" class="pginternal">Fortune</a>, as wel thy-selven
    wost,</p>
<p>Helpeth hardy man to his empryse,</p>
<p>And weyveth wrecches, <a href="#TIVNL602" id="TIVL602" class="pginternal">for hir cowardyse</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">87. And though thy lady wolde a <a href="#TIVNL603" id="TIVL603" class="pginternal">litel</a> hir
    greve,</p>
<p>Thou shalt thy pees ful wel here-after make,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">605</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But as for me, certayn, I can not leve</p>
<p>That she wolde it as now for yvel take.</p>
<p>Why sholde than <a href="#TIVNL607" id="TIVL607" class="pginternal">for ferd</a> thyn herte quake?</p>
<p>Thenk eek how Paris hath, that is thy brother,</p>
<p>A love; and why shaltow not have another?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">610</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">88. And Troilus, o thing I dar thee swere,</p>
<p>That if Criseyde, whiche that is thy leef,</p>
<p>Now loveth thee as wel as thou dost here,</p>
<p>God helpe me so, she nil not take a-greef,</p>
<p>Though thou do bote a-noon in this mischeef.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">615</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page322">{322}</span>And if she wilneth fro thee for
    to passe,</p>
<p>Thanne is she fals; so love hir wel the lasse.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL618" id="TIVL618" class="pginternal">89</a>. For-thy tak herte, and thenk, right
    as a knight,</p>
<p>Thourgh love is broken alday every lawe.</p>
<p>Kyth now sumwhat thy corage and thy might,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">620</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Have mercy on thy-self, for any awe.</p>
<p>Lat not this wrecched wo thin herte gnawe,</p>
<p>But manly set the world on <a href="#TIVNL622" id="TIVL622" class="pginternal">sixe and sevene</a>;</p>
<p>And, if thou deye a martir, go to hevene.</p>
<p class="stanza">90. I wol my-self be with thee at this dede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">625</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Though ich and al my kin, up-on a stounde,</p>
<p>Shulle in a strete as dogges liggen dede,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL627" id="TIVL627" class="pginternal">Thourgh-girt with many a wyd and blody wounde</a>.</p>
<p>In every cas I wol a freend be founde.</p>
<p>And if thee list here sterven as a wrecche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">630</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A-dieu, <a href="#TIVNL630" id="TIVL630" class="pginternal">the devel spede him that it
    recche</a>!'</p>
<p class="stanza">91. This Troilus gan with tho wordes quiken,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'freend, graunt mercy, ich assente;</p>
<p>But certaynly thou mayst not me so priken,</p>
<p>Ne peyne noon ne may me so tormente,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">635</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, for no cas, it is not myn entente,</p>
<p>At shorte wordes, though I dyen sholde,</p>
<p>To ravisshe hir, but-if hir-self it wolde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">92. 'Why, so mene I,' quod Pandarus, 'al this day.</p>
<p>But tel me than, hastow hir wel assayed,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">640</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That sorwest thus?' And he answerde, 'nay.'</p>
<p>'Wher-of artow,' quod Pandare, 'than a-mayed,</p>
<p>That nost not that she wol ben yvel apayed</p>
<p>To ravisshe hir, sin thou hast not ben there,</p>
<p>But-if that Iove tolde it in thyn ere?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">645</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page323">{323}</span>93. For-thy rys up, as
    nought ne were, anoon,</p>
<p>And wash thy face, and to the king thou wende,</p>
<p>Or he may wondren whider thou art goon.</p>
<p>Thou most with wisdom him and othere blende;</p>
<p>Or, up-on cas, he may after thee sende</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">650</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Er thou be war; and shortly, brother dere,</p>
<p>Be glad, and lat me werke in this matere.</p>
<p class="stanza">94. For I shal shape it so, that sikerly</p>
<p>Thou shalt this night som tyme, in som manere,</p>
<p>Com speke with thy lady prevely,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">655</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And by hir wordes eek, and by hir chere,</p>
<p>Thou shalt ful sone aparceyve and wel here</p>
<p>Al hir entente, and in this cas the beste;</p>
<p>And fare now wel, for in this point I reste.'</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL659" id="TIVL659" class="pginternal">95</a>. The swifte Fame, whiche that false
    thinges</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">660</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Egal reporteth lyk the thinges trewe,</p>
<p>Was thorugh-out Troye y-fled with preste winges</p>
<p>Fro man to man, and made this tale al newe,</p>
<p>How Calkas doughter, with hir brighte hewe,</p>
<p>At parlement, with-oute wordes more,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">665</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I-graunted was in chaunge of Antenore.</p>
<p class="stanza">96. The whiche tale anoon-right as Criseyde</p>
<p>Had herd, she which that of hir fader roughte,</p>
<p>As in this cas, right nought, ne whanne he deyde,</p>
<p>Ful bisily to Iuppiter bisoughte</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">670</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Yeve him mischaunce that this tretis broughte.</p>
<p>But shortly, lest thise tales sothe were,</p>
<p>She dorste at no wight asken it, for fere.</p>
<p class="stanza">97. As she that hadde hir herte and al hir minde</p>
<p>On Troilus y-set so wonder faste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">675</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That al this world ne mighte hir love unbinde,</p>
<p>Ne Troilus out of hir herte caste;</p>
<p>She wol ben his, whyl that hir lyf may laste.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page324">{324}</span>And thus she brenneth bothe in love and
    drede,</p>
<p>So that she niste what was best to rede.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">680</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">98. But as men seen in toune, and al aboute,</p>
<p>That wommen usen frendes to visyte,</p>
<p>So to Criseyde of wommen com a route</p>
<p>For pitous Ioye, and <a href="#TIVNL683" id="TIVL683" class="pginternal">wenden hir delyte</a>;</p>
<p>And with hir tales, dere y-nough <a href="#TIVNL684" id="TIVL684" class="pginternal">a myte</a>,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">685</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">These wommen, whiche that in the cite dwelle,</p>
<p>They sette hem doun, and seyde as I shal telle.</p>
<p class="stanza">99. Quod first that oon, 'I am glad, trewely,</p>
<p>By-cause of yow, that shal your fader see.'</p>
<p>A-nother seyde, 'y-wis, so nam not I;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">690</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For al to litel hath she with us be.'</p>
<p>Quod tho the thridde, 'I hope, y-wis, that she</p>
<p>Shal bringen us the pees <a href="#TIVNL692" id="TIVL692" class="pginternal">on every syde</a>,</p>
<p>That, whan she gooth, almighty god hir gyde!'</p>
<p class="stanza">100. Tho wordes and tho wommannisshe thinges,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">695</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">She herde hem right as though she thennes were;</p>
<p>For, god it wot, hir herte on other thing is,</p>
<p>Although the body sat among hem there.</p>
<p>Hir advertence is alwey elles-where;</p>
<p>For Troilus ful faste hir soule soughte;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">700</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">With-outen word, alwey on him she thoughte.</p>
<p class="stanza">101. Thise wommen, that thus wenden hir to plese,</p>
<p>Aboute nought gonne alle hir tales spende;</p>
<p>Swich vanitee ne can don hir non ese,</p>
<p>As she that, al this mene whyle, brende</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">705</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of other passioun than that they wende,</p>
<p>So that she felte almost hir herte deye</p>
<p>For wo, and wery of that companye.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page325">{325}</span><a href="#TIVNL708" id="TIVL708" class="pginternal">102</a>. For which no lenger mighte she restreyne</p>
<p>Hir teres, so they gonnen up to welle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">710</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That yeven signes of the bitter peyne</p>
<p>In whiche hir spirit was, and moste dwelle;</p>
<p>Remembring hir, fro heven unto which helle</p>
<p>She fallen was, sith she forgoth the sighte</p>
<p>Of Troilus, and sorowfully she sighte.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">715</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">103. And thilke foles sittinge hir aboute</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL716" id="TIVL716" class="pginternal">Wenden,</a> that she wepte and syked sore</p>
<p>By-cause that she sholde out of that route</p>
<p>Departe, and never pleye with hem more.</p>
<p>And they that hadde y-knowen hir of yore</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">720</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Seye hir so wepe, and thoughte it kindenesse,</p>
<p>And eche of hem wepte eek for hir distresse;</p>
<p class="stanza">104. And bisily they gonnen hir conforten</p>
<p>Of thing, god wot, on which she litel thoughte;</p>
<p>And with hir tales wenden hir disporten,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">725</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And to be glad they often hir bisoughte.</p>
<p>But swich an ese ther-with they hir wroughte</p>
<p>Right as a man is esed for to fele,</p>
<p>For ache of heed, to clawen him on his hele!</p>
<p class="stanza">105. But after al this nyce vanitee</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">730</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">They took hir leve, and hoom they wenten alle.</p>
<p>Criseyde, ful of sorweful pitee,</p>
<p>In-to hir chaumbre up wente out of the halle,</p>
<p>And on hir bed she gan for deed to falle,</p>
<p>In purpos never thennes for to ryse;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">735</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And thus she wroughte, as I shal yow devyse.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL735" id="TIVL735" class="pginternal">106</a>. Hir <a href="#TIVNL736" id="TIVL736" class="pginternal">ounded</a> heer, that sonnish was of hewe,</p>
<p>She rente, and eek hir fingres longe and smale</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page326">{326}</span>She wrong ful ofte, and bad god on hir
    rewe,</p>
<p>And with the deeth to doon bote on hir bale.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">740</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hir hewe, whylom bright, that tho was pale,</p>
<p>Bar witnes of hir wo and hir constreynte;</p>
<p>And thus she spak, sobbinge, in hir compleynte:</p>
<p class="stanza">107. 'Alas!' quod she, 'out of this regioun</p>
<p>I, woful wrecche and infortuned wight,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">745</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And born in corsed constellacioun,</p>
<p>Mot goon, and thus departen fro my knight;</p>
<p>Wo worth, allas! that ilke dayes light</p>
<p>On which I saw him first with eyen tweyne,</p>
<p>That causeth me, and I him, al this peyne!'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">750</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><a href="#TIVNL750" id="TIVL750" class="pginternal">108</a>. Therwith the teres from hir
    eyen two</p>
<p>Doun fille, as shour in Aperill, ful swythe;</p>
<p>Hir whyte brest she bet, and for the wo</p>
<p>After the deeth she cryed a thousand sythe,</p>
<p>Sin he that wont hir wo was for to lythe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">755</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">She mot for-goon; for which disaventure</p>
<p>She held hir-self a forlost creature.</p>
<p class="stanza">109. She seyde, 'how shal he doon, and I also?</p>
<p>How sholde I live, if that I from him twinne?</p>
<p>O dere herte eek, that I love so,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">760</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Who shal that sorwe sleen that ye ben inne?</p>
<p>O Calkas, fader, thyn be al this sinne!</p>
<p>O moder myn, that cleped were <a href="#TIVNL762" id="TIVL762" class="pginternal">Argyve</a>,</p>
<p>Wo worth that day that thou me bere on lyve!</p>
<p class="stanza">110. To what fyn sholde I live and sorwen thus?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">765</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How sholde a fish with-oute water dure?</p>
<p>What is Criseyde worth, from Troilus?</p>
<p>How sholde a plaunte or lyves creature</p>
<p>Live, with-oute his kinde noriture?</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page327">{327}</span>For which ful oft a <a href="#TIVNL769" id="TIVL769" class="pginternal">by-word</a> here I seye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">770</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, "rotelees, mot grene sone deye."</p>
<p class="stanza">111. I shal don thus, sin neither swerd ne darte</p>
<p>Dar I non handle, for the crueltee,</p>
<p>That ilke day that I from yow departe,</p>
<p>If sorwe of that nil not my bane be,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">775</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Than shal no mete or drinke come in me</p>
<p>Til I my soule out of my breste unshethe;</p>
<p>And thus my-selven wol I do to dethe.</p>
<p class="stanza">112. And, Troilus, my clothes everichoon</p>
<p>Shul blake been, in tokeninge, herte swete,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">780</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That I am as out of this world agoon,</p>
<p>That wont was yow to setten in quiete;</p>
<p>And of myn <a href="#TIVNL782" id="TIVL782" class="pginternal">ordre</a>, ay til deeth me mete,</p>
<p>The observaunce ever, in your absence,</p>
<p>Shal sorwe been, compleynte, and abstinence.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">785</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">113. Myn herte and eek the woful goost ther-inne</p>
<p>Biquethe I, with your spirit to compleyne</p>
<p>Eternally, for they shul never twinne.</p>
<p>For though in erthe y-twinned be we tweyne,</p>
<p>Yet in the feld of pitee, out of peyne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">790</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That hight <a href="#TIVNL790" id="TIVL790" class="pginternal">Elysos</a>, shul we been
    y-fere,</p>
<p>As Orpheus and Erudice his fere.</p>
<p class="stanza">114. Thus herte myn, for Antenor, allas!</p>
<p>I sone shal be chaunged, as I wene.</p>
<p>But how shul ye don in this sorwful cas,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">795</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">How shal your tendre herte this sustene?</p>
<p>But herte myn, for-yet this sorwe and tene,</p>
<p>And me also; for, soothly for to seye,</p>
<p>So ye wel fare, I recche not to deye.'</p>
<p class="stanza">115. How mighte it ever y-red ben or y-songe,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">800</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">The pleynte that she made in hir distresse?</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page328">{328}</span>I noot; but, as for me, my litel tonge,</p>
<p>If I discreven wolde hir hevinesse,</p>
<p>It sholde make hir sorwe seme lesse</p>
<p>Than that it was, and childishly deface</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">805</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hir heigh compleynte, and therfore I it pace.</p>
<p class="stanza">116. Pandare, which that sent from Troilus</p>
<p>Was to Criseyde, as ye han herd devyse,</p>
<p>That for the beste it was accorded thus,</p>
<p>And he ful glad to doon him that servyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">810</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Un-to Criseyde, in a ful secree wyse,</p>
<p>Ther-as she lay in torment and in rage,</p>
<p>Com hir to telle al hoolly his message.</p>
<p class="stanza">117. And fond that she hir-selven gan to trete</p>
<p>Ful pitously; for with hir salte teres</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">815</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Hir brest, hir face y-bathed was ful wete;</p>
<p>The mighty tresses of hir sonnish heres,</p>
<p>Unbroyden, hangen al aboute hir eres;</p>
<p>Which yaf him verray signal of martyre</p>
<p>Of deeth, which that hir herte gan desyre.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">820</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">118. Whan she him saw, she gan for sorwe anoon</p>
<p>Hir tery face a-twixe hir armes hyde,</p>
<p>For which this Pandare is so wo bi-goon,</p>
<p>That in the hous he mighte unnethe abyde,</p>
<p>As he that pitee felte on every syde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">825</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For if Criseyde hadde erst compleyned sore,</p>
<p>Tho gan she pleyne a thousand tymes more.</p>
<p class="stanza">119. And in hir aspre pleynte than she seyde,</p>
<p>'Pandare first of Ioyes mo than two</p>
<p>Was <a href="#TIVNL829" id="TIVL829" class="pginternal">cause causinge</a> un-to me, Criseyde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">830</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That now transmuwed been in cruel wo.</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL831" id="TIVL831" class="pginternal">Wher</a> shal I seye to yow "wel come" or no,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page329">{329}</span>That alderfirst me broughte in-to servyse</p>
<p>Of love, allas! that endeth in swich wyse?</p>
<p class="stanza">120. Endeth than love in wo? Ye, or men lyeth!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">835</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And alle worldly blisse, as thinketh me,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL836" id="TIVL836" class="pginternal">The ende of blisse</a> ay sorwe it occupyeth;</p>
<p>And who-so troweth not that it so be,</p>
<p>Lat him upon me, woful wrecche, y-see,</p>
<p>That my-self hate, and ay my birthe acorse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">840</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Felinge alwey, fro wikke I go to worse.</p>
<p class="stanza">121. Who-so me seeth, he seeth sorwe al at ones,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL842" id="TIVL842" class="pginternal">Peyne, torment,</a> pleynte, wo, distresse.</p>
<p>Out of my woful body <a href="#TIVNL843" id="TIVL843" class="pginternal">harm ther noon is</a>,</p>
<p>As anguish, langour, cruel bitternesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">845</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A-noy, smert, drede, fury, and eek siknesse.</p>
<p>I trowe, y-wis, from hevene teres reyne,</p>
<p>For pitee of myn aspre and cruel peyne!'</p>
<p class="stanza">122. 'And thou, my suster, ful of discomfort,'</p>
<p>Quod Pandarus, 'what thenkestow to do?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">850</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Why ne hastow to thy-selven som <a href="#TIVNL850" id="TIVL850" class="pginternal">resport</a>,</p>
<p>Why woltow thus thy-selve, allas, for-do?</p>
<p>Leef al this werk and tak now hede to</p>
<p>That I shal seyn, and herkne, of good entente,</p>
<p>This, which by me thy Troilus thee sente.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">855</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">123. Torned hir tho Criseyde, a wo makinge</p>
<p>So greet that it a deeth was for to see:—</p>
<p>'Allas!' quod she, 'what wordes may ye bringe?</p>
<p>What wol my dere herte seyn to me,</p>
<p>Which that I drede never-mo to see?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">860</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page330">{330}</span>Wol he have pleynte or teres, er
    I wende?</p>
<p>I have y-nowe, if he ther-after sende!'</p>
<p class="stanza">124. She was right swich to seen in hir visage</p>
<p>As is that wight that men on bere binde;</p>
<p>Hir face, lyk of Paradys the image,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">865</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Was al <a href="#TIVNL865" id="TIVL865" class="pginternal">y-chaunged</a> in another kinde.</p>
<p>The pleye, the laughtre <a href="#TIVNL866" id="TIVL866" class="pginternal">men</a> was wont to finde</p>
<p>In hir, and eek hir Ioyes everychone,</p>
<p>Ben fled, and thus lyth now Criseyde allone.</p>
<p class="stanza">125. Aboute hir eyen two a purpre ring</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">870</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIVNL870" id="TIVL870" class="pginternal">Bi-trent</a>, in sothfast tokninge of hir
    peyne,</p>
<p>That to biholde it was a dedly thing,</p>
<p>For which Pandare mighte not restreyne</p>
<p>The teres from his eyen for to reyne.</p>
<p>But nathelees, as he best mighte, he seyde</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">875</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">From Troilus thise wordes to Criseyde.</p>
<p class="stanza">126. 'Lo, nece, I trowe ye han herd al how</p>
<p>The king, with othere lordes, for the beste,</p>
<p>Hath mad eschaunge of Antenor and yow,</p>
<p>That cause is of this sorwe and this unreste.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">880</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But how this cas doth Troilus moleste,</p>
<p>That may non erthely mannes tonge seye;</p>
<p>For verray wo his wit is al aweye.</p>
<p class="stanza">127. For which we han so sorwed, he and I,</p>
<p>That <a href="#TIVNL884" id="TIVL884" class="pginternal">in-to litel</a> bothe it hadde us slawe;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">885</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But thurgh my conseil this day, fynally,</p>
<p>He somwhat is fro weping now with-drawe.</p>
<p>And semeth me that he desyreth <a href="#TIVNL887" id="TIVL887" class="pginternal">fawe</a></p>
<p>With yow to been al night, for to devyse</p>
<p>Remede in this, if ther were any wyse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">890</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">128. This, short and pleyne, theffect of my message,</p>
<p>As ferforth as my wit can comprehende.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page331">{331}</span>For ye, that been of torment in swich
    rage,</p>
<p>May to no long prologe as now entende;</p>
<p>And her-upon ye may answere him sende.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">895</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And, for the love of god, my nece dere,</p>
<p>So leef this wo er Troilus be here.'</p>
<p class="stanza">129. 'Gret is my wo,' quod she, and sighte sore,</p>
<p>As she that feleth dedly sharp distresse;</p>
<p>'But yet to me his sorwe is muchel more,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">900</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That love him bet than he him-self, I gesse.</p>
<p>Allas! for me hath he swich hevinesse?</p>
<p>Can he for me so pitously compleyne?</p>
<p>Y-wis, this sorwe doubleth al my peyne.</p>
<p class="stanza">130. Grevous to me, god wot, is for to twinne,'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">905</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Quod she, 'but yet it hardere is to me</p>
<p>To seen that sorwe which that he is inne;</p>
<p>For wel wot I, it wol my <a href="#TIVNL907" id="TIVL907" class="pginternal">bane</a> be;</p>
<p>And deye I wol in certayn,' tho quod she;</p>
<p>'But bidde him come, er deeth, that thus me threteth,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">910</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Dryve out that goost, which in myn herte beteth.'</p>
<p class="stanza">131. Thise wordes seyd, she on hir armes two</p>
<p>Fil gruf, and gan to wepe pitously.</p>
<p>Quod Pandarus, 'allas! why do ye so,</p>
<p>Syn wel ye wot the tyme is faste by,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">915</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That he shal come? Arys up hastely,</p>
<p>That he yow nat biwopen thus ne finde,</p>
<p>But ye wol han him wood out of his minde!</p>
<p class="stanza">132. For wiste he that ye ferde in this manere,</p>
<p>He wolde him-selve slee; and if I wende</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">920</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To han this fare, he sholde not come here</p>
<p>For al the good that Pryam may despende.</p>
<p>For to what fyn he wolde anoon pretende,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page332">{332}</span>That knowe I wel; and for-thy yet I seye,</p>
<p>So leef this sorwe, or platly he wol deye.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">925</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">133. And shapeth yow his sorwe for to abregge,</p>
<p>And nought encresse, leve nece swete;</p>
<p>Beth rather to him cause of <a href="#TIVNL927" id="TIVL927" class="pginternal">flat than egge</a>,</p>
<p>And with som wysdom ye his sorwes bete.</p>
<p>What helpeth it to wepen ful a strete,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">930</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or though ye bothe in salte teres dreynte?</p>
<p>Bet is a tyme of cure ay than of pleynte.</p>
<p class="stanza">134. I mene thus; whan I him hider bringe,</p>
<p>Sin ye ben wyse, and bothe of oon assent,</p>
<p>So shapeth how distourbe your goinge,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">935</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or come ayen, sone after ye be went.</p>
<p>Wommen ben wyse in short avysement;</p>
<p>And lat sen how your wit shal now avayle;</p>
<p>And what that I may helpe, it shal not fayle.'</p>
<p class="stanza">135. 'Go,' quod Criseyde, 'and uncle, trewely,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">940</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I shal don al my might, me to restreyne</p>
<p>From weping in his sight, and bisily,</p>
<p>Him for to glade, I shal don al my peyne,</p>
<p>And in myn herte seken every veyne;</p>
<p>If to this soor ther may be founden salve,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">945</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It shal not lakken, certain, on myn halve.'</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL947" id="TIVL947" class="pginternal">136</a>. Goth Pandarus, and Troilus he
    soughte,</p>
<p>Til in a temple he fond him allone,</p>
<p>As he that of his lyf no lenger roughte;</p>
<p>But to the pitouse goddes everichone</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">950</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ful tendrely he preyde, and made his mone,</p>
<p>To doon him sone out of this world to pace;</p>
<p>For wel he thoughte ther was non other grace.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page333">{333}</span>137. And shortly, al the sothe
    for to seye,</p>
<p>He was so fallen in despeyr that day,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">955</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That outrely he shoop him for to deye.</p>
<p>For right thus was his argument alwey:</p>
<p>He seyde, he nas but loren, waylawey!</p>
<p>'For al that comth, comth by necessitee;</p>
<p>Thus to be lorn, it is my destinee.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">960</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><a href="#TIVNL963" id="TIVL963" class="pginternal">138</a>. For certaynly, this wot I
    wel,' he seyde,</p>
<p>That for-sight of divyne purveyaunce</p>
<p>Hath seyn alwey me to for-gon Criseyde,</p>
<p>Sin god seeth every thing, out of doutaunce,</p>
<p>And hem desponeth, thourgh his ordenaunce,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">965</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">In hir merytes sothly for to be,</p>
<p>As they shul comen by predestinee.</p>
<p class="stanza">139. But nathelees, allas! whom shal I leve?</p>
<p>For ther ben <a href="#TIVNL968" id="TIVL968" class="pginternal">grete clerkes</a> many oon,</p>
<p>That destinee thorugh argumentes preve;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">970</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And som men seyn that nedely ther is noon;</p>
<p>But that free chois is yeven us everichoon.</p>
<p>O, welaway! so sleye arn clerkes olde,</p>
<p>That I not whos opinion I may holde.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL974" id="TIVL974" class="pginternal">140</a>. For som men seyn, if god seth al
    biforn,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">975</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ne god may not deceyved ben, pardee,</p>
<p>Than moot it fallen, though men hadde it sworn,</p>
<p>That purveyaunce hath seyn bifore to be.</p>
<p>Wherfor I seye, that from eterne if he</p>
<p>Hath wist biforn our thought eek as our dede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">980</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">We have no free chois, as these clerkes rede.</p>
<p class="stanza">141. For other thought nor other dede also</p>
<p>Might never be, but swich as purveyaunce,</p>
<p>Which may not ben deceyved never-mo,</p>
<p>Hath feled biforn, with-outen ignoraunce.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">985</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page334">{334}</span>For if ther mighte been a
    variaunce</p>
<p>To wrythen out fro goddes purveyinge,</p>
<p>Ther nere no prescience of thing cominge;</p>
<p class="stanza">142. But it were rather an opinioun</p>
<p>Uncerteyn, and no stedfast forseinge;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">990</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And certes, that were an abusioun,</p>
<p>That god shuld han no parfit cleer witinge</p>
<p>More than we men that han doutous weninge.</p>
<p>But swich an errour up-on god to gesse</p>
<p>Were fals and foul, and wikked corsednesse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">995</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">143. Eek this is an opinioun of somme</p>
<p>That han hir top ful heighe and <a href="#TIVNL996" id="TIVL996" class="pginternal">smothe y-shore</a>;</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL997" id="TIVL997" class="pginternal">They seyn right thus</a>, that thing is not to come</p>
<p>For that the prescience hath seyn bifore</p>
<p>That it shal come; but they seyn, that therfore</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1000</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That it shal come, therfore the purveyaunce</p>
<p>Wot it biforn with-outen ignoraunce;</p>
<p class="stanza">144. And in this manere this necessitee</p>
<p>Retorneth in his part contrarie agayn.</p>
<p>For needfully bihoveth it not to be</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1005</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thilke thinges fallen in certayn</p>
<p>That ben purveyed; but nedely, as they seyn,</p>
<p>Bihoveth it that thinges, whiche that falle,</p>
<p>That they in certayn ben purveyed alle.</p>
<p class="stanza">145. I mene as though I laboured me in this,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1010</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To enqueren which thing cause of which thing be;</p>
<p>As whether that the prescience of god is</p>
<p>The certayn cause of the necessitee</p>
<p>Of thinges that to comen been, pardee;</p>
<p>Or if necessitee of thing cominge</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1015</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be cause certeyn of the purveyinge.</p>
<p class="stanza">146. But now ne enforce I me nat in shewinge</p>
<p>How the ordre of causes stant; but wel wot I,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page335">{335}</span>That it bihoveth that the bifallinge</p>
<p>Of thinges wist biforen certeynly</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1020</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Be necessarie, al seme it not ther-by</p>
<p>That prescience put falling necessaire</p>
<p>To thing to come, al falle it foule or faire.</p>
<p class="stanza"><a href="#TIVNL1023" id="TIVL1023" class="pginternal">147</a>. For if ther sit a man yond on a
    see,</p>
<p>Than by necessitee bihoveth it</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1025</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, certes, thyn opinioun soth be,</p>
<p>That wenest or coniectest that he sit;</p>
<p>And ferther-over now ayenward yit,</p>
<p>Lo, right so it is of the part contrarie,</p>
<p>As thus; (now herkne, for I wol not tarie):</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1030</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">148. I seye, that if the opinioun of thee</p>
<p>Be sooth, for that he sit, than seye I this,</p>
<p>That he mot sitten by necessitee;</p>
<p>And thus necessitee in either is.</p>
<p>For in him nede of sitting is, y-wis,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1035</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And in thee nede of sooth; and thus, forsothe,</p>
<p>Ther moot necessitee ben in yow bothe.</p>
<p class="stanza">149. But thou mayst seyn, the man sit not therfore,</p>
<p>That thyn opinion of sitting soth is;</p>
<p>But rather, for the man sit ther bifore,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1040</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Therfore is thyn opinion sooth, y-wis.</p>
<p>And I seye, though the cause of sooth of this</p>
<p>Comth of his sitting, yet necessitee</p>
<p>Is entrechaunged, bothe in him and thee.</p>
<p class="stanza">150. Thus on this same wyse, out of doutaunce,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1045</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I may wel maken, as it semeth me,</p>
<p>My resoninge of goddes purveyaunce,</p>
<p>And of the thinges that to comen be;</p>
<p>By whiche reson men may wel y-see,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page336">{336}</span>That thilke thinges that in erthe falle,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1050</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That by necessitee they comen alle.</p>
<p class="stanza">151. For al-though that, for thing shal come, y-wis,</p>
<p>Therfore is it purveyed, certaynly,</p>
<p>Nat that it comth for it purveyed is:</p>
<p>Yet nathelees, bihoveth it nedfully,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1055</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That thing to come be purveyed, trewely;</p>
<p>Or elles, thinges that purveyed be,</p>
<p>That they bityden by necessitee.</p>
<p class="stanza">152. And this suffyseth right y-now, certeyn,</p>
<p>For to destroye our free chois every del.—</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1060</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But now is this abusion to seyn,</p>
<p>That fallinge of the thinges temporel</p>
<p>Is cause of goddes prescience eternel.</p>
<p>Now trewely, that is a fals sentence,</p>
<p>That thing to come sholde cause his prescience.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1065</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">153. What mighte I wene, and I hadde swich a thought,</p>
<p>But that god purveyth thing that is to come</p>
<p>For that it is to come, and elles nought?</p>
<p>So mighte I wene that thinges alle and some,</p>
<p>That whylom been bifalle and over-come,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1070</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ben cause of thilke sovereyn purveyaunce,</p>
<p>That for-wot al with-outen ignoraunce.</p>
<p class="stanza">154. And over al this, yet seye I more herto,</p>
<p>That right as whan I woot ther is a thing,</p>
<p>Y-wis, that thing mot nedefully be so;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1075</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Eek right so, whan I woot a thing coming,</p>
<p>So mot it come; and thus the bifalling</p>
<p>Of thinges that ben wist bifore the tyde,</p>
<p>They mowe not been eschewed on no syde.'</p>
<p class="stanza">155. Than seyde he thus, 'almighty Iove in trone,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1080</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That wost of al this thing the soothfastnesse,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page337">{337}</span>Rewe on my sorwe, or do me deye sone,</p>
<p>Or bring Criseyde and me fro this distresse.'</p>
<p>And whyl he was in al this hevinesse,</p>
<p>Disputinge with him-self in this matere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1085</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Com Pandare in, and seyde as ye may here.</p>
<p class="stanza">156. 'O mighty god,' quod Pandarus, 'in trone,</p>
<p>Ey! who seigh ever a wys man faren so?</p>
<p>Why, Troilus, what thenkestow to done?</p>
<p>Hastow swich lust to been thyn owene fo?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1090</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">What, parde, yet is not Criseyde a-go!</p>
<p>Why lust thee so thy-self for-doon for drede,</p>
<p>That in thyn heed thyn eyen semen dede?</p>
<p class="stanza">157. Hastow not lived many a yeer biforn</p>
<p>With-outen hir, and <a href="#TIVNL1094" id="TIVL1094" class="pginternal">ferd</a> ful wel at ese?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1095</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Artow for hir and for non other born?</p>
<p>Hath kinde thee wroughte al-only hir to plese?</p>
<p>Lat be, and thenk right thus in thy disese.</p>
<p>That, in the dees right as ther fallen chaunces,</p>
<p>Right so in love, ther come and goon plesaunces.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1100</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">158. And yet this is a wonder most of alle,</p>
<p>Why thou thus sorwest, sin thou nost not yit,</p>
<p>Touching hir goinge, how that it shal falle,</p>
<p>Ne if she can hir-self distorben it.</p>
<p>Thou hast not yet assayed al hir wit.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1105</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A man may al by tyme <a href="#TIVNL1105" id="TIVL1105" class="pginternal">his nekke bede</a></p>
<p>Whan it shal of, and sorwen at the nede.</p>
<p class="stanza">159. For-thy take hede of that that I shal seye;</p>
<p>I have with hir y-spoke and longe y-be,</p>
<p>So as accorded was bitwixe us tweye.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1110</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And ever-mo me thinketh thus, that she</p>
<p>Hath som-what in hir hertes prevetee,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page338">{338}</span>Wher-with she can, if I shal right arede,</p>
<p>Distorbe al this, of which thou art in drede.</p>
<p class="stanza">160. For which my counseil is, whan it is night,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1115</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Thou to hir go, and make of this an ende;</p>
<p>And blisful Iuno, thourgh hir grete mighte,</p>
<p>Shal, as I hope, hir grace un-to us sende.</p>
<p>Myn herte seyth, "certeyn, she shal not wende;"</p>
<p>And for-thy put thyn herte a whyle in reste;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1120</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And hold this purpos, for it is the beste.'</p>
<p class="stanza">161. This Troilus answerde, and sighte sore,</p>
<p>'Thou seyst right wel, and I wil do right so;'</p>
<p>And what him liste, he seyde un-to it more.</p>
<p>And whan that it was tyme for to go,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1125</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Ful prevely him-self, with-outen mo,</p>
<p>Un-to hir com, as he was wont to done;</p>
<p>And how they wroughte, I shal yow telle sone.</p>
<p class="stanza">162. Soth is, that whan they gonne first to mete,</p>
<p>So gan the peyne hir hertes for to twiste,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1130</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That neither of hem other mighte grete,</p>
<p>But hem in armes toke and after kiste.</p>
<p>The lasse wofulle of hem bothe niste</p>
<p>Wher that he was, ne mighte o word out-bringe,</p>
<p>As I seyde erst, for wo and for sobbinge.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1135</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">163. Tho woful teres that they leten falle</p>
<p>As bittre weren, <a href="#TIVNL1136" id="TIVL1136" class="pginternal">out of teres kinde</a>,</p>
<p>For peyne, as is ligne aloës or galle.</p>
<p>So bittre teres weep nought, as I finde,</p>
<p>The woful <a href="#TIVNL1139" id="TIVL1139" class="pginternal">Myrra</a> through the bark and rinde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1140</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That in this world ther nis so hard an herte,</p>
<p>That nolde han rewed on hir peynes smerte.</p>
<p class="stanza">164. But whan hir woful wery gostes tweyne</p>
<p>Retorned been ther-as hem oughte dwelle,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page339">{339}</span>And that som-what to wayken gan the peyne</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1145</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">By lengthe of pleynte, and ebben gan the welle</p>
<p>Of <a href="#TIVNL1146" id="TIVL1146" class="pginternal">hire</a> teres, and the herte unswelle,</p>
<p>With broken voys, <a href="#TIVNL1147" id="TIVL1147" class="pginternal">al hoors for-shright</a>, Criseyde</p>
<p>To Troilus thise ilke wordes seyde:</p>
<p class="stanza">165. 'O Iove, I deye, and mercy I beseche!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1150</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Help, Troilus!' and ther-with-al hir face</p>
<p>Upon his brest she leyde, and loste speche;</p>
<p>Hir woful spirit from his propre place,</p>
<p>Right with the word, <a href="#TIVNL1153" id="TIVL1153" class="pginternal">alwey up poynt to pace</a>.</p>
<p>And thus she lyth with hewes pale and grene,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1155</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That whylom fresh and fairest was to sene.</p>
<p class="stanza">166. This Troilus, that on hir gan biholde,</p>
<p>Clepinge hir name, (and she lay as for deed,</p>
<p>With-oute answere, and felte hir limes colde,</p>
<p>Hir eyen throwen upward to hir heed),</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1160</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This sorwful man can now noon other reed,</p>
<p>But ofte tyme hir colde mouth he kiste;</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL1162" id="TIVL1162" class="pginternal">Wher him was wo</a>, god and him-self it wiste!</p>
<p class="stanza">167. He rist him up, and long streight he hir leyde;</p>
<p>For signe of lyf, for ought he can or may,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1165</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Can he noon finde in no-thing on Criseyde,</p>
<p>For which his song ful ofte is 'weylaway!'</p>
<p>But whan he saugh that specheles she lay,</p>
<p>With sorwful voys, and herte of blisse al bare,</p>
<p>He seyde how she was fro this world y-fare!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1170</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">168. So after that he longe hadde hir compleyned,</p>
<p>His hondes wrong, and seyde that was to seye,</p>
<p>And with his teres salte hir brest bireyned,</p>
<p>He gan tho teris wypen of ful dreye,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL1174" id="TIVL1174" class="pginternal">And pitously gan</a> for the soule preye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1175</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page340">{340}</span>And seyde, 'O lord, that set art
    in thy trone,</p>
<p>Rewe eek on me, for I shal folwe hir sone!'</p>
<p class="stanza">169. She cold was and with-outen sentement,</p>
<p>For aught he woot, for breeth ne felte he noon;</p>
<p>And this was him a <a href="#TIVNL1179" id="TIVL1179" class="pginternal">preignant</a> argument</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1180</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That she was forth out of this world agoon;</p>
<p>And whan he seigh ther was non other <a href="#TIVNL1181" id="TIVL1181" class="pginternal">woon</a>,</p>
<p>He gan hir limes dresse in swich manere</p>
<p>As men don hem that shul be leyd on bere.</p>
<p class="stanza">170. And after this, with sterne and cruel herte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1185</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">His swerd a-noon out of his shethe he <a href="#TIVNL1185" id="TIVL1185" class="pginternal">twighte</a>,</p>
<p>Him-self to sleen, how sore that him smerte,</p>
<p>So that his sowle hir sowle folwen mighte,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL1188" id="TIVL1188" class="pginternal">Ther-as</a> the doom of Mynos wolde it dighte;</p>
<p>Sin love and cruel Fortune it ne wolde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1190</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That in this world he lenger liven sholde.</p>
<p class="stanza">171. Thanne seyde he thus, fulfild of heigh desdayn,</p>
<p>'O cruel Iove, and thou, Fortune adverse,</p>
<p>This al and som, that falsly have ye slayn</p>
<p>Criseyde, and sin ye may do me no werse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1195</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Fy on your might and werkes so diverse!</p>
<p>Thus cowardly ye shul me never winne;</p>
<p>Ther shal no deeth me fro my lady twinne.</p>
<p class="stanza">172. For I this world, sin ye han slayn hir thus,</p>
<p>Wol lete, and folowe hir spirit lowe or hye;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1200</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Shal never lover seyn that Troilus</p>
<p>Dar not, for fere, with his lady dye;</p>
<p>For certeyn, I wol bere hir companye.</p>
<p>But sin ye wol not suffre us liven here,</p>
<p>Yet suffreth that our soules ben y-fere.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1205</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page341">{341}</span>173. And thou, citee,
    whiche that I leve in wo,</p>
<p>And thou, Pryam, and bretheren al y-fere,</p>
<p>And thou, my moder, farewel! for I go;</p>
<p>And <a href="#TIVNL1208" id="TIVL1208" class="pginternal">Attropos</a>, make redy thou my bere!</p>
<p>And thou, Criseyde, o swete herte dere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1210</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Receyve now my spirit!' wolde he seye,</p>
<p>With swerd at herte, al redy for to deye.</p>
<p class="stanza">174. But as god wolde, of swough ther-with she abreyde,</p>
<p>And gan to syke, and 'Troilus' she cryde;</p>
<p>And he answerde, 'lady myn Criseyde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1215</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Live ye yet?' and leet his swerd doun glyde.</p>
<p>'Ye, herte myn, that thanked be Cupyde!'</p>
<p>Quod she, and ther-with-al she sore sighte;</p>
<p>And he bigan to glade hir as he mighte;</p>
<p class="stanza">175. Took hir in armes two, and kiste hir ofte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1220</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And hir to glade he dide al his entente;</p>
<p>For which hir goost, that flikered ay on-lofte,</p>
<p>In-to hir woful herte ayein it wente.</p>
<p>But at the laste, as that hir eyen glente</p>
<p>A-syde, anoon she gan his swerd aspye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1225</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As it lay bare, and gan for fere crye,</p>
<p class="stanza">176. And asked him, why he it hadde out-drawe?</p>
<p>And Troilus anoon the cause hir tolde,</p>
<p>And how himself ther-with he wolde have slawe.</p>
<p>For which Criseyde up-on him gan biholde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1230</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And gan him in hir armes faste folde,</p>
<p>And seyde, 'O mercy, god, lo, which a dede!</p>
<p>Allas! how neigh we were bothe dede!</p>
<p class="stanza">177. Thanne if I ne hadde spoken, as grace was,</p>
<p>Ye wolde han slayn your-self anoon?' quod she.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1235</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page342">{342}</span>'Ye, douteless;' and she
    answerde, 'allas!</p>
<p>For, by that ilke lord that made me,</p>
<p>I nolde <a href="#TIVNL1237" id="TIVL1237" class="pginternal">a forlong wey</a> on-lyve han be,</p>
<p>After your deeth, to han be crowned quene</p>
<p>Of al the lond the sonne on shyneth shene.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1240</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">178. But with this selve swerd, which that here is,</p>
<p>My-selve I wolde have <a href="#TIVNL1241" id="TIVL1241" class="pginternal">slayn</a>!'—quod she tho;</p>
<p>'But <a href="#TIVNL1242" id="TIVL1242" class="pginternal">ho</a>, for we han right y-now of this,</p>
<p>And late us ryse and streight to bedde go;</p>
<p>And <a href="#TIVNL1244" id="TIVL1244" class="pginternal">therë</a> lat vs speken of our wo.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1245</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For, by the <a href="#TIVNL1245" id="TIVL1245" class="pginternal">morter</a> which that I see
    brenne,</p>
<p>Knowe I ful wel that day is not fer henne.'</p>
<p class="stanza">179. Whan they were in hir bedde, in armes folde,</p>
<p>Nought was it lyk tho nightes here-biforn;</p>
<p>For pitously ech other gan biholde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1250</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">As they that hadden al hir blisse y-lorn,</p>
<p>Biwaylinge ay the day that they were born.</p>
<p>Til at the last this sorwful wight Criseyde</p>
<p>To Troilus these ilke wordes seyde:—</p>
<p class="stanza">180. 'Lo, herte myn, wel wot ye this,' quod she,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1255</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">'That if a wight alwey his wo compleyne,</p>
<p>And seketh nought how holpen for to be,</p>
<p>It nis but folye and encrees of peyne;</p>
<p>And sin that here assembled be we tweyne</p>
<p>To finde bote of wo that we ben inne,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1260</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">It were al tyme sone to biginne.</p>
<p class="stanza">181. I am a womman, as ful wel ye woot,</p>
<p>And as I am avysed sodeynly,</p>
<p>So wol I telle yow, whyl it is hoot.</p>
<p>Me thinketh thus, that neither ye nor I</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1265</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Oughte half this wo to make skilfully.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page343">{343}</span>For there is art y-now for to redresse</p>
<p>That yet is mis, and sleen this hevinesse.</p>
<p class="stanza">182. Sooth is, the wo, the whiche that we ben inne,</p>
<p>For ought I woot, for no-thing elles is</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1270</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But for the cause that we sholden twinne.</p>
<p>Considered al, ther nis no-more amis.</p>
<p>But what is thanne a remede un-to this,</p>
<p>But that we shape us sone for to mete?</p>
<p>This al and som, my dere herte swete.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1275</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">183. Now that I shal wel bringen it aboute</p>
<p>To come ayein, sone after that I go,</p>
<p>Ther-of am I no maner thing in doute.</p>
<p>For dredeles, with-inne a wouke or two,</p>
<p>I shal ben here; and, that it may be so</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1280</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">By alle right, and in a wordes fewe,</p>
<p>I shal yow wel an heep of weyes shewe.</p>
<p class="stanza">184. For which I wol not make long sermoun,</p>
<p>For tyme y-lost may not recovered be;</p>
<p>But I wol gon to my conclusioun,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1285</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And to the beste, in ought that I can see.</p>
<p>And, for the love of god, for-yeve it me</p>
<p>If I speke ought ayein your hertes reste;</p>
<p>For trewely, I speke it for the beste;</p>
<p class="stanza">185. Makinge alwey a protestacioun,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1290</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That now these wordes, whiche that I shal seye,</p>
<p>Nis but to shewe yow my mocioun,</p>
<p>To finde un-to our helpe the beste weye;</p>
<p>And taketh it non other wyse, I preye.</p>
<p>For in effect what-so ye me comaunde,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1295</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That wol I doon, for that <a href="#TIVNL1295" id="TIVL1295" class="pginternal">is no
    demaunde</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page344">{344}</span>186. Now herkeneth this, ye han
    wel understonde,</p>
<p>My goinge graunted is by parlement</p>
<p>So ferforth, that it may not be with-stonde</p>
<p>For al this world, as by my Iugement.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1300</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And sin ther helpeth noon avysement</p>
<p>To letten it, lat it passe out of minde;</p>
<p>And lat us shape a bettre wey to finde.</p>
<p class="stanza">187. The sothe is, that the twinninge of us tweyne</p>
<p>Wol us disese and cruelliche anoye.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1305</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But him bihoveth som-tyme han a peyne,</p>
<p>That serveth love, if that he wol have Ioye.</p>
<p>And sin I shal no ferthere out of Troye</p>
<p>Than I may ryde ayein on half a morwe,</p>
<p>It oughte lasse causen us to sorwe.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1310</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">188. So as I shal not so ben hid in muwe,</p>
<p>That day by day, myn owene herte dere,</p>
<p>Sin wel ye woot that it is now a truwe,</p>
<p>Ye shul ful wel al myn estat y-here.</p>
<p>And er that truwe is doon, I shal ben here,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1315</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And thanne have ye bothe Antenor y-wonne</p>
<p>And me also; beth glad now, if ye conne;</p>
<p class="stanza">189. And thenk right thus, "Criseyde is now agoon,</p>
<p>But what! she shal come hastely ayeyn;"</p>
<p>And whanne, allas? by god, lo, right anoon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1320</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Er dayes ten, this dar I saufly seyn.</p>
<p>And thanne at erste shul we been so fayn,</p>
<p>So as we shulle to-gederes ever dwelle,</p>
<p>Thal al this world ne mighte our blisse telle.</p>
<p class="stanza">190. I see that ofte, ther-as we ben now,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1325</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That for the beste, our conseil for to hyde,</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page345">{345}</span>Ye speke not with me, nor I with yow</p>
<p>In fourtenight; ne see yow go ne ryde.</p>
<p>May ye not ten dayes thanne abyde,</p>
<p>For myn honour, in swich an aventure?</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1330</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Y-wis, ye mowen elles lite endure!</p>
<p class="stanza">191. Ye knowe eek how that al my kin is here,</p>
<p>But-if that onliche it my fader be;</p>
<p>And eek myn othere thinges alle y-fere,</p>
<p>And nameliche, my dere herte, ye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1335</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Whom that I nolde leven for to see</p>
<p>For al this world, as wyd as it hath space;</p>
<p>Or elles, see ich never Ioves face!</p>
<p class="stanza">192. Why trowe ye my fader in this wyse</p>
<p>Coveiteth so to see me, but for drede</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1340</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Lest in this toun that folkes me dispyse</p>
<p>By-cause of him, for his unhappy dede?</p>
<p>What woot my fader what lyf that I lede?</p>
<p>For if he wiste in Troye how wel I fare,</p>
<p>Us neded for my wending nought to care.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1345</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">193. Ye seen that every day eek, more and more,</p>
<p>Men trete of pees; and it supposed is,</p>
<p>That men the quene Eleyne shal restore,</p>
<p>And Grekes us restore that is mis.</p>
<p>So though ther nere comfort noon but this,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1350</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That men purposen pees on every syde,</p>
<p>Ye may the bettre at ese of herte abyde.</p>
<p class="stanza">194. For if that it be pees, myn herte dere,</p>
<p>The nature of the pees mot nedes dryve</p>
<p>That men moste entrecomunen y-fere,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1355</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And to and fro eek ryde and gon as blyve</p>
<p>Alday as thikke as been flen from an hyve;</p>
<p>And every wight han libertee to bleve</p>
<p>Wher-as him list the bet, with-outen leve.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page346">{346}</span>195. And though so be that pees
    ther may be noon,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1360</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Yet hider, though ther never pees ne were,</p>
<p>I moste come; for whider sholde I goon,</p>
<p>Or how mischaunce sholde I dwelle there</p>
<p>Among tho men of armes ever in fere?</p>
<p>For which, as wisly god my soule rede,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1365</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I can not seen wher-of ye sholden drede.</p>
<p class="stanza">196. Have here another wey, if it so be</p>
<p>That al this thing ne may yow not suffyse.</p>
<p>My fader, as ye knowen wel, pardee,</p>
<p>Is old, and elde is ful of coveityse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1370</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And I right now have founden al the gyse,</p>
<p>With-oute net, wher-with I shal him hente;</p>
<p>And herkeneth how, if that ye wole assente.</p>
<p class="stanza">197. Lo, Troilus, men seyn that hard it is</p>
<p>The wolf ful, and the <a href="#TIVNL1374" id="TIVL1374" class="pginternal">wether</a> hool to have;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1375</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">This is to seyn, that men ful ofte, y-wis,</p>
<p>Mot spenden part, the remenaunt for to save.</p>
<p>For ay with gold men may the herte <a href="#TIVNL1377" id="TIVL1377" class="pginternal">grave</a></p>
<p>Of him that set is up-on coveityse;</p>
<p>And how I mene, I shal it yow devyse.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1380</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">198. The <a href="#TIVNL1380" id="TIVL1380" class="pginternal">moeble</a> which that I have
    in this toun</p>
<p>Un-to my fader shal I take, and seye,</p>
<p>That right for trust and for savacioun</p>
<p>It sent is from a freend of his or tweye,</p>
<p>The whiche freendes ferventliche him preye</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1385</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To senden after more, and that in hye,</p>
<p>Whyl that this toun stant thus in Iupartye.</p>
<p class="stanza">199. And that shal been an huge quantitee,</p>
<p>Thus shal I seyn, but, lest it folk aspyde,</p>
<p>This may be sent by no wight but by me;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1390</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page347">{347}</span>I shal eek shewen him, if pees
    bityde,</p>
<p>What frendes that ich have on every syde</p>
<p>Toward the court, to doon the wrathe pace</p>
<p>Of Priamus, and doon him stonde in grace.</p>
<p class="stanza">200. So, what for o thing and for other, swete,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1395</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">I shal him so enchaunten with my sawes,</p>
<p>That right in hevene his sowle is, shal he mete!</p>
<p>For al Appollo, or his clerkes lawes,</p>
<p>Or calculinge avayleth nought three hawes;</p>
<p>Desyr of gold shal so his sowle blende,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1400</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">That, as me lyst, I shal wel make an ende.</p>
<p class="stanza">201. And if he wolde ought by his sort it preve</p>
<p>If that I lye, in certayn I shal fonde</p>
<p>Distorben him, and plukke him by the sleve,</p>
<p>Makinge his sort, and <a href="#TIVNL1404" id="TIVL1404" class="pginternal">beren him on honde</a>,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1405</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">He hath not wel the goddes understonde.</p>
<p>For goddes speken in <a href="#TIVNL1406" id="TIVL1406" class="pginternal">amphibologyes</a>,</p>
<p>And, for a sooth, they tellen twenty lyes.</p>
<p class="stanza">202. Eek drede fond first goddes, I suppose,</p>
<p>Thus shal I seyn, and that his cowarde herte</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1410</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Made him amis the goddes text to glose,</p>
<p>Whan he for ferde <a href="#TIVNL1411" id="TIVL1411" class="pginternal">out of his Delphos sterte</a>.</p>
<p>And but I make him sone to converte,</p>
<p>And doon my reed with-inne a day or tweye,</p>
<p>I wol to yow oblige me to deye.'</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1415</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">203. And treweliche, as writen wel I finde,</p>
<p>That al this thing was seyd of good entente;</p>
<p>And that hir herte trewe was and kinde</p>
<p>Towardes him, and spak right as she mente,</p>
<p>And that she starf for wo neigh, whan she wente,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1420</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page348">{348}</span>And was in purpos ever to be
    trewe;</p>
<p>Thus writen they that of hir werkes knewe.</p>
<p class="stanza">204. This Troilus, with herte and eres <a href="#TIVNL1422" id="TIVL1422" class="pginternal">spradde</a>,</p>
<p>Herde al this thing devysen to and fro;</p>
<p>And verraylich him semed that he hadde</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1425</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><a href="#TIVNL1425" id="TIVL1425" class="pginternal">The selve wit</a>; but yet to lete hir
    go</p>
<p>His herte misforyaf him ever-mo.</p>
<p>But fynally, he gan his herte wreste</p>
<p>To trusten hir, and took it for the beste.</p>
<p class="stanza">205. For which the grete furie of his penaunce</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1430</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Was queynt with hope, and ther-with hem bitwene</p>
<p>Bigan for Ioye the amorouse daunce.</p>
<p>And as the briddes, whan the sonne is shene,</p>
<p>Delyten in hir song in leves grene,</p>
<p>Right so the wordes that they spake y-fere</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1435</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Delyted hem, and made hir hertes <a href="#TIVNL1435" id="TIVL1435" class="pginternal">clere</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">206. But natheles, the wending of Criseyde,</p>
<p>For al this world, may nought out of his minde;</p>
<p>For which ful ofte he pitously hir preyde,</p>
<p>That of hir heste he might hir trewe finde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1440</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And seyde hir, 'certes, if ye be unkinde,</p>
<p>And but ye come at day set in-to Troye,</p>
<p>Ne shal I never have hele, honour, ne Ioye.</p>
<p class="stanza">207. For al-so sooth as sonne up-rist on morwe,</p>
<p>And, god! so wisly thou me, woful wrecche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1445</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To reste bringe out of this cruel sorwe,</p>
<p>I wol my-selven slee if that ye drecche.</p>
<p>But of my deeth though litel be to recche,</p>
<p>Yet, er that ye me cause so to smerte,</p>
<p>Dwel rather here, myn owene swete herte!</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1450</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">208. For trewely, myn owene lady dere,</p>
<p>Tho sleightes yet that I have herd yow stere</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page349">{349}</span>Ful shaply been to failen alle y-fere.</p>
<p>For thus men seyn, "that <a href="#TIVNL1453" id="TIVL1453" class="pginternal">oon thenketh the bere</a>,</p>
<p>But al another thenketh his ledere."</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1455</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Your sire is wys, and seyd is, out of drede,</p>
<p><a href="#TIVNL1456" id="TIVL1456" class="pginternal">"Men may the wyse at-renne, and not at-rede."</a></p>
<p class="stanza">209. It is ful hard to halten unespyed</p>
<p>Bifore a crepul, for he can the craft;</p>
<p>Your fader is in sleighte <a href="#TIVNL1459" id="TIVL1459" class="pginternal">as Argus yëd</a>;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1460</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For al be that his moeble is him biraft,</p>
<p>His olde sleighte is yet so with him laft,</p>
<p>Ye shal not blende him for your womanhede,</p>
<p>Ne feyne a-right, and that is al my drede.</p>
<p class="stanza">210. I noot if pees shal ever-mo bityde;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1465</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">But, pees or no, for ernest ne for game,</p>
<p>I woot, sin Calkas on the Grekes syde</p>
<p>Hath ones been, and lost so foule his name,</p>
<p>He dar no more come here ayein for shame;</p>
<p>For which that weye, for ought I can espye,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1470</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">To trusten on, nis but a fantasye.</p>
<p class="stanza">211. Ye shal eek seen, your fader shal yow glose</p>
<p>To been a wyf, and as he can wel preche,</p>
<p>He shal som Grek so preyse and wel alose,</p>
<p>That ravisshen he shal yow with his speche,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1475</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or do yow doon by force as he shal teche.</p>
<p>And Troilus, of whom ye nil han routhe,</p>
<p>Shal causeles so sterven in his trouthe!</p>
<p class="stanza">212. And over al this, your fader shal despyse</p>
<p>Us alle, and seyn this citee nis but lorn;</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1480</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And that thassege never shal aryse,</p>
<p>For-why the Grekes han it alle sworn</p>
<p>Til we be slayn, and doun our walles torn.</p>
<p><span class="pagenum" id="page350">{350}</span>And thus he shal you with his wordes <a href="#TIVNL1483" id="TIVL1483" class="pginternal">fere</a>,</p>
<p>That ay drede I, that ye wol bleve there.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1485</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">213. Ye shul eek seen so many a lusty knight</p>
<p>A-mong the Grekes, ful of worthinesse,</p>
<p>And eche of hem with herte, wit, and might</p>
<p>To plesen yow don al his besinesse,</p>
<p>That ye shul dullen of the rudenesse</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1490</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Of us sely Troianes, but-if routhe</p>
<p>Remorde yow, or vertue of your trouthe.</p>
<p class="stanza">214. And this to me so grevous is to thinke,</p>
<p>That fro my brest it wol my soule rende;</p>
<p>Ne dredeles, in me ther may not sinke</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1495</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A good opinioun, if that ye wende;</p>
<p>For-why your faderes sleighte wol us shende.</p>
<p>And if ye goon, as I have told yow yore,</p>
<p>So thenk I nam but deed, with-oute more.</p>
<p class="stanza">215. For which, with humble, trewe, and pitous herte,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1500</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">A thousand tymes mercy I yow preye;</p>
<p>So reweth on myn aspre peynes smerte,</p>
<p>And doth somwhat, as that I shal yow seye,</p>
<p>And lat us stele away bitwixe us tweye;</p>
<p>And thenk that folye is, whan man may chese,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1505</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">For accident <a href="#TIVNL1505" id="TIVL1505" class="pginternal">his substaunce ay to
    lese</a>.</p>
<p class="stanza">216. I mene this, that sin we mowe er day</p>
<p>Wel stele away, and been to-gider so,</p>
<p>What wit were it to putten in assay,</p>
<p>In cas ye sholden to your fader go,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1510</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">If that ye mighte come ayein or no?</p>
<p>Thus mene I, that it were a gret folye</p>
<p>To putte that sikernesse in Iupartye.</p>
<p class="stanza"><span class="pagenum" id="page351">{351}</span>217. And vulgarly to speken of
    substaunce</p>
<p>Of tresour, may we bothe with us lede</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1515</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Y-nough to live in honour and plesaunce,</p>
<p>Til in-to tyme that we shul ben dede;</p>
<p>And thus we may eschewen al this drede.</p>
<p>For everich other wey ye can recorde,</p>
<p>Myn herte, y-wis, may not ther-with acorde.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35 stanza">1520</div>
</div>
<p class="stanza lined">218. And hardily, ne dredeth no poverte,</p>
<p>For I have kin and freendes elles-where</p>
<p>That, though we comen in our bare sherte,</p>
<p>Us sholde neither lakke gold ne gere,</p>
<p>But been honoured whyl we dwelten there.</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1525</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And <a href="#TIVNL1525" id="TIVL1525" class="pginternal">go we</a> anoon, for, as in myn
    entente,</p>
<p>This is the beste, if that ye wole assente.'</p>
<p class="stanza">219. Criseyde, with a syk, right in this wyse</p>
<p>Answerde, 'y-wis, my dere herte trewe,</p>
<p>We may wel stele away, as ye devyse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1530</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">And finde swiche unthrifty weyes newe;</p>
<p>But afterward, ful sore it wol us rewe.</p>
<p>And help me god so at my moste nede</p>
<p>As causeles ye suffren al this drede!</p>
<p class="stanza">220. For thilke day that I for cherisshinge</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1535</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Or drede of fader, or of other wight,</p>
<p>Or for estat, delyt, or for weddinge</p>
<p>Be fals to yow, my Troilus, my knight,</p>
<p>Saturnes doughter, <a href="#TIVNL1538" id="TIVL1538" class="pginternal">Iuno</a>, thorugh hir might,</p>
<p>As wood as Athamante do me dwelle</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1540</div>
</div>
<p class="lined">Eternaly in Stix, the put of helle!</p>
<p class="stanza">221. And this on every god celestial</p>
<p>I swere it yow, and eek on eche goddesse,</p>
<p>On every Nymphe and deite infernal,</p>
<p>On <a href="#TIVNL1544" id="TIVL1544" class="pginternal">Satiry and Fauny</a> more and lesse,</p>
<div class="rel">
<div class="linenum35">1545</div>
</div>
<p class="lined"><span class="pagenum" id="page352">{352}</span>That halve goddes been of
    wildernesse;</p>
<p>And Attropos my threed of lyf to-breste</p>
<p>If I be fals; now trowe me if thow leste!</p>
<p class="stanza">222. And thou, <a href="#TIVNL1548" id="TIVL1548" class="pginternal">Simoys</a>, that as an arwe
    clere</p>
<p>Thorugh Troye rennest ay downward to the see,</p>
